translated: There are beings who have this view.

original: Evaṁsaññīnampi kho, bhikkhave, sattānaṁ attheva aññathattaṁ atthi vipariṇāmo.
analyzed: evasaññīnam pi kho bhikkhave sattānam attha iva aññathattam atthi vipariṇāmaḥ
translated: But even for those beings who have this view, there is still change and alteration.

original: Evaṁ passaṁ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako tasmimpi nibbindati.
analyzed: evam passa bhikkhave sutavā ariya sāvako tasmim pi nibbindati
translated: Seeing this, the instructed disciple of the noble ones grows disenchanted with that view,

original: Tasmiṁ nibbindanto agge virajjati, pageva hīnasmiṁ.
analyzed: tasmin nibbindantaḥ agge virajjati pagā iva
translated: and through disenchantment, he becomes dispassionate.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, bāhirakānaṁ diṭṭhigatānaṁ yadidaṁ ‘no cassaṁ, no ca me siyā, na bhavissāmi, na me bhavissatī’ti.🔽Evaṁdiṭṭhino, bhikkhave, etaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ:🔽‘yā cāyaṁ bhave appaṭikulyatā, sā cassa na bhavissati;
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave bāhirakānam diṭṭhi gatānam yat idam no ca assa no ca me siyā na bhavissāmi na me bhavissati iti  evadiṭṭhinaḥ bhikkhave etam pāṭikaṅkha  yā ca ayam bhave appaṭikulya tā sā ca ssa na bhavissati
translated: This is the best of the external doctrines of nothingness, namely: ‘I was not, and now I am; I was not, and now I am not; I will not be, and I will not not be.’🔽It can be expected of one who has this view that he will not give up this view.🔽He will not give up the aversion that he has for becoming,

original: yā cāyaṁ bhavanirodhe pāṭikulyatā, sā cassa na bhavissatī’ti.🔽Evaṁdiṭṭhinopi kho, bhikkhave, santi sattā.
analyzed: yā ca ayam bhava nirodhe pāṭikulya tā sā ca ssa na bhavissati iti  eva diṭṭhinaḥ api kho bhikkhave santi sattā
translated: and he will not give up the aversion that he has for the cessation of becoming.🔽There are beings who have this view.

original: Evaṁdiṭṭhīnampi kho, bhikkhave, sattānaṁ attheva aññathattaṁ atthi vipariṇāmo.
analyzed: eva diṭṭhīnam pi kho bhikkhave sattānam attha iva aññathattam atthi vipariṇāmaḥ
translated: But even for those beings who have this view, there is still change and alteration.

original: Evaṁ passaṁ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako tasmimpi nibbindati.
analyzed: evam passa bhikkhave sutavā ariya sāvako tasmim pi nibbindati
translated: Seeing thus, bhikkhus, the instructed noble disciple experiences revulsion towards the eye, the ear, the nose, the tongue, the body, and the mind.

original: Tasmiṁ nibbindanto agge virajjati, pageva hīnasmiṁ.
analyzed: tasmin nibbindantaḥ agge virajjati pagā iva
translated: Experiencing revulsion, he becomes dispassionate.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā paramatthavisuddhiṁ paññāpenti.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā paramattha visuddhim paññāpenti
translated: “There are, bhikkhus, some recluses and brahmins who proclaim a doctrine of completeness, of fulfilling the spiritual life, and who proclaim the immediate destruction of the taints.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, paramatthavisuddhiṁ paññapentānaṁ yadidaṁ sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: etad agga bhikkhave paramattha visuddhim paññapentānam yat idam sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanam samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam upasampajja viharati
translated: This is the best of their doctrines of completeness, namely, that on the complete surmounting of perceptions of form, with the disappearance of perceptions of sensory impact, with non-attention to perceptions of diversity, aware of ‘space is infinite,’ a bhikkhu enters and dwells in the base of the infinity of space.

original: Te tadabhiññāya tassa sacchikiriyāya dhammaṁ desenti.
analyzed: te tat abhiññāya tassa sacchikiriyāya dhammaṃ desenti
translated: They teach the Dhamma for the immediate destruction of the taints.

original: Evaṁvādinopi kho, bhikkhave, santi sattā.
analyzed: eva vādinaḥ api kho bhikkhave santi sattā
translated: There are, bhikkhus, beings who have such a nature that…

original: Evaṁvādīnampi kho, bhikkhave, sattānaṁ attheva aññathattaṁ atthi vipariṇāmo.🔽Evaṁ passaṁ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako tasmimpi nibbindati.
analyzed: eva vādīnam pi kho bhikkhave sattānam attha iva aññathattam atthi vipariṇāmaḥ  evam passa bhikkhave sutavā ariya sāvako tasmim pi nibbindati
translated: But even in those beings who have such a nature, there is change in the material and immaterial things that pertain to their selfhood.🔽Seeing thus, bhikkhus, the instructed noble disciple experiences revulsion towards the eye, the ear, the nose, the tongue, the body, and the mind.

original: Tasmiṁ nibbindanto agge virajjati, pageva hīnasmiṁ.
analyzed: tasmin nibbindantaḥ agge virajjati pagā iva
translated: Experiencing revulsion, he becomes dispassionate.

original: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ paññāpenti.
analyzed: santi bhikkhave eke samaṇa brāhmaṇā parama diṭṭhadhamma nibbānam paññāpenti
translated: “There are, bhikkhus, some recluses and brahmins who proclaim a doctrine of completeness, of fulfilling the spiritual life, in this very life here and now.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ paññapentānaṁ yadidaṁ channaṁ phassāyatanānaṁ
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave parama diṭṭhadhamma nibbānam paññapentānam yat idam channam
translated: “The best of those who proclaim a mundane supreme attainment are the ones who proclaim the cessation of the six bases of contact.

original: samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ viditvā anupādā vimokkho.🔽Evaṁvādiṁ kho maṁ, bhikkhave, evamakkhāyiṁ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhanti:
analyzed: samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtam viditvā anupādā vimokkhaḥ  eva vādim kho ma bhikkhave evam akkhāyim eke samaṇa brāhmaṇāḥ asatā tucchā musā a bhūtena abbhācikkhanti
translated: “The best of those who proclaim a supreme emancipation in the here-&-now is this: one who, having directly known the origination of the six spheres of contact as they really are, their passing away as they really are, their satisfaction as it really is, their danger as it really is, and their escape as it really is, is released without grasping.🔽“Monks, when I am described by certain contemplatives & brahmans as ‘not a speaker of non-causality, not a speaker of non-opportuneness, not a speaker of that which is not the case, not a speaker of what has not been experienced by higher knowledge,’

original: ‘samaṇo gotamo na kāmānaṁ pariññaṁ paññāpeti, na rūpānaṁ pariññaṁ paññāpeti, na vedanānaṁ pariññaṁ paññāpetī’ti.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ na kāmānam pariññam paññāpeti na rūpānam pariññam paññāpeti na vedanānam pariññam paññāpeti iti
translated: they describe me falsely, wrongly, mistakenly, inaccurately, un-understandably, unjustifiably, and groundlessly.

original: Kāmānañcāhaṁ, bhikkhave, pariññaṁ paññāpemi, rūpānañca pariññaṁ paññāpemi, vedanānañca
analyzed: kāmānam ca āha bhikkhave pariññam paññāpemi rūpānam ca pariññam paññāpemi vedanānam ca
translated: “I, monks, do proclaim the full understanding of sensuality, do proclaim the full understanding of forms, do proclaim the full understanding of feelings.

original: pariññaṁ paññāpemi, diṭṭheva dhamme nicchāto nibbuto sītibhūto anupādā parinibbānaṁ paññāpemī”ti.
analyzed: pariññam paññāpemi diṭṭhe iva dhamme nicchātaḥ nibbutaḥ sīti bhūtaḥ anupādā parinibbānam paññāpemi iti
translated: I do proclaim the supreme state of sublime peace in the here-&-now, the unconditioned, which is free from craving, free from delight, free from bias, free from attachment, free from fixation, free from clinging, free from grasping.”

original: Navamaṁ.
analyzed: navama
translated: The ninth .

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.30
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Tens

original: 3. Mahāvagga
analyzed: mahāvagga
translated: The Greater Division

original: Dutiyakosalasutta
analyzed: dutiya kosala sutta
translated: With the Kosalans (2)

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.🔽Tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo uyyodhikā nivatto hoti vijitasaṅgāmo laddhādhippāyo.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme  tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ uyyodhikā nivattaḥ hoti vijita saṅgāmaḥ laddha adhippāyaḥ
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo yena ārāmo tena pāyāsi.
analyzed: atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ yena tena
translated: On that occasion King Pasenadi of Kosala had returned from a battle in which he had defeated his enemies and achieved his purpose.🔽He then went to the park.

original: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikova ārāmaṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikā uva ārāmam pāvisi
translated: He went by vehicle as far as the ground would allow, then alighted and continued on foot.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū abbhokāse caṅkamanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sambahulāḥ bhikkhū abbhokāse caṅkamanti
translated: At that time a number of monks were walking up and down in the open air.

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ yena te bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etat avoca
translated: King Pasenadi went up to them and asked,

original: “kahaṁ nu kho, bhante, bhagavā etarahi viharati arahaṁ sammāsambuddho.
analyzed: kaham nu kho bhante bhagavā etarahi viharati araham sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: “Venerable sirs, where is the Buddha, the perfected and fully awakened one, at present?

original: Dassanakāmā hi mayaṁ, bhante, taṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhan”ti.
analyzed: dassana kāmāḥ hi bhante tam bhagavantam arahantam sammāsambuddhan ti
translated: We wish to see him.”

original: “Eso, mahārāja, vihāro saṁvutadvāro. Tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno ālindaṁ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṁ ākoṭehi; vivarissati te bhagavā dvāran”ti.🔽Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo yena so vihāro saṁvutadvāro, tena appasaddo upasaṅkamitvā ataramāno ālindaṁ pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷaṁ ākoṭesi. Vivari bhagavā dvāraṁ.
analyzed: esaḥ mahā rāja vihāraḥ savuta dvāro tena appasaddaḥ upasaṅkamitvā a taramānaḥ ālindam pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷam ākoṭehi vivarissati te bhagavā dvāranti  atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ yena saḥ vihāraḥ savuta dvāro tena appasaddaḥ upasaṅkamitvā a taramānaḥ ālindam pavisitvā ukkāsitvā aggaḷam ākoṭesi bhagavā dvāra
translated: “That dwelling, sire, has its door closed. Approach it quietly, without hurrying, enter it noiselessly, clear your throat and knock on the bolt. The Blessed Lord will open the door for you.”🔽Then King Pasenadi went to the dwelling with its closed door, approached it quietly, entered it noiselessly, cleared his throat and knocked on the bolt. The Blessed Lord opened the door.

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo vihāraṁ pavisitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavato pādāni mukhena ca paricumbati pāṇīhi ca parisambāhati nāmañca sāveti:
analyzed: atha khalu rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ vihāram pavisitvā bhagavataḥ pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavataḥ pādāni mukhena ca paricumbati pāṇīhi ca parisambāhati nāman ca sāva iti
translated: Then King Pasenadi entered the dwelling, went up to the Blessed Lord, bowed down to him, and stroked the Blessed Lord’s hands, saying:

original: “rājāhaṁ, bhante, pasenadi kosalo;
analyzed: rājā āha bhante pasenadi kosalo
translated: ‘Lord, I am King Pasenadi of Kosala.

original: rājāhaṁ, bhante, pasenadi kosalo”ti.
analyzed: rājā āha bhante pasenadi kosala iti
translated: Lord, I am King Pasenadi of Kosala.’

original: “Kaṁ pana tvaṁ, mahārāja, atthavasaṁ sampassamāno imasmiṁ sarīre evarūpaṁ paramanipaccakāraṁ karosi, mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsesī”ti?
analyzed: kam pana tva mahā rāja atthavasam sampassamānaḥ imasmin sarīre evarūpam parama nipaccakāram karosi mettūpahāram upadasesi iti
translated: ‘But, sire, why do you show me such great respect, such extraordinary deference?’

original: “Kataññutaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhante, kataveditaṁ sampassamāno bhagavati evarūpaṁ paramanipaccakāraṁ karomi, mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsemi.🔽Bhagavā hi, bhante, bahujanahitāya paṭipanno bahujanasukhāya bahuno janassa ariye ñāye patiṭṭhāpitā yadidaṁ kalyāṇadhammatāya kusaladhammatāya.🔽Yampi, bhante, bhagavā bahujanahitāya paṭipanno bahujanasukhāya bahuno janassa ariye
analyzed: kataññutam kho aha bhante kata veditam sampassamānaḥ bhagavati evarūpam parama nipacca kāram karomi mettūpahāram upadasemi  bhagavā hi bhante bahu jana hitāya paṭipannaḥ bahu jana sukhāya bahunaḥ janassa ariye ñāye patiṭṭhāpitā yat idam kalyāṇa dhamma tāya kusala dhamma tāya  yam pi bhante bhagavā bahu jana hitāya paṭipannaḥ bahu jana sukhāya bahunaḥ janassa ariye
translated: “I do this great service to the Blessed One, I pay homage to him with a lofty homage, seeing the gratitude and thankfulness as the fruit and benefit.🔽For the Blessed One is engaged in the welfare of many people, for the happiness of many people, for the good, welfare, and happiness of devas and human beings.

original: ñāye patiṭṭhāpitā yadidaṁ kalyāṇadhammatāya kusaladhammatāya, idampi kho ahaṁ, bhante,
analyzed: ñāye patiṭṭhāpitā yat idam kalyāṇa dhamma tāya kusala dhamma tāya idam api kho aha bhante
translated: And he has established many people in the noble method, that is, in the goodness of virtue, in the goodness of practice, in the goodness of views, and in the goodness of conduct.

original: atthavasaṁ sampassamāno bhagavati evarūpaṁ paramanipaccakāraṁ karomi, mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsemi.
analyzed: atthavasam sampassamānaḥ bhagavati evarūpam parama nipacca kāram karomi mettūpahāram upadasemi
translated: Seeing this benefit, I do this great service to the Blessed One, I pay homage to him with a lofty homage.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhante, bhagavā sīlavā vuddhasīlo ariyasīlo kusalasīlo kusalasīlena samannāgato.
analyzed: puna capara bhante bhagavā sīlavā vuddha sīlaḥ ariya sīlaḥ kusala sīlo kusala sīlena samannāgato
translated: “Again, the Blessed One is virtuous, of good character, of noble character, of wholesome character, endowed with wholesome character.

original: Yampi, bhante, bhagavā sīlavā vuddhasīlo ariyasīlo kusalasīlo kusalasīlena samannāgato,🔽idampi kho ahaṁ, bhante, atthavasaṁ sampassamāno bhagavati evarūpaṁ paramanipaccakāraṁ
analyzed: yam pi bhante bhagavā sīlavā vuddha sīlaḥ ariya sīlaḥ kusala sīlaḥ kusala sīlena samannāgato  idam api kho aha bhante atthavasam sampassamānaḥ bhagavati evarūpam parama nipaccakāra
translated: In that the Blessed One is virtuous, of good character, of noble character, of wholesome character, possessing wholesome character,

original: karomi, mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsemi.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhante, bhagavā dīgharattaṁ āraññiko, araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevati.
analyzed: karomi mettūpahāram upadasemi  puna capara bhante bhagavā dīgharattam āraññikaḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevati
translated: I do this for the Blessed One, I pay homage to the Blessed One with supreme service, with a supreme offering of loving-kindness.🔽“Again, the Blessed One has long gone forth, long since gone forth into homelessness in this Dhamma and Discipline.

original: Yampi, bhante, bhagavā dīgharattaṁ āraññiko, araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni🔽paṭisevati, idampi kho ahaṁ, bhante, atthavasaṁ sampassamāno bhagavati evarūpaṁ paramanipaccakāraṁ
analyzed: yam pi bhante bhagavā dīgharattam āraññikaḥ arañña vana patthāni pantāni senāsanāni  paṭisevati idam api kho aha bhante atthavasam sampassamānaḥ bhagavati evarūpam parama nipaccakāra
translated: In that the Blessed One has long gone forth, long since gone forth into homelessness in this Dhamma and Discipline,

original: karomi, mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsemi.
analyzed: karomi mettūpahāram upadasemi
translated: I do this for the Blessed One, I pay homage to the Blessed One with supreme service, with a supreme offering of loving-kindness.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhante, bhagavā santuṭṭho itarītaracīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārena.
analyzed: puna capara bhante bhagavā santuṭṭhaḥ itarītara cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhārena
translated: “Again, the Blessed One is content with any kind of almsfood and commends contentment with any kind of almsfood.

original: Yampi, bhante, bhagavā santuṭṭho itarītaracīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārena,🔽idampi kho ahaṁ, bhante, atthavasaṁ sampassamāno bhagavati evarūpaṁ paramanipaccakāraṁ
analyzed: yam pi bhante bhagavā santuṭṭhaḥ itarītara cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhārena  idam api kho aha bhante atthavasam sampassamānaḥ bhagavati evarūpam parama nipaccakāra
translated: And the Blessed One is content with any kind of robe, almsfood, lodging, and medicinal requisites for curing sickness that may be obtained.

original: karomi, mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsemi.
analyzed: karomi mettūpahāram upadasemi
translated: I have seen this second reason for showing supreme appreciation to the Blessed One by way of supreme appreciation and by way of a gift of love.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhante, bhagavā āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassa.🔽Yampi, bhante, bhagavā āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ🔽lokassa, idampi kho ahaṁ, bhante, atthavasaṁ sampassamāno bhagavati evarūpaṁ paramanipaccakāraṁ
analyzed: puna capara bhante bhagavā āhuneyyaḥ pāhuneyyaḥ dakkhiṇeyyaḥ añjali karaṇīyaḥ anuttaram puññakkhettam lokassa  yam pi bhante bhagavā āhuneyyaḥ pāhuneyyaḥ dakkhiṇeyyaḥ añjali karaṇīyaḥ anuttaram puñña kkhetta  lokassa idam api kho aha bhante atthavasam sampassamānaḥ bhagavati evarūpam parama nipaccakāra
translated: “Again, the Blessed One is worthy of gifts, worthy of hospitality, worthy of offerings, worthy of reverential salutation, an unsurpassed field of merit for the world.

original: karomi, mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsemi.
analyzed: karomi mettūpahāram upadasemi
translated: I have seen this third reason for showing supreme appreciation to the Blessed One by way of supreme appreciation and by way of a gift of love.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhante, bhagavā yāyaṁ kathā abhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā
analyzed: puna ca para bhante bhagavā yā ayam kathā abhisallekhikā cetaḥ vivaraṇa sappāyā seyyathida appiccha kathā
translated: “Again, the Blessed One is one who teaches the Dhamma of clear vision,🔽the Dhamma that is free from bondage, the Dhamma that is conducive to awakening, the Dhamma that brings happiness to all persons when it is well penetrated by Dhamma.

original: santuṭṭhikathā pavivekakathā asaṁsaggakathā vīriyārambhakathā sīlakathā samādhikathā🔽paññākathā vimuttikathā vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā, evarūpāya kathāya nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
analyzed: santuṭṭhi kathā paviveka kathā a sasagga kathā vīriya ārambha kathā sīla kathā samādhi kathā  paññā kathā vimutti kathā vimutti ñāṇa dassana kathā evarūpāya kathāya nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī
translated: He is one who gains at will, without trouble or difficulty, the four jhanas that constitute the higher mind and provide a pleasant abiding here and now.🔽He is one who gains at will, without trouble or difficulty, the four formless attainments that constitute the higher mind and provide a pleasant abiding here and now.🔽He is one who gains at will, without trouble or difficulty, the five superknowledges.🔽He is one who recollects his manifold past abodes with their aspects and details.

original: Yampi, bhante, bhagavā yāyaṁ kathā abhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā🔽…pe… vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā, evarūpāya kathāya nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī,
analyzed: yam pi bhante bhagavā yā ayam kathā abhisallekhikā cetaḥ vivaraṇa sappāyā sā iyyathida appiccha kathā  pe vimutti ñāṇa dassana kathā evarūpāya kathāya nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī
translated: He is one who, with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, sees beings passing away and reappearing, inferior and superior, fair and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and he understands how beings pass on according to their actions.🔽He is one who, by realising for himself with direct knowledge, here and now enters upon and abides in the deliverance of mind and deliverance by wisdom that are taintless with the destruction of the taints.🔽He is one who teaches the Dhamma of the arahants, which is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its meaning and its phrasing, and which reveals a holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.

original: idampi kho ahaṁ, bhante, atthavasaṁ sampassamāno bhagavati evarūpaṁ paramanipaccakāraṁ🔽karomi, mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsemi.
analyzed: idam api kho aha bhante atthavasam sampassamānaḥ bhagavati evarūpam parama nipaccakāra  karomi mettūpahāram upadasemi
translated: He is one who, as a guide and leader, teaches the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its meaning and its phrasing, and which reveals a holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.🔽He is one who, as a guide and leader, teaches the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its meaning and its phrasing, and which reveals a holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.🔽He is one who, as a guide and leader, teaches the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its meaning and its phrasing, and which reveals a holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhante, bhagavā catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
analyzed: puna capara bhante bhagavā catunnam jhānānam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānam nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī
translated: He is one who, as a guide and leader, teaches the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its meaning and its phrasing, and which reveals a holy life that is utterly perfect and pure.🔽He is one who, as a guide and leader, teaches the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its meaning and its phrasing, and which reveals a holy

original: Yampi, bhante, bhagavā catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ
analyzed: yam pi bhante bhagavā catunnam jhānānam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānaṃ
translated: And the fact that the Buddha is one who gains at will, without trouble or difficulty,

original: nikāmalābhī akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, idampi kho ahaṁ, bhante, atthavasaṁ sampassamāno
analyzed: nikāma lābhī a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī idam pi kho aha bhante atthavasam sampassamāno
translated: the four jhanas that constitute the higher mind and provide a pleasant abiding here and now,

original: bhagavati evarūpaṁ paramanipaccakāraṁ karomi, mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsemi.
analyzed: bhagavati evarūpam parama nipad cakāram karomi mettūpahāram upadasemi
translated: is another reason I have for respecting and revering him.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhante, bhagavā anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi
analyzed: puna capara bhante bhagavā aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati
translated: “Again, the Buddha recollects his manifold past lives, that is, one birth, two

original: jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo tissopi jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo dasapi jātiyo vīsampi🔽jātiyo tiṁsampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyo jātisatampi jātisahassampi
analyzed: jātim dve api jātiyaḥ tissaḥ api jātiyaḥ catasso api jātiyaḥ pañca api jātiyaḥ dasa api jātiyaḥ vīsam pi  jātiyaḥ tisampi jātiyaḥ cattālīsampi jātiyaḥ paññāsampi jātiyaḥ jāti satampi jāti sahassampi
translated: births, three births, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty,🔽a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand, many eons of cosmic🔽contraction, many eons of cosmic expansion, many eons of cosmic contraction

original: jātisatasahassampi anekepi saṁvaṭṭakappe anekepi vivaṭṭakappe anekepi saṁvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe:
analyzed: jāti sata sahassam pi aneke api savaṭṭa kappe aneke api vivaṭṭa kappe aneke api savaṭṭa vivaṭṭa kappe
translated: and expansion:🔽‘There I had such and such a name, belonged to such and such a clan,

original: ‘amutrāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto,
analyzed: amutra asim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgotto eva vaṇṇo evam āhāro eva sukha dukkha paṭisavedī evam āyu pariyantaḥ
translated: had such and such an appearance. Such and such was my food, such and such my🔽experience of pleasure and pain, such the end of my life.🔽Passing away from that state, I re-arose there. There too I had such and such a🔽name, belonged to such and such a clan, had such and such an appearance. Such🔽and such was my food, such and such my experience of pleasure and pain, such🔽the end of my life. Passing away from that state, I re-arose here.’ Thus he🔽recollects his manifold past lives in their modes and details.

original: so tato cuto amutra udapādiṁ; tatrāpāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī
analyzed: saḥ tatas cutaḥ amutra udapādi tatra apāsim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgottaḥ eva vaṇṇo evam āhāraḥ eva sukha dukkha ppaṭisavedī
translated: I was reborn there with such a name, clan, complexion, food, and remained there for such a long time.

original: evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto idhūpapanno’ti. Iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ🔽pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati.🔽Yampi, bhante, bhagavā anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ
analyzed: evam āyu pariyantaḥ saḥ tatas cutaḥ idhu upapanno ti iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihita  pubbenivāsam anussarati  yam pi bhante bhagavā aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati jāti
translated: Having passed away from there, I was reborn elsewhere. I was reborn there with such a name, clan, complexion, food, and remained there for such a long time. Having passed away from there, I was reborn here.’ Thus with their aspects and particulars he recollects his manifold past abodes.

original: dvepi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, idampi🔽kho ahaṁ, bhante, atthavasaṁ sampassamāno bhagavati evarūpaṁ paramanipaccakāraṁ karomi,
analyzed: dve api jātiyaḥ pe iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati idam pi  kho aha bhante atthavasam sampassamānaḥ bhagavati evarūpam parama nipacca kāram karomi
translated: “And further, the Blessed One recollects his manifold past abodes, that is, one birth, two births, three births, four births, five births, ten births, twenty births, thirty births, forty births, fifty births, a hundred births, a thousand births, a hundred thousand births, many eons of world-dissolution, many eons of world-evolution, many eons of world-dissolution and world-evolution: ‘There I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life-term;🔽and passing away from there, I was reborn elsewhere; and there too I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life-term;🔽and passing away from there, I was reborn here.’ Thus with their aspects and particulars he recollects his manifold past abodes.

original: mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsemi.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhante, bhagavā dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte
analyzed: mettūpahāram  puna capara bhante bhagavā dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte
translated: “I consider this, venerable sir, to be a reason, a cause, and a basis for the performance of energy, that is, the recollection of past lives.🔽“Again, with the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, the Blessed One sees beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and he understands how beings fare in accordance with their kamma thus:

original: passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākammūpage
analyzed: passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage
translated: ‘These beings who engaged in misconduct by body, speech, and mind, who reviled the noble ones, held wrong view, and undertook kamma based on wrong view, with the breakup of the body, after death, have been reborn in a lower realm, in a bad destination, a lower world, a hell.

original: satte pajānāti: ‘ime vata bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā vacīduccaritena
analyzed: satte pajānāti ime vata bhonto sattā kāya duccaritena samannāgatāḥ vacī duccaritena
translated: He understands what kind of person will reappear after death: ‘This person, on the dissolution of the body, after death, will reappear in a happy destination, in the heavenly world,’ or ‘This person, on the dissolution of the body, after death, will reappear in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, in hell.’

original: samannāgatā manoduccaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ upavādakā micchādiṭṭhikā micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā,
analyzed: samannāgatāḥ manaḥ duccaritena samannāgatāḥ ariyānam upavādakāḥ micchādiṭṭhikāḥ micchādiṭṭhi kamma samādānāḥ
translated: Thus with his mind, thus concentrated, purified, bright, unblemished, rid of defilement, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directs and inclines it to knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapannā; ime vā🔽pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena🔽samannāgatā ariyānaṁ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā, te kāyassa🔽bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā’ti, iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena
analyzed: te kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapannāḥ ime vā  pana bhonto sattā kāya su caritena samannāgatāḥ vacī su caritena samannāgatāḥ manaḥ su caritena  samannāgatāḥ ariyānam an upavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhi kamma samādānā te kāyassa  bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā ati iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena
translated: He understands as it really is: ‘This is suffering’; he understands as it really is: ‘This is the origin of suffering’; he understands as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering’; he understands as it really is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’🔽He understands as it really is: ‘These are the taints’; he understands as it really is: ‘This is the origin of the taints’; he understands as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of the taints’; he understands as it really is: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of the taints.’

original: atikkantamānusakena satte passati …pe… yathākammūpage satte pajānāti.
analyzed: atikkanta mānusakena satte passati pe yathākammūpage satte pajānāti
translated: Translation: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāti.

original: Yampi, bhante, bhagavā dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena …pe… yathākammūpage
analyzed: yam pi bhante bhagavā dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena pe yathākammūpage
translated: Yampi, bhante, bhagavā dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena …pe… yathākammūpage satte pajānāti, idampi kho ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavati dhammaṁ sampassamāno evaṁ vadāmi:

original: satte pajānāti, idampi kho ahaṁ, bhante, atthavasaṁ sampassamāno bhagavati evarūpaṁ
analyzed: satte pajānāti idam api kho aha bhante atthavasam sampassamānaḥ bhagavati evarūpa
translated: he knows beings, this too I have understood to be a reason for the Fortunate One’s claim to greatness.

original: paramanipaccakāraṁ karomi, mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsemi.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhante, bhagavā āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.🔽Yampi, bhante, bhagavā āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ …pe… sacchikatvā upasampajja
analyzed: parama nipad cakāram karomi mettūpahāram upadasemi  puna capara bhante bhagavā āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati  yam pi bhante bhagavā āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim pe sacchikatvā upasampajja
translated: I see this as a reason to do so.

original: viharati, idampi kho ahaṁ, bhante, atthavasaṁ sampassamāno bhagavati evarūpaṁ paramanipaccakāraṁ
analyzed: viharati idam api kho aha bhante atthavasam sampassamānaḥ bhagavati evarūpam parama nipaccakāra
translated: Again, the Blessed One, with the destruction of the taints, has realized for himself with direct knowledge, in this very life, the taintless liberation of mind, liberation by wisdom, and having entered upon it, he dwells in it.

original: karomi, mettūpahāraṁ upadaṁsemi.
analyzed: karomi mettūpahāram upadasemi
translated: I see this as a reason to do so.

original: Handa ca dāni mayaṁ, bhante, gacchāma.
analyzed: handa ca dāni maya bhante gacchāma
translated: Now, venerable sir, we depart.

original: Bahukiccā mayaṁ bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: bahu kitcā mayam bahu karaṇīyā ati
translated: We are busy and have much to do.”

original: “Yassadāni tvaṁ, mahārāja, kālaṁ maññasī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni tva mahā rāja kālam maññasi iti
translated: “Now is the time, great king, to do as you think fit.”

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmīti.
analyzed: atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi iti
translated: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

original: Dasamaṁ.🔽Mahāvaggo tatiyo.
analyzed: dasama  mahāvaggo tatiyaḥ
translated: The tenth.

original: Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: tassa uddāna
translated: The third sub-chapter on the Great Disciples is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Sīhādhivutti kāyena,
analyzed: sīha adhivutti kāyena
translated: Lion, and the one on the lion’s way, with body,

original: cundena kasiṇena ca;
analyzed: cundena kasiṇena ca
translated: and with Cunda, and with the kasiṇa,

original: Kāḷī ca dve mahāpañhā,
analyzed: kāḷī ca dve mahā pañhā
translated: and with Kali, and with the two great knowledges,

original: kosalehi pare duveti.
analyzed: kosalehi pare
translated: and with Kosala, and with the other two.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.31
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Numerical Discourses of the Buddha are complete.

original: 4. Upālivagga
analyzed: upāli vagga
translated: The Group of Discourses with Upāli

original: Upālisutta
analyzed: upāli sutta
translated: With Upāli

original: Atha kho āyasmā upāli yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā upāli bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai upāli yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmai upāli bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then Venerable Upāli went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: “kati nu kho, bhante, atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññattaṁ, pātimokkhaṁ uddiṭṭhan”ti?
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante attha vase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññatta pātimokkham uddiṭṭhanti
translated: “Sir, for how many reasons did the Buddha lay down the training rules for his disciples and recite the Monastic Code?”

original: “Dasa kho, upāli, atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññattaṁ, pātimokkhaṁ uddiṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: dasa kho upāli attha vase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññatta pātimokkham uddiṭṭha
translated: “Upāli, the Buddha laid down the training rules for his disciples and recited the Monastic Code for ten reasons.

original: Katame dasa?
analyzed: katame dasa
translated: What are the ten?

original: Saṅghasuṭṭhutāya, saṅghaphāsutāya, dummaṅkūnaṁ puggalānaṁ niggahāya, pesalānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ🔽phāsuvihārāya, diṭṭhadhammikānaṁ āsavānaṁ saṁvarāya, samparāyikānaṁ āsavānaṁ paṭighātāya,
analyzed: saṅgha suṭṭhu tāya saṅgha phāsu tāya dummaṅkūnam puggalānam niggahāya pesalānam bhikkhūnam  phāsu vihārāya diṭṭhadhammikānam āsavānam savarāya samparāyikānam āsavānam paṭighātāya
translated: for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of corruptions relating to future lives,

original: appasannānaṁ pasādāya, pasannānaṁ bhiyyobhāvāya, saddhammaṭṭhitiyā, vinayānuggahāya—
analyzed: appasannānam pasādāya pasannānam bhiyyobhāvāya saddhamma ṭṭhitiyā vinaya anuggahāya
translated: for the confidence of those without it, for the increase in confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

original: ime kho, upāli, dasa atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññattaṁ, pātimokkhaṁ uddiṭṭhan”ti.
analyzed: ime kho upāli dasa attha vase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānam sikkhāpadam paññatta pātimokkham uddiṭṭhanti
translated: It’s because of these ten reasons that the Buddha laid down the training rules for his disciples and recited the Monastic Code.”

original: Paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: paṭhama
translated: The first section for recitation on Upāli is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.32
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Collection of Long Sayings is finished.

original: 4. Upālivagga
analyzed: upāli vagga
translated: The Group of Discourses on Upāli

original: Pātimokkhaṭṭhapanāsutta
analyzed: pātimokkha ṭṭhapanā sutta
translated: The canceling of the Monastic Code

original: “Kati nu kho, bhante, pātimokkhaṭṭhapanā”ti?
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante pātimokkha ṭṭhapanā ti
translated: “Sir, how many reasons are there for canceling the Monastic Code?”

original: “Dasa kho, upāli, pātimokkhaṭṭhapanā.
analyzed: dasa kho upāli pātimokkha ṭṭhapanā
translated: “There are ten reasons for canceling the Monastic Code.

original: Katame dasa?
analyzed: katame dasa
translated: What are the ten?

original: Pārājiko tassaṁ parisāyaṁ nisinno hoti, pārājikakathā vippakatā hoti, anupasampanno
analyzed: pārājikaḥ tassam parisāyam nisinnaḥ hoti pārājika kathā vippakatā hoti an upasampannaḥ
translated: A person who’s been ejected from the community is present, and the discussion is about the ejection. An unaccepted person is present, and the discussion is about the unaccepted. A person who’s renounced the training is present, and the discussion is about the renunciation of the training. A person who’s committed the worst kind of offense is present, and the discussion is about the worst kind of offense. A person who’s insane is present, and the discussion is about the insane. A person who’s deranged is present, and the discussion is about the deranged. A person who’s overwhelmed by pain is present, and the discussion is about the person overwhelmed by pain. A person who’s a paṇḍaka is present, and the discussion is about the paṇḍakas. A person who’s living in the community by theft is present, and the discussion is about those living in the community by theft. A person who’s previously married to a woman is present, and the discussion is about those previously married to a woman.

original: tassaṁ parisāyaṁ nisinno hoti, anupasampannakathā vippakatā hoti, sikkhaṁ paccakkhātako
analyzed: parisāyam nisinnaḥ hoti an upasampanna kathā vippakatā hoti sikkham paccakkhātako
translated: a person who has renounced the training is sitting in the gathering, and the discussion has moved on from the topic of people who have renounced the training;

original: tassaṁ parisāyaṁ nisinno hoti, sikkhaṁ paccakkhātakakathā vippakatā hoti, paṇḍako🔽tassaṁ parisāyaṁ nisinno hoti, paṇḍakakathā vippakatā hoti, bhikkhunidūsako tassaṁ
analyzed: parisāyam nisinnaḥ hoti sikkham paccakkhātaka kathā vippakatā hoti paṇḍako  parisāyam nisinnaḥ hoti paṇḍaka kathā vippakatā hoti bhikkhu nidūsakaḥ tassa
translated: a paṇḍaka is sitting in the gathering, and the discussion has moved on from the topic of paṇḍakas;

original: parisāyaṁ nisinno hoti, bhikkhunidūsakakathā vippakatā hoti—
analyzed: parisāyam nisinnaḥ hoti bhikkhu nidūsaka kathā vippakatā hoti
translated: a molester of a nun is sitting in the gathering, and the discussion has moved on from the topic of molesters of nuns.

original: ime kho, upāli, dasa pātimokkhaṭṭhapanā”ti.🔽Dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ime kho upāli dasa pātimokkhaṭṭhapanā ati  dutiya
translated: These are the ten reasons for lifting a legal procedure of suspension.”🔽The second section for recitation on Upāli is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.33
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Anguttara Nikāya in number.

original: 4. Upālivagga
analyzed: upāli vagga
translated: The Upāli Group

original: Ubbāhikāsutta
analyzed: ubbāhikā sutta
translated: The committee

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo”ti?
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbaḥ ti
translated: “Sir, when a monk has how many qualities, should he be appointed to a committee?”

original: “Dasahi kho, upāli, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo.
analyzed: dasahi kho upāli dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbaḥ
translated: “When a monk has ten qualities, he should be appointed to a committee:

original: Katamehi dasahi?
analyzed: katamehi dasahi
translated: What are the ten?

original: Idhupāli, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti; pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;
analyzed: idhupāli bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu
translated: Here, Upāli, a monk is virtuous, he dwells restrained with the Pātimokkha restraint, he is endowed with (suitable) conduct and resort, seeing danger in the slightest faults, he trains in the training rules he has undertaken.🔽He is learned, he retains what he has learned, these things that are good, wholesome, and/or lead to the end of the (cycle of) existence,

original: bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā
analyzed: bahu sutaḥ hoti suta dharaḥ suta sannicayaḥ ye te dhammā ādi kalyāṇā majjhe kalyāṇā pariyosāna kalyāṇā
translated: he has learned much, he has retained what he has learned, he has understood what he has learned in the sense, and the well proclaimed (teachings) that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end,

original: sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ abhivadanti, tathārūpāssa
analyzed: sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam abhivadanti tathārūpāḥ sa
translated: with their own meaning, their own phrasing, and their own full perfection, he has understood these teachings,

original: dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā;
analyzed: dhammāḥ bahu ssutāḥ honti dhātā vacasā paricitāḥ manasā anupekkhitāḥ diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā
translated: he has understood them in the sense, he has retained them by the ear, he has understood them well with the mind, he has penetrated them with knowledge, he has seen them well with right wisdom.

original: ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti suvibhattāni suppavattīni suvinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso;
analyzed: ubhayāni kho panassa pātimokkhāni vitthārena svāgatāni honti su vibhattāni suppavattīni su vinicchitāni suttaso anubyañjanaso
translated: Both the Pāṭimokkhas are well-acquired by him in detail, well-classified, well-judged, well-investigated, both in the phrasing and in the sense,

original: vinaye kho pana ṭhito hoti asaṁhīro;
analyzed: vinaye kho pana ṭhitaḥ hoti a sahīraḥ
translated: he is established in the (Vinaya) training, he is not lacking in confidence,🔽he is able to convince, to satisfy, to convince by the Dhamma those who are doubtful,

original: paṭibalo hoti ubho atthapaccatthike saññāpetuṁ paññāpetuṁ nijjhāpetuṁ pekkhetuṁ pasādetuṁ;
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti ubho attha paccatthike saññāpetum paññāpetum nijjhāpetum pekkhetum pasādetu
translated: he is able to make them understand, to make them see, to make them realise, to make them attain, to make them experience, to make them fully understand,

original: adhikaraṇasamuppādavūpasamakusalo hoti—🔽adhikaraṇaṁ jānāti;
analyzed: adhikaraṇa samuppāda vūpasama kusalaḥ hoti  adhikaraṇam jānāti
translated: He’s skilled in the origin and ending of legal issues.🔽He knows legal issues;

original: adhikaraṇasamudayaṁ jānāti;🔽adhikaraṇanirodhaṁ jānāti;
analyzed: adhikaraṇa samudayam jānāti  adhikaraṇa nirodham jānāti
translated: he knows the origin of legal issues;🔽he knows the ending of legal issues;

original: adhikaraṇanirodhagāminiṁ paṭipadaṁ jānāti.
analyzed: adhikaraṇa nirodha gāminim paṭipadam jānāti
translated: he knows the path leading to the ending of legal issues.

original: Imehi kho, upāli, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbo”ti.🔽Tatiyaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.34
analyzed: imehi kho upāli dasahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu ubbāhikāya sammannitabbaḥ ti  tatiya  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: A monk who has these ten qualities may be appointed to a committee.”🔽The third section for recitation is finished.

original: 4. Upālivagga
analyzed: upāli vagga
translated: The Anguttara Nikāya in number.🔽The Upāli Group

original: Upasampadāsutta
analyzed: upasampadā sutta
translated: The full ordination

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabban”ti?🔽“Dasahi kho, upāli, dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbaṁ.
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbanti  dasahi kho upāli dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabba
translated: “Sir, how many qualities should a monk have in order to give the full ordination?”

original: Katamehi dasahi?
analyzed: katamehi dasahi
translated: “He should have ten qualities:

original: Idhupāli, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;
analyzed: idhupāli bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu
translated: He’s virtuous; he’s restrained by the Monastic Code; he’s seen and known by the Sangha as a person who inspires confidence when questioned about the training rules;

original: bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā🔽sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ abhivadanti, tathārūpāssa🔽dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā;
analyzed: bahu sutaḥ hoti suta dharaḥ suta sannicayaḥ ye te dhammā ādi kalyāṇā majjhe kalyāṇā pariyosāna kalyāṇā  sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam abhivadanti tathārūpāḥ sa  dhammāḥ bahu ssutāḥ honti dhātā vacasā paricitāḥ manasā anupekkhitāḥ diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā
translated: Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end,🔽that have a true goal and are well articulated, and that set out the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life—🔽he has learned many such teachings and remembers them, has recited them verbally, has mentally investigated them, and has penetrated them well by view.

original: pātimokkhaṁ kho panassa vitthārena svāgataṁ hoti suvibhattaṁ suppavattaṁ suvinicchitaṁ suttaso anubyañjanaso;
analyzed: pātimokkham kho panassa vitthārena svāgatam hoti su vibhattam su pavattam su vinicchitam suttaso anubyañjanaso
translated: The Monastic Code is agreeable to him in detail, well analyzed, well investigated, well judged in his mind.

original: paṭibalo hoti gilānaṁ upaṭṭhātuṁ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṁ vā;🔽paṭibalo hoti anabhiratiṁ vūpakāsetuṁ vā vūpakāsāpetuṁ vā;
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti gilānam upaṭṭhātum vā upaṭṭhāpetum vā  paṭibalaḥ hoti an abhiratim vūpakāsetum vā vā
translated: He is capable of nursing or having someone else nurse a sick monk.🔽He is capable of cheering up a monk who is downcast.🔽He is capable of resolving or having someone else resolve a monk’s uncertainty.

original: paṭibalo hoti uppannaṁ kukkuccaṁ dhammato vinodetuṁ;🔽paṭibalo hoti uppannaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ dhammato vivecetuṁ;🔽paṭibalo hoti adhisīle samādapetuṁ;
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti uppannam kukkuccam dhammataḥ vinodetu  paṭibalaḥ hoti uppannam diṭṭhigatam dhammataḥ vivecetu  paṭibalaḥ adhi sīle samādapetu
translated: He is capable of clarifying or having someone else clarify a monk’s perplexity.🔽He is capable of inspiring or having someone else inspire a monk with the inspiration of the Buddhas.

original: paṭibalo hoti adhicitte samādapetuṁ;
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti adhicitte samādapetu
translated: He is capable of encouraging or having someone else encourage a monk with the encouragement of the Buddhas.

original: paṭibalo hoti adhipaññāya samādapetuṁ.
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti adhipaññāya samādapetu
translated: and he’s capable of inspiring others with his wisdom.

original: Imehi kho, upāli, dasahi dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabban”ti.🔽Catutthaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.35
analyzed: imehi kho upāli dasahi dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā upasampādetabbanti  catuttha  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: A monk who has these ten qualities may give the full ordination.”🔽The fourth section on Upāli is finished.

original: 4. Upālivagga
analyzed: upāli vagga
translated: The Anguttara Nikāya in number.🔽The Upāli Group

original: Nissayasutta
analyzed: nissaya sutta
translated: Dependence

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayo dātabbo”ti?🔽“Dasahi kho, upāli, dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayo dātabbo.
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ ti  dasahi kho upāli dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ
translated: “Sir, how many qualities should a monk have in order to be able to give dependence?”

original: Katamehi dasahi?
analyzed: katamehi dasahi
translated: “He should have ten qualities:🔽He’s ethical …

original: Idhupāli, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti …pe… samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;
analyzed: idhupāli bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pe samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu
translated: He’s learned …

original: bahussuto hoti …pe… diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā;🔽pātimokkhaṁ kho panassa vitthārena svāgataṁ hoti suvibhattaṁ suppavattaṁ suvinicchitaṁ suttaso anubyañjanaso;🔽paṭibalo hoti gilānaṁ upaṭṭhātuṁ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṁ vā;
analyzed: bahu ssutaḥ hoti pe diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā  pātimokkham kho panassa vitthārena svāgatam hoti su vibhattam su pavattam su vinicchitam suttaso anubyañjanaso  paṭibalaḥ hoti gilānam upaṭṭhātum vā upaṭṭhāpetum vā
translated: He’s skilled in the meaning, the letter, and the manner of expression …🔽He’s capable of looking after a sick student or making an effort to have someone else look after him …

original: paṭibalo hoti anabhiratiṁ vūpakāsetuṁ vā vūpakāsāpetuṁ vā;
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti an abhiratim vūpakāsetum vā vā
translated: He’s capable of removing dissatisfaction or making an effort to have someone else remove it …

original: paṭibalo hoti uppannaṁ kukkuccaṁ dhammato vinodetuṁ;🔽paṭibalo hoti uppannaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ dhammato vivecetuṁ;🔽paṭibalo hoti adhisīle …pe…🔽adhicitte …
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti uppannam kukkuccam dhammataḥ vinodetu  paṭibalaḥ hoti uppannam diṭṭhigatam dhammataḥ vivecetu  paṭibalaḥ hoti adhi sīle  adhicitte
translated: he’s capable of dispelling, in line with the Teaching, remorse that has arisen;🔽he’s capable of clarifying, in line with the Teaching, a view that has arisen;

original: adhipaññāya samādapetuṁ.
analyzed: adhipaññāya samādapetu
translated: he’s capable of rousing, in line with the Teaching, strong desire for the attainment of the as-yet-unattained, the understanding of the as-yet-not-understood, and the realization of the as-yet-unrealized;🔽he’s capable of rousing, in line with the Teaching, strong desire for the attainment of the as-yet-unattained, the understanding of the as-yet-not-understood, and the realization of the as-yet-unrealized;🔽he’s capable of rousing, in line with the Teaching, strong desire for the attainment of the as-yet-unattained, the understanding of the as-yet-not-understood, and the realization of the as-yet-unrealized;🔽he’s capable of rousing, in line with the Teaching, strong desire for the attainment of the as-yet-unattained, the understanding of the as-yet-not-understood, and the realization of the as-yet-unrealized.

original: Imehi kho, upāli, dasahi dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayo dātabbo”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho upāli dasahi dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā nissayaḥ dātabbaḥ ti
translated: A monk who has these ten qualities may give the formal support of a teacher.”

original: Pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: pañcama
translated: The fifth section for recitation on Upāli is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.36
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Anguttara Nikāya in number.

original: 4. Upālivagga
analyzed: upāli vagga
translated: The Upāli Group

original: Sāmaṇerasutta
analyzed: sāmaṇera sutta
translated: A novice monk

original: “Katihi nu kho, bhante, dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo”ti?
analyzed: katihi nu kho bhante dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbo ti
translated: “Sir, when a monk has how many qualities, should he look after a novice monk?”

original: “Dasahi kho, upāli, dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo.
analyzed: dasahi kho upāli dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbaḥ
translated: “When a monk has ten qualities, he should look after a novice monk:

original: Katamehi dasahi?🔽Idhupāli, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti …pe… samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;🔽bahussuto hoti …pe… diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā;
analyzed: katamehi dasahi 🔽idhupāli bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pe samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu 🔽bahu ssutaḥ hoti pe diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā
translated: He has these ten qualities.

original: pātimokkhaṁ kho panassa vitthārena svāgataṁ hoti suvibhattaṁ suppavattaṁ suvinicchitaṁ suttaso anubyañjanaso;🔽paṭibalo hoti gilānaṁ upaṭṭhātuṁ vā upaṭṭhāpetuṁ vā;
analyzed: pātimokkham kho panassa vitthārena svāgatam hoti su vibhattam su pavattam su vinicchitam suttaso anubyañjanaso  paṭibalaḥ hoti gilānam upaṭṭhātum vā upaṭṭhāpetum vā
translated: He has mastered the Pāṭimokkha.🔽He is capable of nursing or having someone else nurse a sick monk.🔽He is capable of dispelling or having someone else dispel dissatisfaction that has arisen.🔽He is capable of dispelling or having someone else dispel anxiety that has arisen.

original: paṭibalo hoti anabhiratiṁ vūpakāsetuṁ vā vūpakāsāpetuṁ vā;
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti an abhiratim vūpakāsetum vā vā
translated: He is capable of dispelling or having someone else dispel a view that has arisen.🔽He is capable of inspiring faith in those without it.

original: paṭibalo hoti uppannaṁ kukkuccaṁ dhammato vinodetuṁ;🔽paṭibalo hoti uppannaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ dhammato vivecetuṁ;
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti uppannam kukkuccam dhammataḥ vinodetu  paṭibalaḥ hoti uppannam diṭṭhigatam dhammataḥ vivecetu
translated: He is capable of increasing the faith of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring confidence in those without it.🔽He is capable of increasing the confidence of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring conviction in those without it.🔽He is capable of increasing the conviction of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring respect in those without it.

original: paṭibalo hoti adhisīle samādapetuṁ;🔽paṭibalo hoti adhicitte samādapetuṁ;
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ adhi sīle samādapetu  paṭibalaḥ hoti adhicitte samādapetu
translated: He is capable of increasing the respect of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring admiration in those without it.🔽He is capable of increasing the admiration of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring devotion in those without it.

original: paṭibalo hoti adhipaññāya samādapetuṁ.🔽Imehi kho, upāli, dasahi dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā sāmaṇero upaṭṭhāpetabbo”ti.
analyzed: paṭibalaḥ hoti adhipaññāya samādapetu  imehi kho upāli dasahi dhammehi samannāgatena bhikkhunā sāmaṇeraḥ upaṭṭhāpetabbo ti
translated: He is capable of increasing the devotion of those who have it.

original: Chaṭṭhaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.37
analyzed: chaṭṭha  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: He is capable of inspiring love in those without it.🔽He is capable of increasing the love of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring desire for learning in those without it.

original: 4. Upālivagga🔽Saṅghabhedasutta
analyzed: upāli vagga  saṅgha bheda sutta
translated: He is capable of increasing the desire for learning of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring a sense of urgency in those without it.🔽He is capable of increasing the sense of urgency of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring the thought of renunciation in those without it.🔽He is capable of increasing the thought of renunciation of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring the thought of fewness of wishes in those without it.

original: “‘Saṅghabhedo, saṅghabhedo’ti, bhante, vuccati.
analyzed: saṅgha bhedo saṅgha bhedo ti bhante vuccati
translated: He is capable of increasing the thought of fewness of wishes of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring contentment in those without it.🔽He is capable of increasing the contentment of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring a sense of seclusion in those without it.🔽He is capable of increasing the sense of seclusion of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring a sense of inner confidence in those without it.🔽He is capable of increasing the sense of inner confidence of those who have it.🔽He is capable of inspiring the desire for the training in those without it.

original: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, saṅgho bhinno hotī”ti?
analyzed: kittāvatā nu kho bhante saṅghaḥ bhinnaḥ hoti iti
translated: He is capable of increasing the desire for the training of those who have it.

original: “Idhupāli, bhikkhū adhammaṁ dhammoti dīpenti, dhammaṁ adhammoti dīpenti, avinayaṁ🔽vinayoti dīpenti, vinayaṁ avinayoti dīpenti, abhāsitaṁ alapitaṁ tathāgatena bhāsitaṁ🔽lapitaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, bhāsitaṁ lapitaṁ tathāgatena abhāsitaṁ alapitaṁ tathāgatenāti🔽dīpenti, anāciṇṇaṁ tathāgatena āciṇṇaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, āciṇṇaṁ tathāgatena
analyzed: idha upāli bhikkhū adhammam dhammoti dīpenti dhammam adhammoti dīpenti avinaya  vinaya uti dīpenti vinayam a vinaya uti dīpenti a bhāsitam a lapitam tathāgatena bhāsita  lapitam tathāgatena ati dīpenti bhāsitam lapitam tathāgatena a bhāsitam a lapitam tathāgatena ati  dīpenti an āciṇṇam tathāgatena āciṇṇam tathāgatena ati dīpenti āciṇṇam tathāgatena
translated: “There are, monks, cases where monks explain what is contrary to the Teaching as the Teaching, what is the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching, what is contrary to the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law, what is the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law, what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as spoken by the Buddha, what’s been spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by the Buddha, what wasn’t practiced by the Buddha as practiced by the Buddha, what was practiced by the Buddha as not practiced by the Buddha,

original: anāciṇṇaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, apaññattaṁ tathāgatena paññattaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti,🔽paññattaṁ tathāgatena apaññattaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti.
analyzed: an āciṇṇam tathāgatena ati dīpenti a paññattam tathāgatena paññattam tathāgatena ati dīpenti  paññattam tathāgatena a paññattam tathāgatena ati dīpenti
translated: “It’s when the monks explain what’s contrary to the Teaching as the Teaching, what’s the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching, what’s contrary to the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law, what’s the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law, what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as spoken by him, what’s been spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by him, what was not practiced by the Buddha as practiced by him, what was practiced by the Buddha as not practiced by him, what was not laid down by the Buddha as laid down by him, and what was laid down by the Buddha as not laid down by him.

original: Te imehi dasahi vatthūhi avakassanti apakassanti āveni kammāni karonti āveni pātimokkhaṁ uddisanti.
analyzed: te imehi dasahi vatthūhi avakassanti apakassanti āveni kammāni karonti āveni pātimokkham uddisanti
translated: They then insist on these ten points.

original: Ettāvatā kho, upāli, saṅgho bhinno hotī”ti.

original: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, saṅgho samaggo hotī”ti?🔽“Idhupāli, bhikkhū adhammaṁ adhammoti dīpenti, dhammaṁ dhammoti dīpenti, avinayaṁ🔽avinayoti dīpenti, vinayaṁ vinayoti dīpenti, abhāsitaṁ alapitaṁ tathāgatena abhāsitaṁ🔽alapitaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, bhāsitaṁ lapitaṁ tathāgatena bhāsitaṁ lapitaṁ tathāgatenāti🔽dīpenti, anāciṇṇaṁ tathāgatena anāciṇṇaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, āciṇṇaṁ tathāgatena
analyzed: kittāvatā nu kho bhante saṅghaḥ samaggaḥ hoti iti  idha upāli bhikkhū adhammam adhammoti dīpenti dhammam dhammoti dīpenti avinaya  dīpenti vinayam dīpenti a bhāsitam a lapitam tathāgatena a bhāsita  a lapitam tathāgatena ati dīpenti bhāsitam lapitam tathāgatena bhāsitam lapitam tathāgatena ati  dīpenti an āciṇṇam tathāgatena an āciṇṇam tathāgatena ati dīpenti āciṇṇam tathāgatena
translated: In what way is the Sangha united?”

original: āciṇṇaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, apaññattaṁ tathāgatena apaññattaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti,🔽paññattaṁ tathāgatena paññattaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti.
analyzed: āciṇṇam tathāgatena ati dīpenti a paññattam tathāgatena a paññattam tathāgatena ati dīpenti 🔽paññattam tathāgatena paññattam tathāgatena ati dīpenti
translated: “There is the case where the monks make known what is contrary to the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching, what is the Teaching as the Teaching, what is contrary to the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law, what is the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law, what hasn’t been spoken by the Tathāgata as not spoken by the Tathāgata, what has been spoken by the Tathāgata as spoken by the Tathāgata, what wasn’t practiced by the Tathāgata as not practiced by the Tathāgata, what was practiced by the Tathāgata as practiced by the Tathāgata, what wasn’t laid down by the Tathāgata as not laid down by the Tathāgata, what was laid down by the Tathāgata as laid down by the Tathāgata.

original: Te imehi dasahi vatthūhi na avakassanti na apakassanti na āveni kammāni karonti na āveni pātimokkhaṁ uddisanti.
analyzed: te imehi dasahi vatthūhi na avakassanti na apakassanti na āveni kammāni karonti na āveni pātimokkham uddisanti
translated: They don’t do any of these ten actions.

original: Ettāvatā kho, upāli, saṅgho samaggo hotī”ti.🔽Aṭṭhamaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.39
analyzed: ettāvatā kho upāli saṅghaḥ samaggaḥ hoti iti  aṭṭhama  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: In this way, Upāli, the Sangha is in harmony.”🔽The eighth section on Upāli is finished.

original: 4. Upālivagga
analyzed: upāli vagga

original: Paṭhamaānandasutta
analyzed: paṭhama ānanda sutta
translated: 1. The first on Ānanda

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then Venerable Ānanda went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: “‘saṅghabhedo saṅghabhedo’ti, bhante, vuccati.
analyzed: saṅgha bhedo saṅgha bhedo ti bhante vuccati
translated: “Venerable Sir, I’ve heard it said, ‘a schism in the Sangha, a schism in the Sangha.’

original: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, saṅgho bhinno hotī”ti?
analyzed: kittāvatā nu kho bhante saṅghaḥ bhinnaḥ hoti iti
translated: In what way is there a schism in the Sangha?”🔽“Ānanda, there are ten legitimate legal procedures done by a unanimous Sangha.

original: “Idhānanda, bhikkhū adhammaṁ dhammoti dīpenti, dhammaṁ adhammoti dīpenti, avinayaṁ vinayoti dīpenti …pe…
analyzed: idha ānanda bhikkhū adhammam dhammoti dīpenti dhammam adhammoti dīpenti avinayam vinayoti dīpenti pe
translated: If a monk teaches, explains, and establishes these as illegitimate, and disparages the Monastic Law, saying, ‘This isn’t the Monastic Law, it’s not been spoken by the Buddha, I don’t approve of it,’

original: paññattaṁ tathāgatena apaññattaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti.
analyzed: paññattam tathāgatena a paññattam tathāgatena ati dīpenti
translated: and if he gains approval for that view, even by just one person, then there is a schism in the Sangha.

original: Te imehi dasahi vatthūhi avakassanti apakassanti āveni kammāni karonti āveni pātimokkhaṁ uddisanti.
analyzed: te imehi dasahi vatthūhi avakassanti apakassanti āveni kammāni karonti āveni pātimokkham uddisanti
translated: They split up, they break apart, they do their transactions separately, they recite the Pāṭimokkha separately.

original: Ettāvatā kho, ānanda, saṅgho bhinno hotī”ti.
analyzed: ettāvatā khalu ānanda saṅghaḥ bhinnaḥ hoti iti
translated: To this extent, Ānanda, the Saṅgha is split.”

original: “Samaggaṁ pana, bhante, saṅghaṁ bhinditvā kiṁ so pasavatī”ti?
analyzed: samaggam pana bhante saṅgham bhinditvā kim saḥ pasavati iti
translated: “But, lord, having split a united Saṅgha, what does one create?”

original: “Kappaṭṭhikaṁ, ānanda, kibbisaṁ pasavatī”ti.
analyzed: kappaṭṭhike ānanda kibbisam pasavati iti
translated: “One creates bad kamma lasting for an eon.”

original: “Kiṁ pana, bhante, kappaṭṭhikaṁ kibbisan”ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante kappaṭṭhikam kibbisanti
translated: “But what is bad kamma lasting for an eon, lord?”

original: “Kappaṁ, ānanda, nirayamhi paccatīti—
analyzed: kappaḥ ānanda nirayamhi paccati iti
translated: “For an eon one cooks in hell.”

original: Āpāyiko nerayiko,
analyzed: āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ
translated: One who is bound for the lower realms, headed for hell,

original: Kappaṭṭho saṅghabhedako;🔽Vaggarato adhammaṭṭho,
analyzed: kappaṭṭhaḥ saṅghabhedako  vagga rataḥ adhammaṭṭhaḥ
translated: who splits a united Saṅgha,

original: Yogakkhemā padhaṁsati;
analyzed: yogakkhemā padhasati
translated: who delights in quarrels, who is intent on non-Dhamma,🔽who falls away from the security from bondage:

original: Saṅghaṁ samaggaṁ bhinditvā,
analyzed: saṅgham samaggam bhinditvā
translated: having split a united Saṅgha,

original: Kappaṁ nirayamhi paccatī”ti.
analyzed: kappam nirayamhi paccati iti
translated: for an eon one cooks in hell.

original: Navamaṁ.
analyzed: navama
translated: The ninth.

analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya

original: 4. Upālivagga
analyzed: upāli vagga
translated: The Upāli Group

original: Dutiyaānandasutta
analyzed: dutiya ānanda sutta
translated: With Ānanda I

original: “‘Saṅghasāmaggī, saṅghasāmaggī’ti, bhante, vuccati.
analyzed: saṅgha sāmaggī saṅgha sāmaggī iti bhante vuccati
translated: “‘Uniting the Saṅgha, uniting the Saṅgha,’ it is said.

original: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, saṅgho samaggo hotī”ti?
analyzed: kittāvatā nu kho bhante saṅghaḥ samaggaḥ hoti iti
translated: In what way, lord, is the Saṅgha united?”

original: “Idhānanda, bhikkhū adhammaṁ adhammoti dīpenti, dhammaṁ dhammoti dīpenti, avinayaṁ🔽avinayoti dīpenti, vinayaṁ vinayoti dīpenti, abhāsitaṁ alapitaṁ tathāgatena abhāsitaṁ🔽alapitaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, bhāsitaṁ lapitaṁ tathāgatena bhāsitaṁ lapitaṁ tathāgatenāti🔽dīpenti, anāciṇṇaṁ tathāgatena anāciṇṇaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, āciṇṇaṁ tathāgatena
analyzed: idha ānanda bhikkhū adhammam adhammo ti dīpenti dhammam dhammo ti dīpenti avinaya  dīpenti vinayam dīpenti a bhāsitam a lapitam tathāgatena a bhāsita  a lapitam tathāgatena ati dīpenti bhāsitam lapitam tathāgatena bhāsitam lapitam tathāgatena ati  dīpenti an āciṇṇam tathāgatena an āciṇṇam tathāgatena ati dīpenti āciṇṇam tathāgatena
translated: “Here, Ananda, monks teach the Dhamma as they have heard it and learned it. They teach the Vinaya as they have heard it and learned it. They teach the Teaching as they have heard it and learned it. They teach the Monastic Law as they have heard it and learned it. They teach what has been spoken by the Buddha as spoken by the Buddha. They teach what has not been spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by the Buddha. They teach what was practiced by the Buddha as practiced by the Buddha. They teach what was not practiced by the Buddha as not practiced by the Buddha. They teach what was laid down by the Buddha as laid down by the Buddha. They teach what was not laid down by the Buddha as not laid down by the Buddha. They teach what is a grave offense as a grave offense. They teach what is a light offense as a light offense. They teach what is a curable offense as a curable offense. They teach what is an incurable offense as an incurable offense. They teach what is a serious offense as a serious offense. They teach what is a minor offense as a minor offense. They teach what is a dark offense as a dark offense. They teach what is a bright offense as a bright offense. They teach what is a difficult offense as a difficult offense. They teach what is an easy offense as an easy offense. They teach what is a difficult training rule as a difficult training rule. They teach what is an easy training rule as an easy training rule.

original: āciṇṇaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, apaññattaṁ tathāgatena apaññattaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti,🔽paññattaṁ tathāgatena paññattaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti.
analyzed: āciṇṇam tathāgatena ati dīpenti a paññattam tathāgatena a paññattam tathāgatena ati dīpenti  paññattam tathāgatena paññattam tathāgatena ati dīpenti
translated: “Here, Ānanda, the monks explain what is contrary to the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching, what is the Teaching as the Teaching, what is contrary to the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law, what is the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law, what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by the Buddha, what has been spoken by the Buddha as spoken by the Buddha, what hasn’t been practiced by the Buddha as not practiced by the Buddha, what has been practiced by the Buddha as practiced by the Buddha, what hasn’t been laid down by the Buddha as not laid down by the Buddha, and what has been laid down by the Buddha as laid down by the Buddha.🔽They don’t reject or disparage these ten principles.

original: Te imehi dasahi vatthūhi na avakassanti na apakassanti na āveni kammāni karonti na āveni pātimokkhaṁ uddisanti.
analyzed: te imehi dasahi vatthūhi na avakassanti na apakassanti na āveni kammāni karonti na āveni pātimokkham uddisanti
translated: They don’t perform or cancel legal procedures. They don’t recite or cancel the Monastic Code.

original: Ettāvatā kho, ānanda, saṅgho samaggo hotī”ti.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho ānanda saṅghaḥ samaggaḥ hoti iti
translated: In this way the Sangha is in harmony.”

original: “Bhinnaṁ pana, bhante, saṅghaṁ samaggaṁ katvā kiṁ so pasavatī”ti?
analyzed: bhinnam pana bhante saṅgham samaggam katvā kim so pasavati iti
translated: “But, Sir, what does one create by reconciling a divided Sangha?”

original: “Brahmaṁ, ānanda, puññaṁ pasavatī”ti.
analyzed: brahma ānanda puññam pasavati iti
translated: “One creates the supreme merit,” he said.

original: “Kiṁ pana, bhante, brahmaṁ puññan”ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante brahmam puññanti
translated: “But, Sir, what is the supreme merit?”

original: “Kappaṁ, ānanda, saggamhi modatīti—
analyzed: kappaḥ ānanda saggamhi modati iti
translated: “One rejoices in heaven for an eon.”

original: Sukhā saṅghassa sāmaggī,
analyzed: sukhā saṅghassa sāmaggī
translated: The happiness of a united Sangha,

original: samaggānañca anuggaho;
analyzed: samaggānam ca anuggahaḥ
translated: and supporting those in unity,

original: Samaggarato dhammaṭṭho,
analyzed: samagga rataḥ dhammaṭṭho
translated: one who delights in unity and is firm in the Teaching

original: yogakkhemā na dhaṁsati;
analyzed: yogakkhemā na dhasati
translated: doesn’t fall from safety.

original: Saṅghaṁ samaggaṁ katvāna,
analyzed: saṅgham samaggam katvāna
translated: Having reconciled a united Sangha,

original: kappaṁ saggamhi modatī”ti.
analyzed: kappam saggamhi modati iti
translated: one rejoices in heaven for an eon.

original: Dasamaṁ.
analyzed: dasama
translated: The tenth.

original: Upālivaggo catuttho.🔽Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: upāli vaggo catutthaḥ  tassa uddāna
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on Upāli is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Upāli ṭhapanā ubbāho,
analyzed: upāli ṭhapanā ubbāho

original: upasampadanissayā;
analyzed: upasampad anissayā
translated: full ordination, dependence;

original: Sāmaṇero ca dve bhedā,
analyzed: sāmaṇeraḥ ca dve bhedā
translated: novice monk, two schisms,

original: ānandehi pare duveti.
analyzed: ānandehi pare
translated: and two more with Ānanda.

original: Vivādasutta
analyzed: vivādasutta
translated: Disputes🔽Then Venerable Upāli went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: Atha kho āyasmā upāli yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā upāli bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai upāli yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmai upāli bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said to him:

original: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo, yena saṅghe bhaṇḍanakalahaviggahavivādā uppajjanti, bhikkhū ca na phāsu viharantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena saṅghe bhaṇḍana kalaha viggaha vivādāḥ uppajjanti bhikkhū ca na phāsu viharanti iti
translated: “What is the reason, Venerable Sir, what is the cause, for quarrels, disputes, and arguments arising in the Sangha, and for the monks not living comfortably?”

original: “Idhupāli, bhikkhū adhammaṁ dhammoti dīpenti, dhammaṁ adhammoti dīpenti, avinayaṁ🔽vinayoti dīpenti, vinayaṁ avinayoti dīpenti, abhāsitaṁ alapitaṁ tathāgatena bhāsitaṁ
analyzed: idha upāli bhikkhū adhammam dhammoti dīpenti dhammam adhammoti dīpenti avinaya  vinaya uti dīpenti vinayam a vinaya uti dīpenti a bhāsitam a lapitam tathāgatena bhāsita
translated: “Here, Upāli, monks describe what is contrary to the Teaching as the Teaching,🔽what is contrary to the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law,🔽what hasn’t been spoken by the Buddha as spoken by the Buddha,

original: lapitaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, bhāsitaṁ lapitaṁ tathāgatena abhāsitaṁ alapitaṁ tathāgatenāti🔽dīpenti, anāciṇṇaṁ tathāgatena āciṇṇaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, āciṇṇaṁ tathāgatena
analyzed: lapitam tathāgatena ati dīpenti bhāsitam lapitam tathāgatena a bhāsitam a lapitam tathāgatena ati  dīpenti an āciṇṇam tathāgatena āciṇṇam tathāgatena ati dīpenti āciṇṇam tathāgatena
translated: what has been spoken by the Buddha as not spoken by the Buddha,🔽what hasn’t been practiced by the Buddha as practiced by the Buddha,🔽what has been practiced by the Buddha as not practiced by the Buddha,

original: anāciṇṇaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti, apaññattaṁ tathāgatena paññattaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti,
analyzed: an āciṇṇam tathāgatena ati dīpenti a paññattam tathāgatena paññattam tathāgatena ati dīpenti
translated: what hasn’t been laid down by the Buddha as laid down by the Buddha,

original: paññattaṁ tathāgatena apaññattaṁ tathāgatenāti dīpenti.
analyzed: paññattam tathāgatena a paññattam tathāgatena ati dīpenti
translated: what has been laid down by the Buddha as not laid down by the Buddha.

original: Ayaṁ kho, upāli, hetu ayaṁ paccayo, yena saṅghe bhaṇḍanakalahaviggahavivādā uppajjanti, bhikkhū ca na phāsu viharantī”ti.🔽Paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ayam kho upāli hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena saṅghe bhaṇḍana kalaha viggaha vivādāḥ uppajjanti bhikkhū ca na phāsu viharanti iti  paṭhama
translated: This is the reason, Upāli, this is the cause, why quarrels, disputes, and dissension arise in the Sangha, and why the monks do not live comfortably.”🔽The first section for recitation on Upāli is finished.
