original: Idhānanda, bhikkhu imameva kāyaṁ uddhaṁ pādatalā adho kesamatthakā tacapariyantaṁ pūraṁ nānāppakārassa asucino paccavekkhati:🔽‘atthi imasmiṁ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco, maṁsaṁ nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṁ vakkaṁ,🔽hadayaṁ yakanaṁ kilomakaṁ pihakaṁ papphāsaṁ, antaṁ antaguṇaṁ udariyaṁ karīsaṁ, pittaṁ
analyzed: idha ānanda bhikkhu imam eva kāyam uddham pāda talāḥ adhas kesamatthakā taca pariyantam pūram nānā appakārassa asucino paccavekkhati  atthi imasmin kāye kesāḥ lomā nakhāḥ dantāḥ tacaḥ masam nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjam vakka  hadayam yakanam kilomakam pihakam papphāsa antam antaguṇam udariyam karīsa pitta
translated: Here, Ananda, a bhikkhu reflects thus: ‘This body is impure, full of various kinds of impurity.🔽There are in this body head hairs, body hairs, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidney,

original: semhaṁ pubbo lohitaṁ sedo medo, assu vasā kheḷo siṅghāṇikā lasikā muttan’ti.
analyzed: semham pubbaḥ lohitam sedaḥ medaḥ assu vasā kheḷaḥ siṅghāṇikā lasikā muttanti
translated: heart, liver, midriff, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, contents of the stomach, excrement, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovic fluid, urine.’

original: Iti imasmiṁ kāye asubhānupassī viharati.
analyzed: iti imasmin kāye asubha anupassī viharati
translated: So he abides contemplating unattractiveness in this body.

original: Ayaṁ vuccatānanda, asubhasaññā.
analyzed: ayam vuccatā ānanda asubha saññā
translated: This, Ananda, is called the perception of unattractiveness.

original: Katamā cānanda, ādīnavasaññā?
analyzed: katamā ca ānande ādīnava saññā
translated: “And what, Ananda, is the perception of the drawbacks?

original: Idhānanda, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: idha ānanda bhikkhu arañña gataḥ vā rukkha mūla gataḥ vā suññāgāra gataḥ vā iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: Here, Ananda, a monk who has gone to the wilderness, to the foot of a tree, or to an empty hut, reflects thus:

original: ‘bahudukkho kho ayaṁ kāyo bahuādīnavo. Iti imasmiṁ kāye vividhā ābādhā uppajjanti, seyyathidaṁ—🔽cakkhurogo sotarogo ghānarogo jivhārogo kāyarogo sīsarogo kaṇṇarogo mukharogo dantarogo🔽oṭṭharogo kāso sāso pināso ḍāho jaro kucchirogo mucchā pakkhandikā sūlā visūcikā
analyzed: bahu dukkhaḥ kho ayam kāyaḥ bahu ādīnavaḥ iti imasmin kāye vividhāḥ ābādhāḥ uppajjanti  cakkhu rogo sota rogaḥ ghāna rogaḥ jivhā rogo kāya rogo sīsa rogo kaṇṇa rogaḥ mukha rogaḥ danta rogo  oṭṭha rogaḥ kāsaḥ sāsaḥ pināsaḥ ḍāhaḥ jaro kucchi rogaḥ mucchā pakkhandikā sūlā visūcikā
translated: ‘This body is of such a nature that in it various diseases arise, that is to say:🔽eye disease, ear disease, nose disease, tongue disease, body disease,

original: kuṭṭhaṁ gaṇḍo kilāso soso apamāro daddu kaṇḍu kacchu nakhasā vitacchikā lohitaṁ pittaṁ
analyzed: kuṭṭham gaṇḍaḥ kilāsaḥ sosaḥ apamāraḥ daddu kaṇḍu kacchu nakhasā vitacchikā lohitam pitta
translated: head disease, disease of the lips, of the mouth, of the throat, of the heart, of the intestines, of the stomach, of the bladder, of the testicles, of the kidneys, of the liver, of the spleen, of the lungs, of the large intestines, of the mesentery, of the external orifices, of the joints, of the veins, of the flesh, of the bones, of the bone marrow, of the skin, of the hair, of the nails, of the teeth,🔽gout, epilepsy, leprosy, boils, ringworm, tuberculosis, diarrhoea, haemorrhoids, ulcers, quartan ague, catarrh, stomach ache, fainting, fever, cold, wind, bile, phlegm,

original: madhumeho aṁsā piḷakā bhagandalā pittasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā semhasamuṭṭhānā ābādhā vātasamuṭṭhānā
analyzed: madhumehaḥ asā piḷakā bhagandalā pitta samuṭṭhānā ābādhā semha samuṭṭhānā ābādhā vāta samuṭṭhānā
translated: blisters, itch, scab, rash, smallpox, cholera, dysentery,

original: ābādhā sannipātikā ābādhā utupariṇāmajā ābādhā visamaparihārajā ābādhā opakkamikā
analyzed: ābādhā sannipātikā ābādhā utu pariṇāma jā ābādhā visama parihāra jā ābādhā opakkamikā
translated: illness born of disturbance, illness born of change of climate, illness born of careless behaviour, illness born of assault,

original: ābādhā kammavipākajā ābādhā sītaṁ uṇhaṁ jighacchā pipāsā uccāro passāvo’ti.
analyzed: ābādhā kamma vipāka jāḥ ābādhā sītam uṇham jighacchā pipāsā uccāro passāvo ti
translated: illness born of kamma formations, cold, heat, hunger, thirst, excrement, urine.”

original: Iti imasmiṁ kāye ādīnavānupassī viharati.
analyzed: iti imasmin kāye ādīnava anupassī viharati
translated: Thus he abides contemplating danger in this body.

original: Ayaṁ vuccatānanda, ādīnavasaññā.
analyzed: ayam vuccatā ānanda ādīnava saññā
translated: This, Ānanda, is called perception of danger.

original: Katamā cānanda, pahānasaññā?🔽Idhānanda, bhikkhu uppannaṁ kāmavitakkaṁ nādhivāseti, pajahati, vinodeti, byantīkaroti,🔽anabhāvaṁ gameti. Uppannaṁ byāpādavitakkaṁ nādhivāseti, pajahati, vinodeti, byantīkaroti,
analyzed: katamā ca ānanda pahāna saññā  idha ānanda bhikkhu uppannam kāma vitakkam na adhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti  anabhāvam gameti uppannam byāpāda vitakkam na adhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti
translated: “And what, Ānanda, is perception of giving up?

original: anabhāvaṁ gameti. Uppannaṁ vihiṁsāvitakkaṁ nādhivāseti, pajahati, vinodeti, byantīkaroti,🔽anabhāvaṁ gameti. Uppannuppanne pāpake akusale dhamme nādhivāseti, pajahati, vinodeti,
analyzed: anabhāvam gameti uppannam vihisā vitakkam na adhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti  anabhāvam gameti uppanna uppanne pāpake akusale dhamme na adhivāseti pajahati vinodeti
translated: Here, Ānanda, a bhikkhu does not tolerate an arisen thought of sensual desire; he abandons it, removes it, does away with it, and annihilates it. He does not tolerate an arisen thought of ill will … an arisen thought of cruelty; he abandons it, removes it, does away with it, and annihilates it.

original: byantīkaroti, anabhāvaṁ gameti.
analyzed: vyantīkaroti anabhāvam gama iti
translated: Whatever arisen evil unwholesome states are, he does not tolerate them; he abandons them, removes them, does away with them, and annihilates them.

original: Ayaṁ vuccatānanda, pahānasaññā.
analyzed: ayam vuccatā ānanda pahāna saññā
translated: This, Ānanda, is called perception of giving up.

original: Katamā cānanda, virāgasaññā?
analyzed: katamā ca ānanda virāga saññā
translated: “And what, Ananda, is the perception of dispassion?

original: Idhānanda, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: idha ānanda bhikkhu arañña gataḥ vā rukkha mūla gataḥ vā suññāgāra gataḥ vā iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: Here, Ananda, a monk, having gone to the forest, to the foot of a tree, or to an empty hut, considers thus:

original: ‘etaṁ santaṁ etaṁ paṇītaṁ yadidaṁ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhippaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nibbānan’ti.
analyzed: etam santam etam paṇītam yat idam sabba saṅkhāra samatho sabba upadhi paṭinissaggo taṇhā kkhayaḥ virāgaḥ nibbānam ti
translated: ‘This is peaceful, this is sublime, that is, the stilling of all processes, the relinquishing of all acquisitions, the destruction of craving, dispassion, cessation, Nibbāna.’

original: Ayaṁ vuccatānanda, virāgasaññā.
analyzed: ayam vuccatā ānanda virāga saññā
translated: This, Ānanda, is called the perception of dispassion.

original: Katamā cānanda, nirodhasaññā?
analyzed: katamā ca ānanda nirodha saññā
translated: “And what, Ānanda, is the perception of cessation?

original: Idhānanda, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: idha ānanda bhikkhu arañña gataḥ vā rukkha mūla gataḥ vā suññāgāra gataḥ vā iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: Here, Ānanda, a monk, having gone to the forest, to the foot of a tree, or to an empty hut, considers thus:

original: ‘etaṁ santaṁ etaṁ paṇītaṁ yadidaṁ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhippaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo nirodho nibbānan’ti.
analyzed: etam santam etam paṇītam yat idam sabba saṅkhāra samatho sabba upadhi paṭinissaggo taṇhā kkhayaḥ nirodhaḥ nibbānam ti
translated: ‘This is peaceful, this is sublime, that is, the stilling of all processes, the relinquishing of all acquisitions, the destruction of craving, cessation, Nibbāna.’

original: Ayaṁ vuccatānanda, nirodhasaññā.
analyzed: ayam vuccatā ānanda nirodha saññā
translated: This, Ānanda, is called the perception of cessation.

original: Katamā cānanda, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā?
analyzed: katamā ca ānanda sabba loke an abhirata saññā
translated: “And what, Ānanda, is the perception of non-delight in the whole world?

original: Idhānanda, bhikkhu ye loke upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhānābhinivesānusayā, te pajahanto viharati anupādiyanto.
analyzed: idha ānanda bhikkhu ye loke upādānā cetasaḥ adhiṭṭhāna abhinivesa anusayā te pajahantaḥ viharati an upādiyantaḥ
translated: Here, Ānanda, a monk, having given up the acquisition of form, being without acquisitions, dwells with a mind inwardly at peace.

original: Ayaṁ vuccatānanda, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā.
analyzed: ayam vuccatā ānanda sabba loke an abhirata saññā
translated: This is called the perception of non-delight in the entire world.

original: Katamā cānanda, sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā?
analyzed: katamā ca ānanda sabba saṅkhāresu anicchā saññā
translated: “And what, Ānanda, is the perception of the undesirability of all fabrications?

original: Idhānanda, bhikkhu sabbasaṅkhāresu aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati.
analyzed: idha ānanda bhikkhu sabba saṅkhāresu aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati
translated: There is the case where a monk feels horrified, humiliated, & disgusted with all fabrications.

original: Ayaṁ vuccatānanda, sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā.
analyzed: ayam vuccatā ānanda sabba saṅkhāresu anicchā saññā
translated: This is called the perception of the undesirability of all fabrications.

original: Katamā cānanda, ānāpānassati?
analyzed: katamā ca ānandaḥ
translated: “And what, Ānanda, is mindfulness of in-&-out breathing?

original: Idhānanda, bhikkhu araññagato vā rukkhamūlagato vā suññāgāragato vā nisīdati pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya parimukhaṁ satiṁ upaṭṭhapetvā.
analyzed: idha ānanda bhikkhu arañña gataḥ vā rukkha mūla gataḥ vā suññāgāra gataḥ vā nisīdati pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya parimukham satim upaṭṭhapetvā
translated: There is the case where a monk — having gone to the wilderness, to the shade of a tree, or to an empty building — sits down folding his legs crosswise, holding his body erect, and setting mindfulness to the fore.

original: So satova assasati satova passasati.🔽Dīghaṁ vā assasanto ‘dīghaṁ assasāmī’ti pajānāti. Dīghaṁ vā passasanto ‘dīghaṁ passasāmī’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: saḥ satas iva assasati satas iva passasati  dīgham vai assasantaḥ dīgham assasāmi iti pajānāti dīgham vā passasantaḥ dīgham passasāmi iti pajānāti
translated: Though mindful, he breathes in; mindful he breathes out.🔽Breathing in long, he discerns, ‘I am breathing in long’; or breathing out long, he discerns, ‘I am breathing out long.’

original: Rassaṁ vā assasanto ‘rassaṁ assasāmī’ti pajānāti. Rassaṁ vā passasanto ‘rassaṁ passasāmī’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: rassam vai assasantaḥ rassam assasāmi iti pajānāti rassam vā passasantaḥ rassam passasāmi iti pajānāti
translated: Or breathing in short, he discerns, ‘I am breathing in short’; or breathing out short, he discerns, ‘I am breathing out short.’

original: ‘Sabbakāyapaṭisaṁvedī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati. ‘Sabbakāyapaṭisaṁvedī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati.🔽‘Passambhayaṁ kāyasaṅkhāraṁ assasissāmī’ti sikkhati. ‘Passambhayaṁ kāyasaṅkhāraṁ passasissāmī’ti sikkhati.
analyzed: sabba kāya paṭisavedī assasissāmi iti sikkhati sabba kāya paṭisavedī passasissāmi iti sikkhati  passambhayam kāya saṅkhāram assasissāmi iti sikkhati passambhayam kāya saṅkhāram passasissāmi iti sikkhati
translated: He trains himself to breathe in and out sensitive to the whole body.🔽He trains himself to breathe in and out calming bodily activity.

original: ‘Pītipaṭisaṁvedī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati. ‘Pītipaṭisaṁvedī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati.🔽‘Sukhapaṭisaṁvedī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati. ‘Sukhapaṭisaṁvedī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati.
analyzed: pīti paṭisavedī assasissāmi iti sikkhati pīti paṭisavedī passasissāmi iti sikkhati  sukha paṭisavedī assasissāmi iti sikkhati sukha paṭisavedī passasissāmi iti sikkhati
translated: He trains himself to breathe in and out experiencing rapture.🔽He trains himself to breathe in and out experiencing pleasure.

original: ‘Cittasaṅkhārapaṭisaṁvedī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati. ‘Cittasaṅkhārapaṭisaṁvedī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati.🔽‘Passambhayaṁ cittasaṅkhāraṁ assasissāmī’ti sikkhati. ‘Passambhayaṁ cittasaṅkhāraṁ passasissāmī’ti sikkhati.🔽‘Cittapaṭisaṁvedī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati. ‘Cittapaṭisaṁvedī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati.
analyzed: citta saṅkhāra paṭisavedī assasissāmi iti sikkhati citta saṅkhāra paṭisavedī passasissāmi iti sikkhati  passambhayam citta saṅkhāram assasissāmi iti sikkhati passambhayam citta saṅkhāram passasissāmi iti sikkhati  citta paṭisavedī assasissāmi iti sikkhati citta paṭisavedī passasissāmi iti sikkhati
translated: He trains himself to breathe in and out experiencing mental activity.🔽He trains himself to breathe in and out calming mental activity.🔽He trains himself to breathe in and out experiencing the mind.

original: Abhippamodayaṁ cittaṁ …pe…
analyzed: cittam pe
translated: He trains himself to breathe in and out gladdening the mind. …

original: samādahaṁ cittaṁ …pe…🔽vimocayaṁ cittaṁ …pe…
analyzed: cittam pe  vimocayam cittam pe
translated: he trains himself to breathe in and out focusing on releasing the mind.🔽He trains himself to breathe in and out focusing on the cessation of the mind.🔽He trains himself to breathe in and out focusing on the mind being uplifted.

original: aniccānupassī …pe…🔽virāgānupassī …pe…🔽nirodhānupassī …pe…🔽‘paṭinissaggānupassī assasissāmī’ti sikkhati. ‘Paṭinissaggānupassī passasissāmī’ti sikkhati.
analyzed: anicca anupassī pe  virāga anupassī pe  nirodha anupassī pe  paṭinissagga anupassī assasissāmi iti sikkhati paṭinissagga anupassī passasissāmi iti sikkhati
translated: He trains himself to breathe in and out focusing on the mind being calmed.🔽He trains himself to breathe in and out focusing on the mind being released.🔽He trains himself to breathe in and out focusing on letting go.

original: Ayaṁ vuccatānanda, ānāpānassati.
analyzed: ayam vuccati ānanda āna apāna sati
translated: This, Ānanda, is called mindfulness of breathing.

original: Sace kho tvaṁ, ānanda, girimānandassa bhikkhuno imā dasa saññā bhāseyyāsi, ṭhānaṁ🔽kho panetaṁ vijjati yaṁ girimānandassa bhikkhuno imā dasa saññā sutvā so ābādho ṭhānaso
analyzed: sace kho tva ānanda girimānandassa bhikkhuno imā dasa saññā bhāseyyāsi ṭhāna  kho pana etat vijjati yat girimānandassa bhikkhuno imā dasa saññā sutvā saḥ ābādhaḥ ṭhānasaḥ
translated: If you were to speak these ten perceptions to the monk Girimananda,

original: paṭippassambheyyā”ti.
analyzed: paṭippassambheyya ati
translated: it’s possible that when he hears these ten perceptions his disease may be allayed even before I arrive.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato santike imā dasa saññā uggahetvā yenāyasmā girimānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmato girimānandassa imā dasa saññā abhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmato ānandaḥ bhagavato santike imā dasa saññāḥ uggahetvā yena āyasmā girima ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmataḥ girima ānandassa imā dasa saññāḥ abhāsi
translated: Then, after learning these ten perceptions in the presence of the Buddha, Ānanda went to Girimananda and spoke these ten perceptions to him.

original: Atha kho āyasmato girimānandassa dasa saññā sutvā so ābādho ṭhānaso paṭippassambhi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ girima ānandassa dasa saññā sutvā saḥ ābādhaḥ ṭhānaso paṭippassambhi
translated: And when he heard these ten perceptions, Girimananda’s disease was allayed on the spot.

original: Vuṭṭhahi cāyasmā girimānando tamhā ābādhā. Tathā pahīno ca panāyasmato girimānandassa so ābādho ahosīti.
analyzed: vuṭṭhahi ca āyasmā girima ānando tamhā ābādhā tathā pahīno ca pana āyasmataḥ girima ānandassa so ābādhaḥ ahosi iti
translated: And the venerable Girimānanda recovered from that affliction, and thus it was that this came to be called the “Girimānanda Sutta.”

original: Dasamaṁ.🔽Sacittavaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: dasama  sa citta vaggaḥ paṭhamaḥ
translated: The tenth.

original: Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: tassa uddāna
translated: The first sub-chapter on the mind is finished.🔽The summary:

original: Sacittañca sāriputta,
analyzed: sa cittam ca sāriputta
translated: Mind, Sāriputta, and standing,

original: ṭhiti ca samathena ca;🔽Parihāno ca dve saññā,
analyzed: ṭhiti ca samathena ca  parihāno ca dve saññā
translated: and with serenity, and decline,

original: mūlā pabbajitaṁ girīti.
analyzed: mūlā pabbajitam girī iti
translated: and two perceptions, and roots, and gone forth, and mountain.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.61
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Elevens

original: 7. Yamakavagga
analyzed: yamaka vagga
translated: The Group of Twos

original: Avijjāsutta
analyzed: avijjāsutta
translated: Ignorance

original: “Purimā, bhikkhave, koṭi na paññāyati avijjāya: ‘ito pubbe avijjā nāhosi, atha pacchā samabhavī’ti.
analyzed: purimā bhikkhave koṭi na paññāyati avijjāya ito pubbe avijjā na ahosi atha pacchā samabhavīti
translated: “Bhikkhus, there comes a time when the beginning of the aeon cannot be discerned, when this world has come into being in this way for a long, long time.

original: Evañcetaṁ, bhikkhave, vuccati, atha ca pana paññāyati: ‘idappaccayā avijjā’ti.
analyzed: evam ceta bhikkhave vuccati atha ca pana paññāyati idappaccayā avijjāti
translated: And yet it is said: ‘With ignorance as condition, volitional formations come to be.’

original: Avijjampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: avijjam pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that ignorance has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro avijjāya?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ avijjāya
translated: And what is the nutriment of ignorance?

original: ‘Pañca nīvaraṇā’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: pañca vacanīya
translated: ‘The five hindrances,’ should be the reply.

original: Pañcapāhaṁ, bhikkhave, nīvaraṇe sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre.
analyzed: bhikkhave nīvaraṇe sa āhāre vadāmi no anāhāre
translated: I say that the five hindrances have a nutriment; they are not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro pañcannaṁ nīvaraṇānaṁ?
analyzed: kaḥ
translated: And what is the nutriment of the five hindrances?

original: ‘Tīṇi duccaritānī’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: tīṇi
translated: ‘The three kinds of misconduct,’ should be the reply.

original: Tīṇipāhaṁ, bhikkhave, duccaritāni sāhārāni vadāmi, no anāhārāni.
analyzed: tīṇi pāha bhikkhave duccaritāni sa āhārāni vadāmi no anāhārāni
translated: I say that the three kinds of misconduct have a nutriment; they are not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro tiṇṇaṁ duccaritānaṁ?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ tiṇṇam
translated: And what is the nutriment of the three kinds of misconduct?

original: ‘Indriyaasaṁvaro’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: vacanīya
translated: ‘Lack of restraint of the sense faculties’ should be the reply.

original: Indriyaasaṁvarampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: indriya asavaram pāha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that lack of restraint of the sense faculties has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro indriyaasaṁvarassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ indriya asavarassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of lack of restraint of the sense faculties?

original: ‘Asatāsampajaññan’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: a satā sampajaññantissa vacanīya
translated: ‘Lack of mindfulness and clear comprehension’ should be the reply.

original: Asatāsampajaññampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: asatā sampajaññam pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that lack of mindfulness and clear comprehension has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro asatāsampajaññassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ asatā asampajaññassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of lack of mindfulness and clear comprehension?

original: ‘Ayonisomanasikāro’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: vacanīya
translated: ‘Inappropriate attention’ should be the reply.

original: Ayonisomanasikārampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: a yoniso manasikāram pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that inappropriate attention has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro ayonisomanasikārassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ a yonisomanasikārassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of inappropriate attention?

original: ‘Assaddhiyan’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: assaddhiyantissa vacanīya
translated: ‘Lack of faith’ should be the reply.

original: Assaddhiyampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that lack of faith has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro assaddhiyassa?🔽‘Asaddhammassavanan’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ assaddhiyassa  asat dhamma ssavana ntissa vacanīya
translated: And what is the nutriment of lack of faith?🔽‘Not hearing the true Dhamma’ should be the reply.

original: Asaddhammassavanampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: asaddhammassavanam pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that not hearing the true Dhamma has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro asaddhammassavanassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ asat dhamma ssavanassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of listening to the Dhamma in a way that is not conducive to uprooting the underlying tendency to conceit?

original: ‘Asappurisasaṁsevo’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: a sappurisa sa sevā utissa vacanīya
translated: ‘Association with bad persons.’

original: Iti kho, bhikkhave, asappurisasaṁsevo paripūro asaddhammassavanaṁ paripūreti, asaddhammassavanaṁ🔽paripūraṁ assaddhiyaṁ paripūreti, assaddhiyaṁ paripūraṁ ayonisomanasikāraṁ paripūreti,
analyzed: iti kho bhikkhave asappurisa sa sevaḥ paripūraḥ asat dhamma ssavanam paripūreti asat dhamma ssavana  paripūram assaddhiyam paripūreti assaddhiyam paripūram a yoniso manasikāram paripūreti
translated: So, bhikkhus, the nutriment association with bad persons, when developed and properly undertaken, brings the nutriment listening to the Dhamma in a way that is not conducive to uprooting the underlying tendency to conceit to perfection.🔽The nutriment listening to the Dhamma in a way that is not conducive to uprooting the underlying tendency to conceit, when developed and properly undertaken, brings the nutriment lack of faith to perfection.

original: ayonisomanasikāro paripūro asatāsampajaññaṁ paripūreti, asatāsampajaññaṁ paripūraṁ
analyzed: a yoniso manasikāro paripūraḥ asatā asampajaññam paripūra iti asatā asampajaññam paripūra
translated: The nutriment lack of faith, when developed and properly undertaken, brings the nutriment lack of conscience and prudence to perfection.🔽The nutriment lack of conscience and prudence, when developed and properly undertaken, brings the nutriment lack of restraint of the sense faculties to perfection.

original: indriyaasaṁvaraṁ paripūreti, indriyaasaṁvaro paripūro tīṇi duccaritāni paripūreti,
analyzed: indriya asavaram paripūra iti indriya asavaraḥ paripūraḥ tīṇi duccaritāni paripūra iti
translated: The nutriment lack of restraint of the sense faculties, when developed and properly undertaken, brings the three kinds of misconduct to perfection.

original: tīṇi duccaritāni paripūrāni pañca nīvaraṇe paripūrenti, pañca nīvaraṇā paripūrā avijjaṁ paripūrenti;
analyzed: tīṇi duccaritāni paripūrāni pañca nīvaraṇe paripūrenti pañca nīvaraṇā paripūrāḥ avijjam paripūrenti
translated: The three kinds of misconduct, when developed and properly undertaken, bring the five hindrances to perfection. The five hindrances, when developed and properly undertaken, bring ignorance to perfection.

original: evametissā avijjāya āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
analyzed: evam etissaḥ avijjāya āhāraḥ hoti evam ca pāripūri
translated: This is how there is the nutriment for the arising of ignorance that has not yet arisen and for the increase and expansion of ignorance that has already arisen.

original: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, uparipabbate thullaphusitake deve vassante (…) taṁ udakaṁ
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave upari pabbate thullaphusitake deve vassante tam udaka
translated: “Bhikkhus, when a cloud covers the sky,

original: yathāninnaṁ pavattamānaṁ pabbatakandarapadarasākhā paripūreti, pabbatakandarapadarasākhā
analyzed: yathāninnam pavattamānam pabbata kandara pada rasa ākhā paripūreti pabbata kandara pada rasa ākhā
translated: as the water flows down, it fills the mountain streams,

original: paripūrā kusobbhe paripūrenti. Kusobbhā paripūrā mahāsobbhe paripūrenti, mahāsobbhā🔽paripūrā kunnadiyo paripūrenti, kunnadiyo paripūrā mahānadiyo paripūrenti, mahānadiyo
analyzed: paripūrā kusobbhe paripūrenti kusobbhā paripūrā mahāsobbhe paripūrenti mahāsobbhā  paripūrā kunnadiyo paripūrenti kunnadiyo paripūrā mahā nadiyo paripūrenti mahā nadiyo
translated: the mountain streams fill the lakes, the lakes fill the great lakes,🔽the great lakes fill the rivers, the rivers fill the great oceans,

original: paripūrā mahāsamuddaṁ sāgaraṁ paripūrenti;
analyzed: paripūrāḥ mahā samuddam sāgaram paripūrenti
translated: the great oceans, the seas are filled.

original: evametassa mahāsamuddassa sāgarassa āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
analyzed: evam etassa mahā samuddassa sāgarassa āhāraḥ hoti evañca pāripūri
translated: This is how the great ocean, the sea is fed, and so it is filled.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, asappurisasaṁsevo paripūro asaddhammassavanaṁ paripūreti,🔽asaddhammassavanaṁ paripūraṁ assaddhiyaṁ paripūreti, assaddhiyaṁ paripūraṁ ayonisomanasikāraṁ
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave asappurisa sa sevaḥ paripūraḥ asat dhamma ssavanam paripūreti  asat dhamma ssavanam paripūram assaddhiyam paripūreti assaddhiyam paripūram a yoni soma nasikāra
translated: So too, monks, association with bad people, when fulfilled, fills the listening to bad Dhamma,🔽the listening to bad Dhamma, when fulfilled, fills lack of faith, lack of faith, when fulfilled, fills lack of devotion,

original: paripūreti, ayonisomanasikāro paripūro asatāsampajaññaṁ paripūreti, asatāsampajaññaṁ
analyzed: paripūreti a yoniso manasikāro paripūraḥ a satā a sampajaññam paripūreti a satā a sampajañña
translated: lack of devotion, when fulfilled, fills lack of full awareness and lack of full understanding,

original: paripūraṁ indriyaasaṁvaraṁ paripūreti, indriyaasaṁvaro paripūro tīṇi duccaritāni
analyzed: paripūram indriya asavaram paripūra iti indriya asavaraḥ tīṇi duccaritāni
translated: He who has fulfilled the restraint of the faculties fulfills the three kinds of good conduct.🔽He who has fulfilled the three kinds of good conduct fulfills the five hindrances.

original: paripūreti, tīṇi duccaritāni paripūrāni pañca nīvaraṇe paripūrenti, pañca nīvaraṇā🔽paripūrā avijjaṁ paripūrenti;
analyzed: tīṇi duccaritāni paripūrāni pañca nīvaraṇe paripūrenti pañca nīvaraṇā  paripūrāḥ avijjam paripūrenti
translated: He who has fulfilled the five hindrances fulfills ignorance.

original: evametissā avijjāya āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
analyzed: evam etissaḥ avijjāya āhāraḥ hoti evam ca pāripūri
translated: This is how ignorance is fed, and this is how it comes to fulfillment.

original: Vijjāvimuttimpāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: vijjā vimuttim pāha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: “Bhikkhus, I say that the liberation of mind and liberation by wisdom are fed, not unfed.

original: Ko cāhāro vijjāvimuttiyā?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ vijjā vimuttiyā
translated: And what is the nutriment for the liberation of mind and the liberation by wisdom?

original: ‘Satta bojjhaṅgā’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: satta
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment should be told.

original: Sattapāhaṁ, bhikkhave, bojjhaṅge sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre.
analyzed: bhikkhave bojjhaṅge sa āhāre vadāmi no anāhāre
translated: “Bhikkhus, I say that the seven factors of enlightenment are fed, not unfed.

original: Ko cāhāro sattannaṁ bojjhaṅgānaṁ?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāro
translated: And what is the nutriment for the seven factors of enlightenment?

original: ‘Cattāro satipaṭṭhānā’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: cattāro
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness should be told.

original: Cattāropāhaṁ, bhikkhave, satipaṭṭhāne sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre.
analyzed: cattāri upa aha bhikkhave sati paṭṭhāne sa āhāre vadāmi no anāhāre
translated: “Bhikkhus, I say that the four establishments of mindfulness are fed, not unfed.

original: Ko cāhāro catunnaṁ satipaṭṭhānānaṁ?🔽‘Tīṇi sucaritānī’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāro catunnam sati paṭṭhānāna  tīṇi vacanīya
translated: And what is the nutriment for the four establishments of mindfulness?🔽The three kinds of good conduct should be told.

original: Tīṇipāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sucaritāni sāhārāni vadāmi, no anāhārāni.
analyzed: tīṇi pāha bhikkhave su caritāni sa āhārāni vadāmi no anāhārāni
translated: “Bhikkhus, I say that the three kinds of good conduct are fed, not unfed.

original: Ko cāhāro tiṇṇaṁ sucaritānaṁ?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ tiṇṇam
translated: And what is the nutriment for the three kinds of good conduct?

original: ‘Indriyasaṁvaro’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: vacanīya
translated: ‘Restraint of the senses’ should be the reply.

original: Indriyasaṁvarampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: indriya savaram pā aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: And I say that restraint of the senses has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro indriyasaṁvarassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ indriya savarassa
translated: And what is the nutriment for restraint of the senses?

original: ‘Satisampajaññan’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: sati sampajañña ntissa vacanīya
translated: ‘Mindfulness & alertness’ should be the reply.

original: Satisampajaññampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: sati sampajaññam pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: And I say that mindfulness & alertness have a nutriment; they are not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro satisampajaññassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ sati sampajaññassa
translated: And what is the nutriment for mindfulness & alertness?

original: ‘Yonisomanasikāro’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: vacanīya
translated: ‘Righteous attention’ should be the reply.

original: Yonisomanasikārampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: yoniso manasikāram pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: And I say that righteous attention has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro yonisomanasikārassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ yonisomanasikārassa
translated: And what is the nutriment for righteous attention?

original: ‘Saddhā’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: saddhātissa vacanīya
translated: ‘Faith’ should be the reply.

original: Saddhampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: And I say that faith has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro saddhāya?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ saddhāya
translated: And what is the nutriment for faith?

original: ‘Saddhammassavanan’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: saddhamma ssavana ntissa vacanīya
translated: ‘Hearing the true Dhamma’ should be the reply.

original: Saddhammassavanampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: saddhammassavanam pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: And I say that hearing the true Dhamma has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro saddhammassavanassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ saddhamma ssavanassa
translated: And what is the nutriment for hearing the true Dhamma?

original: ‘Sappurisasaṁsevo’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: sappurisa sa sevā utissa vacanīya
translated: ‘Association with people who are true’ should be the reply.

original: Iti kho, bhikkhave, sappurisasaṁsevo paripūro saddhammassavanaṁ paripūreti, saddhammassavanaṁ🔽paripūraṁ saddhaṁ paripūreti, saddhā paripūrā yonisomanasikāraṁ paripūreti, yonisomanasikāro
analyzed: iti kho bhikkhave sappurisa sasevaḥ paripūro saddhammassavanam paripūreti  paripūram saddham paripūrā iti saddhā paripūrā yoni soma nasikāram paripūrā iti yoni soma nasikāraḥ
translated: Thus the cultivation of good people fulfills listening to the true Dhamma.🔽Listening to the true Dhamma🔽fulfills faith. Faith fulfills proper attention. Proper attention🔽fulfills mindfulness and full awareness. Mindfulness and full awareness

original: paripūro satisampajaññaṁ paripūreti, satisampajaññaṁ paripūraṁ indriyasaṁvaraṁ paripūreti,
analyzed: paripūraḥ sati sampajaññam paripūreti sati sampajaññam paripūram indriya savaram paripūreti
translated: fulfill the restraint of the sense faculties. The restraint of the sense faculties

original: indriyasaṁvaro paripūro tīṇi sucaritāni paripūreti, tīṇi sucaritāni paripūrāni cattāro
analyzed: indriya savaro paripūro tīṇi su caritāni paripūreti tīṇi su caritāni paripūrāni cattāro
translated: fulfills the three kinds of good conduct. The three kinds of good conduct

original: satipaṭṭhāne paripūrenti, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā paripūrā satta bojjhaṅge paripūrenti,
analyzed: sati paṭṭhāne paripūrenti cattāro sati paṭṭhānā paripūrā satta bojjhaṅge paripūrenti
translated: fulfill the four establishments of mindfulness. The four establishments of mindfulness

original: satta bojjhaṅgā paripūrā vijjāvimuttiṁ paripūrenti;
analyzed: satta bojjhaṅgā paripūrā vijjā vimuttim paripūrenti
translated: fulfill the seven factors of awakening. The seven factors of awakening🔽fulfill knowledge and liberation.

original: evametissā vijjāvimuttiyā āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
analyzed: evam etissā vijjā vimuttiyāḥ āhāraḥ hoti evam ca pāripūri
translated: This is how there comes to be the nutriment for the arising of the unarisen knowledge and liberation, and for the fulfilment by development of the arisen knowledge and liberation.

original: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, uparipabbate thullaphusitake deve vassante taṁ udakaṁ yathāninnaṁ
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave upari pabbate thullaphusitake deve vassante tam udakam
translated: Just as when there is a great mountain not far from a town, and it rains heavily on the mountain, then the water flowing down from the mountain fills the mountain stream;

original: pavattamānaṁ pabbatakandarapadarasākhā paripūreti, pabbatakandarapadarasākhā paripūrā🔽kusobbhe paripūrenti, kusobbhā paripūrā mahāsobbhe paripūrenti, mahāsobbhā paripūrā🔽kunnadiyo paripūrenti, kunnadiyo paripūrā mahānadiyo paripūrenti, mahānadiyo paripūrā
analyzed: pavattamānam pabbata kandara pada rasa ākhā paripūrā iti pabbata kandara pada rasa ākhā paripūrā  kusobbhe paripūrenti kusobbhā paripūrā mahāsobbhe paripūrenti mahāsobbhā paripūrā  kunnadiyo paripūrenti kunnadiyo paripūrā mahā nadiyo paripūrenti mahā nadiyo paripūrā
translated: and it fills the mountain caves and clefts and gullies. When the mountain caves and clefts and gullies are full,🔽they fill the pools. When the pools are full,🔽they fill the streams. When the streams are full,

original: mahāsamuddaṁ sāgaraṁ paripūrenti;
analyzed: mahā samuddam sāgaram paripūrenti
translated: they fill the great rivers. When the great rivers are full,🔽they fill the ocean.

original: evametassa mahāsamuddassa sāgarassa āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.🔽Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, sappurisasaṁsevo paripūro saddhammassavanaṁ paripūreti,🔽saddhammassavanaṁ paripūraṁ saddhaṁ paripūreti, saddhā paripūrā yonisomanasikāraṁ
analyzed: evam etassa mahā samuddassa sāgarassa āhāraḥ hoti evañca pāripūri  evam evam kho bhikkhave sappurisa sa sevaḥ paripūro saddhamma ssavanam paripūreti  saddhammassavanam paripūram saddham paripūrā iti saddhā paripūrā yoni soma nasikāra
translated: This is how the great ocean is fed, and this is why it does not decrease.🔽“So too, bhikkhus, the frequenting of good persons, when fulfilled, brings it to pass that one hears the true Dhamma.

original: paripūreti, yonisomanasikāro paripūro satisampajaññaṁ paripūreti, satisampajaññaṁ
analyzed: paripūreti yoniso manasikāro paripūraḥ sati sampajaññam paripūreti sati sampajañña
translated: When one hears the true Dhamma, this brings it to pass that one acquires confidence. When one acquires confidence, this brings it to pass that one exerts zeal. When one exerts zeal, this brings it to pass that one gains mindfulness and full awareness. When one gains mindfulness and full awareness, this brings it to pass that one guards the doors of one’s sense faculties. When one guards the doors of one’s sense faculties, this brings it to pass that one is moderate in eating.

original: paripūraṁ indriyasaṁvaraṁ paripūreti, indriyasaṁvaro paripūro tīṇi sucaritāni paripūreti,
analyzed: paripūram indriya savaram paripūra iti indriya savaraḥ paripūraḥ tīṇi su caritāni paripūra iti
translated: When one is moderate in eating, this brings it to pass that one is devoted to wakefulness. When one is devoted to wakefulness, this brings it to pass that one is possessed of three kinds of good conduct. When one is possessed of three kinds of good conduct, this brings it to pass that one is possessed of the four establishments of mindfulness.🔽When one is possessed of the four establishments of mindfulness, this brings it to pass that one is possessed of the seven factors of enlightenment. When one is possessed of the seven factors of enlightenment, this brings it to pass that one is possessed of knowledge and deliverance.

original: tīṇi sucaritāni paripūrāni cattāro satipaṭṭhāne paripūrenti, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā
analyzed: tīṇi su caritāni paripūrāni cattāro satipaṭṭhāne paripūrenti cattāro satipaṭṭhānā
translated: The three kinds of good conduct are fulfilled in the four establishments of mindfulness.🔽The four establishments of mindfulness are fulfilled in the seven factors of awakening.

original: paripūrā satta bojjhaṅge paripūrenti, satta bojjhaṅgā paripūrā vijjāvimuttiṁ paripūrenti;🔽evametissā vijjāvimuttiyā āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūrī”ti.
analyzed: paripūrā satta bojjhaṅge paripūrenti satta bojjhaṅgā paripūrā vijjā vimuttim paripūrenti  evam etissā vijjā vimuttiyāḥ āhāraḥ hoti evam ca pāripūrī iti
translated: The seven factors of awakening are fulfilled in knowledge and liberation.

original: Paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: paṭhama
translated: This is how there is nourishment for this knowledge and liberation, and this is how it is fulfilled.”🔽The first section for recitation on the past is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.62🔽7. Yamakavagga
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya  yamaka vagga
translated: The Book of the Tens

original: Taṇhāsutta
analyzed: taṇhā sutta
translated: The Linked Discourses with Yamaka🔽Craving

original: “Purimā, bhikkhave, koṭi na paññāyati bhavataṇhāya: ‘ito pubbe bhavataṇhā nāhosi, atha pacchā samabhavī’ti.
analyzed: purimā bhikkhave koṭi na paññāyati bhava taṇhāya ito pubbe bhava taṇhā na ahosi atha pacchā samabhavīti
translated: “Mendicants, there is no beginning of craving for continued existence to be found. Before craving for continued existence there was no craving for continued existence.

original: Evañcetaṁ, bhikkhave, vuccati, atha ca pana paññāyati: ‘idappaccayā bhavataṇhā’ti.
analyzed: evam ceta bhikkhave vuccati atha ca pana paññāyati idappaccayā bhavataṇhā ti
translated: But it’s said that craving for continued existence has a specific condition.

original: Bhavataṇhampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: bhavataṇham pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that craving for continued existence has a nutriment, it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro bhavataṇhāya?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ bhava taṇhāya
translated: And what is the nutriment for craving for continued existence?

original: ‘Avijjā’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: avijjātissa vacanīya
translated: ‘Ignorance,’ should be the reply.

original: Avijjampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: avijjam pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that ignorance has a nutriment, it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro avijjāya?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ avijjāya
translated: And what is the nutriment for ignorance?

original: ‘Pañca nīvaraṇā’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: pañca vacanīya
translated: ‘The five hindrances,’ should be the reply.

original: Pañca nīvaraṇepāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre.
analyzed: pañca bhikkhave sa āhāre vadāmi no anāhāre
translated: I say the five hindrances have a nutriment; they are not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro pañcannaṁ nīvaraṇānaṁ?
analyzed: kaḥ
translated: And what is the nutriment of the five hindrances?

original: ‘Tīṇi duccaritānī’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: tīṇi
translated: The answer is: the three kinds of misconduct.

original: Tīṇipāhaṁ, bhikkhave, duccaritāni sāhārāni vadāmi, no anāhārāni.
analyzed: tīṇi pāha bhikkhave duccaritāni sa āhārāni vadāmi no anāhārāni
translated: I say the three kinds of misconduct have a nutriment; they are not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro tiṇṇannaṁ duccaritānaṁ?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ
translated: And what is the nutriment of the three kinds of misconduct?

original: ‘Indriyaasaṁvaro’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: vacanīya
translated: The answer is: lack of sense restraint.

original: Indriyaasaṁvarampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: indriya asavaram pāha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say lack of sense restraint has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro indriyaasaṁvarassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ indriya asavarassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of lack of sense restraint?

original: ‘Asatāsampajaññan’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: a satā sampajaññantissa vacanīya
translated: The answer is: lack of mindfulness & alertness. 🔽I say lack of mindfulness & alertness has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment. 🔽And what is the nutriment of lack of mindfulness & alertness? 🔽The answer is: lack of right concentration.

original: Asatāsampajaññampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: asatā sampajaññam pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say lack of right concentration has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro asatā sampajaññassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ asatā sampajaññassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of lack of right concentration?

original: ‘Ayonisomanasikāro’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: vacanīya
translated: The answer is: lack of persistence.

original: Ayonisomanasikārampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: a yoniso manasikāram pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say lack of persistence has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro ayonisomanasikārassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ a yonisomanasikārassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of lack of persistence?

original: ‘Assaddhiyan’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: assaddhiyantissa vacanīya
translated: The answer is: lack of conviction.

original: Assaddhiyampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that lack of faith has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro assaddhiyassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ assaddhiyassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of lack of faith?

original: ‘Assaddhammassavanan’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: assaddhamma ssavana ntissa vacanīya
translated: ‘Listening to teachings that are not Dhamma’ should be the reply.

original: Assaddhammassavanampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: assaddhammassavanam pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that listening to teachings that are not Dhamma has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro assaddhammassavanassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ assat dhamma ssavanassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of listening to teachings that are not Dhamma?

original: ‘Asappurisasaṁsevo’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: a sappurisa sa sevā utissa vacanīya
translated: ‘Association with bad people’ should be the reply.

original: Iti kho, bhikkhave, asappurisasaṁsevo paripūro assaddhammassavanaṁ paripūreti, assaddhammassavanaṁ🔽paripūraṁ assaddhiyaṁ paripūreti, assaddhiyaṁ paripūraṁ ayonisomanasikāraṁ paripūreti,
analyzed: iti kho bhikkhave asappurisa sa sevaḥ paripūraḥ assat dhammassavanam paripūreti assat dhammassavana  paripūram assaddhiyam paripūreti assaddhiyam paripūram a yoniso manasikāram paripūreti
translated: Thus, bhikkhus, the nutriment of association with bad people has been revealed by me to those who delight in the Dhamma, love the Dhamma, and treasure the Dhamma.🔽When there is association with bad people, listening to teachings that are not Dhamma is fulfilled;🔽when there is listening to teachings that are not Dhamma, lack of faith is fulfilled;🔽when there is lack of faith, lack of conscience and prudence are fulfilled;

original: ayonisomanasikāro paripūro asatāsampajaññaṁ paripūreti, asatāsampajaññaṁ paripūraṁ🔽indriyaasaṁvaraṁ paripūreti, indriyaasaṁvaro paripūro tīṇi duccaritāni paripūreti,
analyzed: a yoniso manasikāro paripūraḥ asatā asampajaññam paripūra iti asatā asampajaññam paripūra  indriya asavaram paripūra iti indriya asavaraḥ paripūraḥ tīṇi duccaritāni paripūra iti
translated: when there is lack of conscience and prudence, failure in morality is fulfilled;🔽when there is failure in morality, the three forms of misconduct are fulfilled;🔽when there are the three forms of misconduct, the five hindrances are fulfilled;

original: tīṇi duccaritāni paripūrāni pañca nīvaraṇe paripūrenti, pañca nīvaraṇā paripūrā avijjaṁ
analyzed: tīṇi duccaritāni paripūrāni pañca nīvaraṇe paripūrenti pañca nīvaraṇā paripūrā avijja
translated: when there are the five hindrances, ignorance is fulfilled;

original: paripūrenti, avijjā paripūrā bhavataṇhaṁ paripūreti;
analyzed: paripūrenti avijjā paripūrā bhava taṇham paripūreti
translated: ignorance fulfills craving for existence;

original: evametissā bhavataṇhāya āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.🔽Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, uparipabbate thullaphusitake deve vassante taṁ udakaṁ yathāninnaṁ
analyzed: evam etissā bhava taṇhāya āhāraḥ hoti evam ca pāripūri  seyyathā api bhikkhave upari pabbate thullaphusitake deve vassante tam udakam
translated: this is how craving for existence is fueled and fulfilled.🔽“Suppose, monks, that on a steep mountaintop

original: pavattamānaṁ pabbatakandarapadarasākhā paripūreti, pabbatakandarapadarasākhā paripūrā
analyzed: pavattamānam pabbata kandara pada rasa ākhā paripūrā iti pabbata kandara pada rasa ākhā paripūrā
translated: rain falls and flows down the slope, filling the clefts, gullies, and gulley-forks; the clefts, gullies, and gulley-forks being full,

original: kusobbhe paripūrenti, kusobbhā paripūrā mahāsobbhe paripūrenti, mahāsobbhā paripūrā🔽kunnadiyo paripūrenti, kunnadiyo paripūrā mahānadiyo paripūrenti, mahānadiyo paripūrā
analyzed: kusobbhe paripūrenti kusobbhā paripūrā mahāsobbhe paripūrenti mahāsobbhā paripūrā  kunnadiyo paripūrenti kunnadiyo paripūrā mahā nadiyo paripūrenti mahā nadiyo paripūrā
translated: fill up the pools; the pools being full,🔽fill up the ponds; the ponds being full,🔽fill up the rivers; the rivers being full,

original: mahāsamuddaṁ sāgaraṁ paripūrenti;
analyzed: mahā samuddam sāgaram paripūrenti
translated: fill up the great ocean.

original: evametassa mahāsamuddassa sāgarassa āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
analyzed: evam etassa mahā samuddassa sāgarassa āhāraḥ hoti evañca pāripūri
translated: This is how the great ocean is fueled and fulfilled.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, asappurisasaṁsevo paripūro assaddhammassavanaṁ paripūreti,
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave asappurisa sa sevaḥ paripūraḥ assat dhamma ssavanam paripūreti
translated: “So too, monks, association with bad people, when fulfilled, fulfills listening to bad Dhamma;

original: assaddhammassavanaṁ paripūraṁ assaddhiyaṁ paripūreti, assaddhiyaṁ paripūraṁ ayonisomanasikāraṁ
analyzed: assaddhammassavanam paripūram assaddhiyam paripūreti assaddhiyam paripūram a yoni soma nasikāra
translated: The lack of faith that is fulfilled by not listening to the true Dhamma fulfills lack of conscience and lack of prudence.🔽Lack of conscience and lack of prudence fulfill lack of mindfulness and lack of full awareness.

original: paripūreti, ayonisomanasikāro paripūro asatāsampajaññaṁ paripūreti, asatāsampajaññaṁ
analyzed: paripūreti a yoniso manasikāro paripūraḥ a satā a sampajaññam paripūreti a satā a sampajañña
translated: Lack of mindfulness and lack of full awareness fulfill lack of restraint of the senses.

original: paripūraṁ indriyaasaṁvaraṁ paripūreti, indriyaasaṁvaro paripūro tīṇi duccaritāni
analyzed: paripūram indriya asavaram paripūra iti indriya asavaraḥ tīṇi duccaritāni
translated: Lack of restraint of the senses fulfills the three kinds of misconduct.

original: paripūreti, tīṇi duccaritāni paripūrāni pañca nīvaraṇe paripūrenti, pañca nīvaraṇā
analyzed: tīṇi duccaritāni paripūrāni pañca nīvaraṇe paripūrenti pañca nīvaraṇā
translated: The three kinds of misconduct fulfill the five hindrances.🔽The five hindrances fulfill ignorance.

original: paripūrā avijjaṁ paripūrenti, avijjā paripūrā bhavataṇhaṁ paripūreti;
analyzed: paripūrāḥ avijjam paripūrenti avijjā paripūrā bhava taṇham paripūreti
translated: Ignorance fulfills craving for becoming.

original: evametissā bhavataṇhāya āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
analyzed: evam etissā bhava taṇhāya āhāraḥ hoti evam ca pāripūri
translated: This is the nutriment for the arising of craving for becoming.

original: Vijjāvimuttimpāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: vijjā vimuttim pāha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: “I say that the liberation by wisdom has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro vijjāvimuttiyā?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ vijjā vimuttiyā
translated: And what is the nutriment for the liberation by wisdom?

original: ‘Satta bojjhaṅgā’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: satta
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment should be said to be its nutriment.

original: Sattapāhaṁ, bhikkhave, bojjhaṅge sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre.
analyzed: bhikkhave bojjhaṅge sa āhāre vadāmi no anāhāre
translated: “I say that the seven factors of enlightenment have a nutriment; they are not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro sattannaṁ bojjhaṅgānaṁ?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāro
translated: And what is the nutriment for the seven factors of enlightenment?

original: ‘Cattāro satipaṭṭhānā’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: cattāro
translated: You should say: ‘The four establishments of mindfulness.’

original: Cattāropāhaṁ, bhikkhave, satipaṭṭhāne sāhāre vadāmi, no anāhāre.
analyzed: cattāri upa aha bhikkhave sati paṭṭhāne sa āhāre vadāmi no anāhāre
translated: I say that the four establishments of mindfulness have a nutriment; they are not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro catunnaṁ satipaṭṭhānānaṁ?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāro catunnam sati paṭṭhānāna
translated: And what is the nutriment of the four establishments of mindfulness?

original: ‘Tīṇi sucaritānī’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: tīṇi vacanīya
translated: You should say: ‘The three kinds of good conduct.’

original: Tīṇipāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sucaritāni sāhārāni vadāmi, no anāhārāni.
analyzed: tīṇi pāha bhikkhave su caritāni sa āhārāni vadāmi no anāhārāni
translated: I say that the three kinds of good conduct have a nutriment; they are not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro tiṇṇannaṁ sucaritānaṁ?
analyzed: kaḥ
translated: And what is the nutriment of the three kinds of good conduct?

original: ‘Indriyasaṁvaro’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: vacanīya
translated: You should say: ‘Restraint of the sense faculties.’

original: Indriyasaṁvarampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: indriya savaram pā aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that restraint of the sense faculties has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro indriyasaṁvarassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ indriya savarassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of restraint of the sense faculties?

original: ‘Satisampajaññan’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: sati sampajañña ntissa vacanīya
translated: You should say: ‘Mindfulness and alertness.’

original: Satisampajaññampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: sati sampajaññam pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that mindfulness and alertness have a nutriment; they are not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro satisampajaññassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ sati sampajaññassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of mindfulness and alertness?

original: ‘Yonisomanasikāro’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: vacanīya
translated: You should say: ‘Wise attention.’

original: Yonisomanasikārampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: yoniso manasikāram pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that wise attention has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro yonisomanasikārassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ yonisomanasikārassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of wise attention?

original: ‘Saddhā’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: saddhātissa vacanīya
translated: You should say: ‘Faith.’

original: Saddhampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that faith has a nutriment; it is not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro saddhāya?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ saddhāya
translated: And what is the nutriment of faith?

original: ‘Saddhammassavanan’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: saddhamma ssavana ntissa vacanīya
translated: The answer is: good friends.

original: Saddhammassavanampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sāhāraṁ vadāmi, no anāhāraṁ.
analyzed: saddhammassavanam pa aha bhikkhave sa āhāram vadāmi no anāhāra
translated: I say that good friends have a nutriment; they are not without nutriment.

original: Ko cāhāro saddhammassavanassa?
analyzed: kaḥ ca āhāraḥ saddhamma ssavanassa
translated: And what is the nutriment of good friends?

original: ‘Sappurisasaṁsevo’tissa vacanīyaṁ.
analyzed: sappurisa sa sevā utissa vacanīya
translated: The answer is: hearing the true Dhamma.

original: Iti kho, bhikkhave, sappurisasaṁsevo paripūro saddhammassavanaṁ paripūreti, saddhammassavanaṁ🔽paripūraṁ saddhaṁ paripūreti, saddhā paripūrā yonisomanasikāraṁ paripūreti, yonisomanasikāro
analyzed: iti kho bhikkhave sappurisa sasevaḥ paripūro saddhammassavanam paripūreti  paripūram saddham paripūrā iti saddhā paripūrā yoni soma nasikāram paripūrā iti yoni soma nasikāraḥ
translated: Thus, bhikkhus, the nutriment of good friends has hearing the true Dhamma as its nutriment;🔽hearing the true Dhamma has faith as its nutriment;🔽faith has careful attention as its nutriment;🔽careful attention has the establishment of mindfulness as its nutriment;

original: paripūro satisampajaññaṁ paripūreti, satisampajaññaṁ paripūraṁ indriyasaṁvaraṁ paripūreti,🔽indriyasaṁvaro paripūro tīṇi sucaritāni paripūreti, tīṇi sucaritāni paripūrāni cattāro
analyzed: paripūraḥ sati sampajaññam paripūreti sati sampajaññam paripūram indriya savaram paripūreti  indriya savaro paripūro tīṇi su caritāni paripūreti tīṇi su caritāni paripūrāni cattāro
translated: the establishment of mindfulness has the restraint of the sense faculties as its nutriment;🔽the restraint of the sense faculties has the three kinds of good conduct as its nutriment;🔽the three kinds of good conduct have the four establishments of mindfulness as their nutriment;

original: satipaṭṭhāne paripūrenti, cattāro satipaṭṭhānā paripūrā satta bojjhaṅge paripūrenti,
analyzed: sati paṭṭhāne paripūrenti cattāro sati paṭṭhānā paripūrā satta bojjhaṅge paripūrenti
translated: the four establishments of mindfulness have the seven factors of enlightenment as their nutriment;

original: satta bojjhaṅgā paripūrā vijjāvimuttiṁ paripūrenti;
analyzed: satta bojjhaṅgā paripūrā vijjā vimuttim paripūrenti
translated: The seven factors of awakening, when developed and cultivated, fulfil knowledge and freedom.

original: evametissā vijjāvimuttiyā āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
analyzed: evam etissā vijjā vimuttiyāḥ āhāraḥ hoti evam ca pāripūri
translated: This is how knowledge and freedom are nourished and fulfilled.🔽Suppose, monks, on a steep mountain there was a lake,

original: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, uparipabbate thullaphusitake deve vassante taṁ udakaṁ yathāninnaṁ pavattamānaṁ …pe…
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave upari pabbate thullaphusitake deve vassante tam udakam yathāninnam pavattamānam pe
translated: and the water in that lake was flowing out, not flowing in, and there was no rain, and the clouds did not pour down rain on the lake,

original: evametassa mahāsamuddassa sāgarassa āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūri.
analyzed: evam etassa mahā samuddassa sāgarassa āhāraḥ hoti evañca pāripūri
translated: this is how the great ocean is nourished and fulfilled.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, sappurisasaṁsevo paripūro saddhammassavanaṁ paripūreti …pe…
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave sappurisa sa sevaḥ paripūro saddhamma ssavanam paripūreti pe
translated: So too, monks, association with superior persons, when developed and cultivated, fulfils listening to the true Dhamma. …

original: evametissā vijjāvimuttiyā āhāro hoti, evañca pāripūrī”ti.
analyzed: evam etissā vijjā vimuttiyāḥ āhāraḥ hoti evam ca pāripūrī iti
translated: This is how knowledge and freedom are nourished and fulfilled.”

original: Dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: dutiya
translated: The second.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.63🔽7. Yamakavagga
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya  yamaka vagga
translated: The Book of the Tens

original: Niṭṭhaṅgatasutta
analyzed: niṭṭhaṅgata sutta
translated: The Completed

original: “Ye keci, bhikkhave, mayi niṭṭhaṁ gatā sabbe te diṭṭhisampannā.
analyzed: ye keci bhikkhave mayi niṭṭham gatā sabbe te diṭṭhi sampannā
translated: “Monks, those who have confidence in the Teacher have confidence in what is true.

original: Tesaṁ diṭṭhisampannānaṁ pañcannaṁ idha niṭṭhā, pañcannaṁ idha vihāya niṭṭhā.
analyzed: tesam diṭṭhi sampannānam pañcannam idha niṭṭhā pañcannam idha vihāya niṭṭhā
translated: Of those who have confidence in the true Dhamma, five are to be expected here and five are not to be expected here.

original: Katamesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha niṭṭhā?
analyzed: katamesam pañcannam idha niṭṭhā
translated: Which five are to be expected here?

original: Sattakkhattuparamassa, kolaṅkolassa, ekabījissa, sakadāgāmissa, yo ca diṭṭheva dhamme arahā—
analyzed: satta kkhattu paramassa kolaṅkolassa ekabījissa sakadāgāmissa yaḥ ca diṭṭhe iva dhamme arahā
translated: the one who attains Nibbāna in the interval, the one who attains Nibbāna upon landing, the one who attains Nibbāna without exertion, the one who attains Nibbāna with exertion, and the one who goes upstream to the highest gods.

original: imesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha niṭṭhā.
analyzed: imesam pañcannam idha niṭṭhā
translated: These five attain Nibbāna right here.

original: Katamesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha vihāya niṭṭhā?
analyzed: katamesam pañcannam idha vihāya niṭṭhā
translated: “And which five attain Nibbāna after leaving this world?

original: Antarāparinibbāyissa, upahaccaparinibbāyissa, asaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa, sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa, uddhaṁsotassa akaniṭṭhagāmino—
analyzed: antarā parinibbāyissa upahacca parinibbāyissa asaṅkhāra parinibbāyissa sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyissa uddha sotassa a kaniṭṭha gāmino
translated: the one who attains Nibbāna in the interval, the one who attains Nibbāna upon landing, the one who attains Nibbāna without exertion, the one who attains Nibbāna with exertion, and the one who goes upstream to the highest gods.

original: imesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha vihāya niṭṭhā.
analyzed: imesam pañcannam idha vihāya niṭṭhā
translated: These five attain Nibbāna after leaving this world.

original: Ye keci, bhikkhave, mayi niṭṭhaṁ gatā, sabbe te diṭṭhisampannā.🔽Tesaṁ diṭṭhisampannānaṁ imesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha niṭṭhā, imesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha vihāya niṭṭhā”ti.
analyzed: ye keci bhikkhave mayi niṭṭham gatā sabbe te diṭṭhi sampannā  tesam diṭṭhi sampannānam imesam pañcannam idha niṭṭhā imesam pañcannam idha vihāya niṭṭhāti
translated: “Bhikkhus, all those who have confidence in me have confidence in what is worthy of confidence.🔽Of those who have confidence in what is worthy of confidence, five attain Nibbāna in this very life, and five after leaving this world.”

original: Tatiyaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.64
analyzed: tatiya  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The third section on those who attain Nibbāna in this very life is finished.

original: 7. Yamakavagga
analyzed: yamaka vagga
translated: The Book of the Fives

original: Aveccappasannasutta
analyzed: aveccappasannasutta
translated: The Discourse on Those with Perfect Confidence in Me

original: “Ye keci, bhikkhave, mayi aveccappasannā, sabbe te sotāpannā.
analyzed: ye keci bhikkhave mayi avecca ppasannā sabbe te sotāpannā
translated: “Bhikkhus, all those who have perfect confidence in me have entered the stream.

original: Tesaṁ sotāpannānaṁ pañcannaṁ idha niṭṭhā, pañcannaṁ idha vihāya niṭṭhā.
analyzed: tesam sotāpannānam pañcannam idha niṭṭhā pañcannam idha vihāya niṭṭhā
translated: Of those who have entered the stream, five attain Nibbāna in this very life, and five after leaving this world.

original: Katamesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha niṭṭhā?
analyzed: katamesam pañcannam idha niṭṭhā
translated: Who are the five who are successful right here?

original: Sattakkhattuparamassa, kolaṅkolassa, ekabījissa, sakadāgāmissa, yo ca diṭṭheva dhamme arahā—
analyzed: satta kkhattu paramassa kolaṅkolassa ekabījissa sakadāgāmissa yaḥ ca diṭṭhe iva dhamme arahā
translated: One who attains nibbāna after seven rebirths, one who goes from family to family, one who is liable to one more birth, a once-returner, and one who is fully extinguished in that very life.

original: imesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha niṭṭhā.
analyzed: imesam pañcannam idha niṭṭhā
translated: These are the five who are successful right here.

original: Katamesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha vihāya niṭṭhā?
analyzed: katamesam pañcannam idha vihāya niṭṭhā
translated: Who are the five who are successful elsewhere?

original: Antarāparinibbāyissa, upahaccaparinibbāyissa, asaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa, sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyissa, uddhaṁsotassa akaniṭṭhagāmino—
analyzed: antarā parinibbāyissa upahacca parinibbāyissa asaṅkhāra parinibbāyissa sa saṅkhāra parinibbāyissa uddha sotassa a kaniṭṭha gāmino
translated: One who attains nibbāna in the interval, one who attains nibbāna upon landing, one who attains nibbāna without exertion, one who attains nibbāna with exertion, and one who goes upstream to the highest gods.

original: imesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha vihāya niṭṭhā.
analyzed: imesam pañcannam idha vihāya niṭṭhā
translated: These are the five who are successful elsewhere.

original: Ye keci, bhikkhave, mayi aveccappasannā sabbe te sotāpannā.
analyzed: ye keci bhikkhave mayi avecca ppasannā sabbe te sotāpannā
translated: Monks, all those who have perfect confidence in me are stream-enterers.🔽Of those stream-enterers, five are successful right here, and five are successful elsewhere.”

original: Tesaṁ sotāpannānaṁ imesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha niṭṭhā, imesaṁ pañcannaṁ idha vihāya niṭṭhā”ti.🔽Catutthaṁ.
analyzed: tesam sotāpannānam imesam pañcannam idha niṭṭhā imesam pañcannam idha vihāya niṭṭhāti  catuttha
translated: The fourth section on “right here” is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.65
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Fives

original: 7. Yamakavagga
analyzed: yamaka vagga
translated: The Yamaka Group

original: Paṭhamasukhasutta
analyzed: paṭhama sukha sutta
translated: Happiness (1)

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ āyasmā sāriputto magadhesu viharati nālakagāmake.
analyzed: ekam samayam āyasmā sāriputtaḥ magadhesu viharati nālakagāmake
translated: One time the Venerable Sariputta was dwelling among the Magadhans at Nalaka Village.

original: Atha kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājako yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājakaḥ yena āyasmā sāriputto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the wanderer Sāmaṇḍakāni went to Sāriputta and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājako āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājakaḥ āyasmantam sāriputtam etat avoca
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and said to Sāriputta:

original: “Kiṁ nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, sukhaṁ, kiṁ dukkhan”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho āvuso sāriputta sukha kim dukkhanti
translated: “Now, what is pleasure, and what is pain?”

original: “Abhinibbatti kho, āvuso, dukkhā, anabhinibbatti sukhā.
analyzed: abhinibbatti kho āvuso dukkhā an abhinibbatti sukhā
translated: “Rebirth, friend, is painful, non-rebirth is pleasure.

original: Abhinibbattiyā, āvuso, sati idaṁ dukkhaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ—🔽sītaṁ uṇhaṁ jighacchā pipāsā uccāro passāvo aggisamphasso daṇḍasamphasso satthasamphasso ñātīpi mittāpi saṅgamma samāgamma rosenti.
analyzed: abhinibbattiyā āvuso sati idam dukkham pāṭikaṅkha  sītam uṇham jighacchā pipāsā uccāraḥ passāvaḥ aggi samphasso daṇḍa samphasso sattha samphasso ñātī pi mittā pi saṅgamma samāgamma rosenti
translated: When there is rebirth, this suffering can be expected:

original: Abhinibbattiyā, āvuso, sati idaṁ dukkhaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ.
analyzed: abhinibbattiyā āvuso sati idam dukkham pāṭikaṅkha
translated: cold, heat, hunger, thirst, defecation, and urination, the touch of flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles. When there is rebirth, this suffering can be expected.

original: Anabhinibbattiyā, āvuso, sati idaṁ sukhaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ—
analyzed: an abhinibbattiyā āvuso sati idam sukham pāṭikaṅkha
translated: When there is no rebirth, this pleasure can be expected:

original: na sītaṁ na uṇhaṁ na jighacchā na pipāsā na uccāro na passāvo na aggisamphasso na daṇḍasamphasso na satthasamphasso ñātīpi mittāpi saṅgamma samāgamma na rosenti.
analyzed: na sītam na uṇham na jighacchā na pipāsā na uccāraḥ na passāvaḥ na aggi samphassaḥ na daṇḍa samphassaḥ na sattha samphassaḥ ñātī pi mittā api saṅgamma samāgamma na rosenti
translated: There’s no cold, no heat, no hunger, no thirst, no defecation, no urination, no burning by fire, no contact with a staff, no contact with a knife. Even relatives and friends, having gathered and assembled, don’t cause displeasure.”

original: Anabhinibbattiyā, āvuso, sati idaṁ sukhaṁ pāṭikaṅkhan”ti.
analyzed: an abhinibbattiyā āvuso sati idam sukham pāṭikaṅkhanti
translated: “When there’s no rebirth, friend, this happiness is to be expected.”

original: Pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: pañcama
translated: The fifth.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.66
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Fives

original: 7. Yamakavagga
analyzed: yamaka vagga
translated: The Greater Division

original: Dutiyasukhasutta
analyzed: dutiya sukha sutta
translated: On Happiness (Second Version)

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ āyasmā sāriputto magadhesu viharati nālakagāmake.🔽Atha kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājako yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: ekam samayam āyasmā sāriputtaḥ magadhesu viharati nālakagāmake  atha kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājakaḥ yena āyasmā sāriputto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhim sammodi
translated: One time the venerable Sariputta was living in the Magadhan lands at Nalakagama.🔽Then the wanderer Samandakakandakayana approached the venerable Sariputta and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājako āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho sāmaṇḍakāni paribbājakaḥ āyasmantam sāriputtam etat avoca
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and said to the venerable Sariputta:

original: “Kiṁ nu kho, āvuso, sāriputta, imasmiṁ dhammavinaye sukhaṁ, kiṁ dukkhan”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho āvuso sāriputta imasmin dhamma vinaye sukha kim dukkhanti
translated: “What, friend Sariputta, is happiness and what is suffering in this Dhamma and Discipline?”🔽“What do you think, friend?

original: “Anabhirati kho, āvuso, imasmiṁ dhammavinaye dukkhā, abhirati sukhā.
analyzed: an abhirati kho āvuso imasmin dhamma vinaye dukkhā abhirati sukhā
translated: “Discontent is suffering in this Dhamma-&-Vinaya. Contentment is happiness.

original: Anabhiratiyā, āvuso, sati idaṁ dukkhaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ—
analyzed: an abhiratiyā āvuso sati idam dukkham pāṭikaṅkha
translated: When there’s discontent, this suffering is to be expected:

original: gacchantopi sukhaṁ sātaṁ nādhigacchati,🔽ṭhitopi …🔽nisinnopi …
analyzed: gacchantaḥ upi sukham sātam na adhigacchati  ṭh itaḥ pi  nisinnaḥ pi
translated: Even when walking, one doesn’t attain ease & bliss.🔽Even when standing …🔽Even when sitting …

original: sayānopi …
analyzed: sa yānaḥ api
translated: Even when lying down …

original: gāmagatopi …🔽araññagatopi …🔽rukkhamūlagatopi …
analyzed: gām a gataḥ api  arañña gataḥ pi  rukkha mūla gataḥ api
translated: Even when going to the village …🔽Even when going to the wilderness …🔽Even when going to the foot of a tree …

original: suññāgāragatopi …
analyzed: suñña āgāra gataḥ pi
translated: Even when going to an empty building …

original: abbhokāsagatopi …
analyzed: ap bhokāsa gataḥ api
translated: Even when going to the open air …

original: bhikkhumajjhagatopi sukhaṁ sātaṁ nādhigacchati.🔽Anabhiratiyā, āvuso, sati idaṁ dukkhaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ.
analyzed: bhikkhu majjha gataḥ api sukham sātam na adhigacchati  an abhiratiyā āvuso sati idam dukkham pāṭikaṅkha
translated: Even when going to the midst of the monks … one doesn’t attain ease & bliss.🔽When there’s discontent, this suffering is to be expected.

original: Abhiratiyā, āvuso, sati idaṁ sukhaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ—
analyzed: abhiratiyā āvuso sati idam sukham pāṭikaṅkha
translated: When there’s contentment, this happiness is to be expected:

original: gacchantopi sukhaṁ sātaṁ adhigacchati,🔽ṭhitopi …🔽nisinnopi …
analyzed: gacchantaḥ upi sukham sātam adhigacchati  ṭh itaḥ pi  nisinnaḥ pi
translated: Even when walking, one attains ease & bliss.🔽Even when standing …🔽Even when sitting …

original: sayānopi …
analyzed: sa yānaḥ api
translated: Even when lying down …

original: gāmagatopi …🔽araññagatopi …🔽rukkhamūlagatopi …
analyzed: gām a gataḥ api  arañña gataḥ pi  rukkha mūla gataḥ api
translated: Even when going to the village …🔽Even when going to the wilderness …🔽Even when going to the foot of a tree …

original: suññāgāragatopi …
analyzed: suñña āgāra gataḥ pi
translated: Even when going to an empty building …

original: abbhokāsagatopi …
analyzed: ap bhokāsa gataḥ api
translated: Even when going to the open air …

original: bhikkhumajjhagatopi sukhaṁ sātaṁ adhigacchati.
analyzed: sukham sātam adhigacchati
translated: Even when going to the midst of the monks … one attains ease & bliss.

original: Abhiratiyā, āvuso, sati idaṁ sukhaṁ pāṭikaṅkhan”ti.
analyzed: abhiratiyā āvuso sati idam sukham pāṭikaṅkhanti
translated: When there’s contentment, this happiness is to be expected.”

original: Chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: chaṭṭha
translated: The sixth.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.67
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: Numbered Discourses The Great Chapter

original: 7. Yamakavagga
analyzed: yamaka vagga
translated: The Pairs

original: Paṭhamanaḷakapānasutta
analyzed: paṭhama naḷaka pāna sutta
translated: At Nalakapāna (Long Version)

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena naḷakapānaṁ nāma kosalānaṁ nigamo tadavasari.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim yena naḷakapānam nāma kosalānam nigamaḥ tat avasari
translated: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the Kosalan country with a large Saṅgha of monks, and eventually he arrived at a Kosalan town called Nalakapāna.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā naḷakapāne viharati palāsavane.🔽Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tadahuposathe bhikkhusaṅghaparivuto nisinno hoti.🔽Atha kho bhagavā bahudeva rattiṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā naḷaka pāne viharati palāsa vane  tena kho pana samayena bhagavā tadahuposathe bhikkhu saṅgha parivutaḥ nisinnaḥ hoti  atha kho bhagavā bahudeva rattim bhikkhūnam dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā
translated: There the Buddha stayed in the Palasa Grove.🔽On that occasion, the Buddha was sitting in the midst of the Saṅgha of monks, who were observing the uposatha.🔽Then, after instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the monks for most of the night with a teaching,

original: samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā tuṇhībhūtaṁ tuṇhībhūtaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ anuviloketvā āyasmantaṁ🔽sāriputtaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: samuttejetvā sampahasetvā tuṇhībhūtam tuṇhībhūtam bhikkhu saṅgham anuviloketvā  sāriputtam āmantesi
translated: the Buddha saw that they were weary. He then dismissed them, saying, “Monks, you may disperse.🔽My back is aching, and I will lie down.”

original: “Vigatathinamiddho kho, sāriputta, bhikkhusaṅgho.
analyzed: vigata thinamiddhaḥ kho sāriputta bhikkhu saṅghaḥ
translated: “The Saṅgha of monks is free from drowsiness, Sāriputta.

original: Paṭibhātu taṁ, sāriputta, bhikkhūnaṁ dhammī kathā.
analyzed: paṭibhātu ta sāriputta bhikkhūnam dhammī kathā
translated: Please give a teaching to the monks.

original: Piṭṭhi me āgilāyati;
analyzed: piṭṭhi me āgilāyati
translated: My back is aching,

original: tamahaṁ āyamissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam aham āyamissāmi iti
translated: and I will stretch it out.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, Venerable Sir,” Ven. Sāriputta responded to the Blessed One.

original: Atha kho bhagavā catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññāpetvā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ kappesi pāde pādaṁ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṁ manasi karitvā.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā catugguṇam saṅghāṭim paññāpetvā dakkhiṇena passena sīha seyyam kappesi pāde pādam accādhāya sataḥ sampajānaḥ uṭṭhāna saññam manasi karitvā
translated: Then the Blessed One, having arranged his outer robe folded in four, lay down on his right side in the lion’s sleeping posture, with one foot on top of the other, mindful & alert, having made a mental note to get up.

original: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: tatra kho āyasmā sāriputtaḥ bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Then Ven. Sāriputta addressed the monks,

original: “āvuso bhikkhave”ti.
analyzed: āvuso bhikkhave ti
translated: “Friends, monks!”

original: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: āvuso ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa
translated: “Friend,” the monks responded to him.

original: Āyasmā sāriputto etadavoca:🔽“Yassa kassaci, āvuso, saddhā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī natthi …🔽ottappaṁ natthi …🔽vīriyaṁ natthi …
analyzed: āyasmā sāriputtaḥ etat avoca  yassa kassaci āvuso saddhā natthi kusalesu dhammesu hirī natthi  ottappam natthi  vīriyam natthi
translated: Ven. Sāriputta said,

original: paññā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi.
analyzed: paññā natthi kusalesu dhammesu tassa yā ratti vā divasaḥ vā āgacchati hāniyā iva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi
translated: “Friends, for one who has no conviction, no conscience, no sense of shame, no learning, no persistence, and no discernment with regard to what is wholesome, whether night or day comes, only decline is to be expected in terms of wholesome qualities, not growth.

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, kāḷapakkhe candassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, hāyateva vaṇṇena hāyati maṇḍalena hāyati ābhāya hāyati ārohapariṇāhena;🔽evamevaṁ kho, āvuso, yassa kassaci saddhā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī natthi …🔽ottappaṁ natthi …🔽vīriyaṁ natthi …
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso kāḷapakkhe candassa yā ratti vā divasaḥ vā āgacchati hāyatā iva vaṇṇena hāyati maṇḍalena hāyati ābhāya hāyati āroha pariṇāhena  evam evam kho āvuso yassa kassaci saddhā natthi kusalesu dhammesu hirī natthi  ottappam natthi  vīriyam natthi
translated: Just as in the dark of the moon, whatever night it is, the moon’s beauty, brightness, luster, & light diminish,🔽so too, whatever the case that one without faith, without a sense of shame, without compunction, without learning, lazy, with diminished mindfulness, with a mind lacking clarity, with poor discernment, and without conviction in the knowledge & conviction of the noble ones, goes forth into, his bad qualities diminish.🔽Just as in the bright half of the month, whatever night it is, the moon’s beauty, brightness, luster, & light increase,🔽so too, whatever the case that one with faith, a sense of shame, compunction, learning, and persistence, with mindfulness well-established, with a mind that has clarity, with discernment, and with conviction in the knowledge & conviction of the noble ones, goes forth into, his good qualities increase.

original: paññā natthi kusalesu dhammesu, tassa yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati, hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi.🔽‘Assaddho purisapuggalo’ti, āvuso, parihānametaṁ;🔽‘ahiriko purisapuggalo’ti, āvuso, parihānametaṁ;
analyzed: paññā natthi kusalesu dhammesu tassa yā ratti vā divasaḥ vā āgacchati hāniyā iva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu no vuddhi  assaddhaḥ purisa puggalaḥ ti āvuso  ahiriko purisa puggalo ti āvuso
translated: Just as, in the dark fortnight, whatever night or day passes, the moon’s beauty, colour, & figure diminish, so too, whatever night or day passes, a person without conviction, without a sense of shame, without compunction, lazy, & lacking in wisdom sees a diminution in wholesome qualities.🔽“A person without conviction is one heading for decline…🔽A person without a sense of shame…

original: ‘anottappī purisapuggalo’ti, āvuso, parihānametaṁ;🔽‘kusīto purisapuggalo’ti, āvuso, parihānametaṁ;🔽‘duppañño purisapuggalo’ti, āvuso, parihānametaṁ;
analyzed: an uttappī purisa puggalaḥ ti āvuso  kusītaḥ purisa puggalo ti āvuso  duppaññaḥ purisa puggalo ti āvuso
translated: A person without compunction…🔽A person who is lazy…🔽A person lacking in wisdom is one heading for decline.

original: ‘kodhano purisapuggalo’ti, āvuso, parihānametaṁ;
analyzed: kodhano purisa puggalo ti āvuso
translated: “A person who is angry is one heading for decline.

original: ‘upanāhī purisapuggalo’ti, āvuso, parihānametaṁ;🔽‘pāpiccho purisapuggalo’ti, āvuso, parihānametaṁ;
analyzed: upanāhī purisa puggalo ti āvuso  pāpa iccho purisa puggalo ti āvuso
translated: It’s a loss for a person to be spiteful,🔽It’s a loss for a person to be evil,

original: ‘pāpamitto purisapuggalo’ti, āvuso, parihānametaṁ;
analyzed: pāpa mittaḥ purisa puggalaḥ ti āvuso
translated: It’s a loss for a person to have bad friends,

original: ‘micchādiṭṭhiko purisapuggalo’ti, āvuso, parihānametaṁ.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhiko purisa puggalo ti āvuso
translated: It’s a loss for a person to have wrong view.

original: Yassa kassaci, āvuso, saddhā atthi kusalesu dhammesu, hirī atthi …
analyzed: yassa kassaci āvuso saddhā atthi kusalesu dhammesu hirī atthi
