translated: They have right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right concentration, right knowledge, and right freedom.

original: imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato puggalo bahuṁ puññaṁ pasavatī”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave dasahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ puggalaḥ bahum puññam pasavati iti
translated: A person who has these ten qualities generates a lot of merit.”

original: Puggalavaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: puggala vaggo paṭhamaḥ
translated: The first sub-chapter on persons is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.167🔽17. Jāṇussoṇivagga
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya  jāṇussoṇi vagga
translated: The Book of the Tens

original: Brāhmaṇapaccorohaṇīsutta
analyzed: brāhmaṇa paccorohaṇī sutta
translated: The Brahmins’ and Householders’ Questions🔽The Discussion with the Brahmin of Proper Speech

original: Tena kho pana samayena jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo tadahuposathe sīsaṁnhāto navaṁ khomayugaṁ nivattho allakusamuṭṭhiṁ ādāya bhagavato avidūre ekamantaṁ ṭhito hoti.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ tad ahuposathe sīsa nhātaḥ navam khoma yugam nivatthaḥ allaku samuṭṭhim ādāya bhagavataḥ avidūre ekamantam ṭhitaḥ hoti
translated: On the observance day, the brahmin Jaṇussoṇi had bathed his head and put on new linen. He was holding a spray of acacia blossom and standing at one side not far from the Buddha.

original: Addasā kho bhagavā jāṇussoṇiṁ brāhmaṇaṁ tadahuposathe sīsaṁnhātaṁ navaṁ khomayugaṁ nivatthaṁ allakusamuṭṭhiṁ ādāya ekamantaṁ ṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: addasā khalu bhagavā jāṇussoṇim brāhmaṇam tadahuposathe sīsa nhātam navam khoma yugam nivattham allakusa muṭṭhim ādāya ekamantam ṭhita
translated: He saw the brahmin Janussoni, who had bathed his head that day of the sabbath, wearing new linen clothes, holding a spray of acacia blossom in his hand, standing at one side.

original: Disvāna jāṇussoṇiṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvāna jāṇussoṇim brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: Seeing him, he said to him:

original: “kiṁ nu tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, tadahuposathe sīsaṁnhāto navaṁ khomayugaṁ nivattho allakusamuṭṭhiṁ ādāya ekamantaṁ ṭhito?
analyzed: kim nu tva brāhmaṇa tadah uposathe sīsanhātaḥ navam khoma yugam allakusa muṭṭhim ādāya ekamantam ṭhitaḥ
translated: “Brahmin, why have you bathed your head on this sabbath, put on new linen clothes, taken a spray of acacia blossom in your hand, and stood at one side?

original: Kiṁ nvajja brāhmaṇakulassā”ti?
analyzed: kim nu ajja brāhmaṇa kulassa ati
translated: What is the brahmin clan doing today?”

original: “Paccorohaṇī, bho gotama, ajja brāhmaṇakulassā”ti.
analyzed: paccorohaṇī bho gotama ajja brāhmaṇa kulassa ati
translated: “Today, Master Gotama, is the brahmin clan’s New Year’s Day.”

original: “Yathā kathaṁ pana, brāhmaṇa, brāhmaṇānaṁ paccorohaṇī hotī”ti?
analyzed: yathā katham pana brāhmaṇa brāhmaṇānam paccorohaṇī hoti iti
translated: “But, brahmin, how do the brahmins observe the New Year’s Day of the brahmin clan?”

original: “Idha, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā tadahuposathe sīsaṁnhātā navaṁ khomayugaṁ nivatthā allena
analyzed: idha bho gotama brāhmaṇā navam khoma yugam allena
translated: “Here, Master Gotama, the brahmins bathe their heads on this sabbath, put on new linen clothes, and besmear the ground with fresh cow dung.

original: gomayena pathaviṁ opuñjitvā haritehi kusehi pattharitvā antarā ca velaṁ antarā ca🔽agyāgāraṁ seyyaṁ kappenti.
analyzed: gomayena pathavim opuñjitvā haritehi kusehi pattharitvā antarā ca velam antarā ca  agyāgāram seyyam kappenti
translated: Then they strew green grass there and prepare a bed there between the threshold and the door.

original: Te taṁ rattiṁ tikkhattuṁ paccuṭṭhāya pañjalikā aggiṁ namassanti:
analyzed: te tam rattim tikkhattum paccuṭṭhāya pañjalikāḥ aggim namassanti
translated: During that night they rise three times and with hands raised in salutation they worship the fire, saying:

original: ‘paccorohāma bhavantaṁ, paccorohāma bhavantan’ti.
analyzed: paccorohāma bhavanta paccorohāma bhavantanti
translated: ‘We descend to you, sir, we descend to you!’

original: Bahukena ca sappitelanavanītena aggiṁ santappenti.
analyzed: bahukena ca sappi tela navanītena aggim santappenti
translated: And they warm themselves with a lot of ghee, oil and fresh butter.

original: Tassā ca rattiyā accayena paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena brāhmaṇe santappenti.
analyzed: tassā ca rattiyā accayena paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena brāhmaṇe santappenti
translated: And when the night is over, they satisfy the brahmins with fine food to eat and eat.

original: Evaṁ, bho gotama, brāhmaṇānaṁ paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
analyzed: eva bho gotama brāhmaṇānam paccorohaṇī hoti iti
translated: That’s how the brahmins’ descent takes place.”

original: “Aññathā kho, brāhmaṇa, brāhmaṇānaṁ paccorohaṇī hoti, aññathā ca pana ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
analyzed: aññathā kho brāhmaṇa brāhmaṇānam paccorohaṇī hoti aññathā ca pana ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hoti iti
translated: “The brahmins’ descent is one thing, but the descent in the Noble One’s Discipline is another.”

original: “Yathā kathaṁ pana, bho gotama, ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hoti?
analyzed: yathā katham pana bho gotama ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hoti
translated: “But how does the descent take place in the Noble One’s Discipline?

original: Sādhu me bhavaṁ gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetu yathā ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu me bhavam gotamaḥ tathā dhammam desetu yathā ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hoti iti
translated: It would be good if the Reverend Gotama would teach me the descent in the Noble One’s Discipline.”

original: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi brāhmaṇa suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Well then, brahmin, listen and pay careful attention, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, sir,” replied Jānussoṇi.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “Idha, brāhmaṇa, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: idha brāhmaṇa ariya sāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: “Here, brahmin, a noble disciple considers this:

original: ‘pāṇātipātassa kho pāpako vipāko diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.
analyzed: pāṇātipātassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyañca ati
translated: ‘Killing living creatures has a bad result both in this life and in the next.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya pāṇātipātaṁ pajahati;
analyzed: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya pāṇa atipātam pajahati
translated: Considering this, he gives up killing living creatures,

original: pāṇātipātā paccorohati.🔽… ‘Adinnādānassa kho pāpako vipāko—
analyzed: pāṇa atipātā paccorohati  adinnādānassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: and he turns away from it.

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati
translated: … ‘Taking what is not given has a bad result both in this life and in the next.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya adinnādānaṁ pajahati;
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisaṅkhāya adinnādānam pajahati
translated: Considering this, he gives up taking what is not given,

original: adinnādānā paccorohati.🔽… ‘Kāmesumicchācārassa kho pāpako vipāko—
analyzed: a dinna ādānā paccorohati  kāmesu micchā ācārassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: and he turns away from it.

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati
translated: … ‘Misconduct has a bad result both in this life and in the next.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya kāmesumicchācāraṁ pajahati;
analyzed: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya kāmesum icchā ācāram pajahati
translated: Considering this, he gives up misconduct,

original: kāmesumicchācārā paccorohati.🔽… ‘Musāvādassa kho pāpako vipāko—
analyzed: kāmesumicchā ācārā paccorohati  musāvādassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: and he turns away from it.

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati
translated: … ‘False speech has a bad result both in this life and in the next.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya musāvādaṁ pajahati;
analyzed: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya musāvādam pajahati
translated: Considering this, he gives up false speech,

original: musāvādā paccorohati.🔽… ‘Pisuṇāya vācāya kho pāpako vipāko—
analyzed: musāvādā paccorohati  pisuṇāya vācāya kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: and he turns away from it.

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati
translated: … ‘Malicious speech has a bad result both in this life and in the next.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya pisuṇaṁ vācaṁ pajahati;
analyzed: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya pisuṇam vācam pajahati
translated: Considering this, he gives up malicious speech,🔽and he turns away from it.

original: pisuṇāya vācāya paccorohati.🔽… ‘Pharusāya vācāya kho pāpako vipāko—
analyzed: pisuṇāya vācāya paccorohati  pharusāya vācāya kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: he turns away from malicious speech.

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.🔽So iti paṭisaṅkhāya pharusaṁ vācaṁ pajahati;
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati  sā u iti paṭisaṅkhāya pharusam vācam pajahati
translated: … ‘Harsh speech has a bad result both in this life and in the next.’

original: pharusāya vācāya paccorohati.🔽… ‘Samphappalāpassa kho pāpako vipāko—
analyzed: pharusāya vācāya paccorohati  samphappalāpassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: Considering this, he gives up harsh speech and turns away from it.

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.🔽So iti paṭisaṅkhāya samphappalāpaṁ pajahati;
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati  so iti paṭisaṅkhāya samphappalāpam pajahati
translated: … ‘Idle chatter has a bad result both in this life and in the next.’

original: samphappalāpā paccorohati.🔽… ‘Abhijjhāya kho pāpako vipāko—
analyzed: samphappalāpā paccorohati  kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: Considering this, he gives up idle chatter and turns away from it.

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.🔽So iti paṭisaṅkhāya abhijjhaṁ pajahati;
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati  so iti paṭisaṅkhāya abhijjham pajahati
translated: … ‘Covetousness has a bad result both in this life and in the next.’

original: abhijjhāya paccorohati.🔽… ‘Byāpādassa kho pāpako vipāko—
analyzed: abhijjhāya paccorohati  byāpādassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: Considering this, he gives up covetousness and turns away from it.

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.🔽So iti paṭisaṅkhāya byāpādaṁ pajahati;
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati  iti paṭisaṅkhāya byāpādam pajahati
translated: … ‘Ill will has a bad result both in this life and in the next.’

original: byāpādā paccorohati.🔽… ‘Micchādiṭṭhiyā kho pāpako vipāko—
analyzed: byāpādā paccorohati  micchādiṭṭhiyā kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: Considering this, he gives up ill will and turns away from it.

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati
translated: … ‘Wrong view has a bad result both in this life and in the next.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya micchādiṭṭhiṁ pajahati;
analyzed: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya micchādiṭṭhim pajahati
translated: Having reflected thus, he abandons wrong view,

original: micchādiṭṭhiyā paccorohati.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhiyā paccorohati
translated: and so he descends from wrong view.

original: Evaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hotī”ti.
analyzed: evam kho brāhmaṇa ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hoti iti
translated: This is how there is descending in the Noble One’s Discipline.”

original: “Aññathā kho, bho gotama, brāhmaṇānaṁ paccorohaṇī hoti, aññathā ca pana ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hoti.
analyzed: aññathā kho bho gotama brāhmaṇānam paccorohaṇī hoti aññathā ca pana ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇī hoti
translated: “Master Gotama, the descending in the brahmins’ discipline is one thing, but the descending in the Noble One’s Discipline is something else.

original: Imissā, bho gotama, ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇiyā brāhmaṇānaṁ paccorohaṇī kalaṁ nāgghati soḷasiṁ.
analyzed: imissā bho gotama ariyassa vinaye paccorohaṇiyā brāhmaṇānam paccorohaṇī kalam soḷasi
translated: This descending in the Noble One’s Discipline does not equal one sixteenth part of the descending in the brahmins’ discipline.

original: Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama …pe…
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama pe
translated: Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent! …

original: upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.🔽Paṭhamaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.168
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti  paṭhama  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: From today let Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge for life.”🔽The first section for recitation on the brahmin student Jānussoṇi is finished.

original: 17. Jāṇussoṇivagga
analyzed: jāṇussoṇi vagga
translated: The Book of the Sixes

original: Ariyapaccorohaṇīsutta
analyzed: ariya paccorohaṇī sutta
translated: The Noble Descending

original: “Ariyaṁ vo, bhikkhave, paccorohaṇiṁ desessāmi.
analyzed: ariyam vaḥ bhikkhave paccorohaṇim desessāmi
translated: “Bhikkhus, I will teach you the noble descending.

original: Taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: Listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato
translated: “Yes, friend,” the bhikkhus replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: “Katamā ca, bhikkhave, ariyā paccorohaṇī?
analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave ariyā paccorohaṇī
translated: “And what’s the noble descent?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ariya sāvakaḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: A noble disciple considers thus:

original: ‘pāṇātipātassa kho pāpako vipāko—
analyzed: pāṇātipātassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: ‘Killing living beings has a bad result

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati
translated: in terms of this very life and the next.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya pāṇātipātaṁ pajahati;
analyzed: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya pāṇa atipātam pajahati
translated: Having reflected thus, he gives up killing living beings;

original: pāṇātipātā paccorohati.
analyzed: pāṇa atipātā paccorohati
translated: he descends from killing living beings.

original: … ‘Adinnādānassa kho pāpako vipāko—
analyzed: adinnādānassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: … ‘Taking what is not given has a bad result

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati
translated: in terms of this very life and the next.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya adinnādānaṁ pajahati;
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisaṅkhāya adinnādānam pajahati
translated: Having reflected thus, he gives up taking what is not given;

original: adinnādānā paccorohati.
analyzed: a dinna ādānā paccorohati
translated: he descends from taking what is not given.🔽… ‘Misconduct has a bad result

original: … ‘Kāmesumicchācārassa kho pāpako vipāko …pe…
analyzed: kāmesu micchā ācārassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ pe
translated: in terms of this very life and the next.’

original: kāmesumicchācārā paccorohati.
analyzed: kāmesumicchā ācārā paccorohati
translated: he descends from misconduct.

original: … ‘Musāvādassa kho pāpako vipāko …pe…
analyzed: musāvādassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ pe
translated: … ‘False speech has a bad result🔽in terms of this very life and the next.’

original: musāvādā paccorohati.
analyzed: musāvādā paccorohati
translated: he descends from false speech.

original: … ‘Pisuṇāya vācāya kho pāpako vipāko …pe…
analyzed: pisuṇāya vācāya kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: … ‘Malicious speech has a bad result🔽in terms of this very life and the next.’

original: pisuṇāya vācāya paccorohati.
analyzed: pisuṇāya vācāya paccorohati
translated: he descends from malicious speech.

original: … ‘Pharusāya vācāya kho pāpako vipāko …pe…
analyzed: pharusāya vācāya kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: … ‘Harsh speech has a bad result🔽in terms of this very life and the next.’

original: pharusāya vācāya paccorohati.
analyzed: pharusāya vācāya paccorohati
translated: he descends from harsh speech.

original: … ‘Samphappalāpassa kho pāpako vipāko …pe…
analyzed: samphappalāpassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ pe
translated: … ‘Meaningless speech has a bad result🔽in terms of this very life and the next.’

original: samphappalāpā paccorohati.
analyzed: samphappalāpā paccorohati
translated: he refrains from idle chatter.

original: … ‘Abhijjhāya kho pāpako vipāko …pe…
analyzed: kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ pe
translated: … ‘Covetousness has a bad result …

original: abhijjhāya paccorohati.
analyzed: abhijjhāya paccorohati
translated: he refrains from covetousness.

original: … ‘Byāpādassa kho pāpako vipāko …pe…
analyzed: byāpādassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ pe
translated: … ‘Ill will has a bad result …

original: byāpādā paccorohati.
analyzed: byāpādā paccorohati
translated: he refrains from ill will.

original: … ‘Micchādiṭṭhiyā kho pāpako vipāko diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhiyā kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati
translated: … ‘Wrong view has a bad result both in the present life and in future lives.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya micchādiṭṭhiṁ pajahati;
analyzed: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya micchādiṭṭhim pajahati
translated: Reflecting thus, he gives up wrong view,

original: micchādiṭṭhiyā paccorohati.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhiyā paccorohati

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, ariyā paccorohaṇī”ti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave ariyā paccorohaṇī iti

original: Dutiyaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.169
analyzed: dutiya  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The second🔽The Book of the Tens

original: 17. Jāṇussoṇivagga
analyzed: jāṇussoṇi vagga
translated: The Chapter with Jāṇussoṇi

original: Saṅgāravasutta
analyzed: saṅgāravasutta
translated: With Saṅgārava

original: Atha kho saṅgāravo brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho saṅgāravaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the brahmin Saṅgārava went to the Blessed One and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho saṅgāravo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saṅgāravaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and said to the Blessed One:

original: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, orimaṁ tīraṁ, kiṁ pārimaṁ tīran”ti?
analyzed: kim nu khalu bho gotama orimam kim pārimam
translated: “What, Master Gotama, is the near shore, and what is the far shore?”

original: “Pāṇātipāto kho, brāhmaṇa, orimaṁ tīraṁ, pāṇātipātā veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.
analyzed: pāṇa atipātaḥ kho brāhmaṇaḥ orimam tīra pāṇa atipātā veramaṇī pārimam tīra
translated: “Killing living beings is this shore, brahmin, and refraining from killing living beings is the further shore.

original: Adinnādānaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, orimaṁ tīraṁ, adinnādānā veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.
analyzed: adinnādānam khalu brāhmaṇaḥ orimam adinnādānā veramaṇī pārimam
translated: Taking what is not given is this shore, brahmin, and refraining from taking what is not given is the further shore.

original: Kāmesumicchācāro orimaṁ tīraṁ, kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.
analyzed: kāmesum icchācārā veramaṇī pārimam
translated: Sexual misconduct is this shore, brahmin, and refraining from sexual misconduct is the further shore.

original: Musāvādo orimaṁ tīraṁ, musāvādā veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.🔽Pisuṇā vācā orimaṁ tīraṁ, pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.🔽Pharusā vācā orimaṁ tīraṁ, pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.
analyzed: musāvādaḥ orimam tīra musāvādā veramaṇī pārimam tīra  pisuṇā vācā orimam pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī pārimam tīra  pharusā vācā orimam pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī pārimam tīra
translated: False speech is this shore, brahmin, and refraining from false speech is the further shore.🔽Malicious speech is this shore, brahmin, and refraining from malicious speech is the further shore.🔽Harsh speech is this shore, brahmin, and refraining from harsh speech is the further shore.

original: Samphappalāpo orimaṁ tīraṁ, samphappalāpā veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.🔽Abhijjhā orimaṁ tīraṁ, anabhijjhā pārimaṁ tīraṁ.🔽Byāpādo orimaṁ tīraṁ, abyāpādo pārimaṁ tīraṁ.
analyzed: samphappalāpaḥ orimam tīra samphappalāpā veramaṇī pārimam  anabhijjhā pārimam tīra  a byāpādaḥ pārimam
translated: Meaningless talk is this shore, brahmin, and refraining from meaningless talk is the further shore.🔽Covetousness is this shore, brahmin, and uncovetousness is the further shore.🔽Ill will is this shore, brahmin, and non-ill will is the further shore.

original: Micchādiṭṭhi orimaṁ tīraṁ, sammādiṭṭhi pārimaṁ tīraṁ.
analyzed: micchā diṭṭhi orimam tīra sammā diṭṭhi pārimam tīra
translated: Wrong view is this shore, brahmin, and right view is the further shore.

original: Idaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, orimaṁ tīraṁ, idaṁ pārimaṁ tīranti.
analyzed: idam khalu brāhmaṇaḥ orimam tīre idam pārimam
translated: This is the near shore, brahmin, and this is the further shore.”

original: Appakā te manussesu,🔽ye janā pāragāmino;
analyzed: appakā te manussesu  ye janā pāra gāminaḥ
translated: Among human beings,🔽there are few who go to the further shore.

original: Athāyaṁ itarā pajā,
analyzed: atha ayam itarā pajā
translated: The rest just run back and forth

original: tīramevānudhāvati.
analyzed: tīram eva anudhāvati
translated: on this very shore.

original: Ye ca kho sammadakkhāte,
analyzed: ye ca kho sammad akkhāte
translated: But those who, when the Dhamma is rightly taught,

original: dhamme dhammānuvattino;
analyzed: dhamme dhamma anuvattinaḥ
translated: practice in accordance with the Dhamma,

original: Te janā pāramessanti,
analyzed: te janāḥ pāramessanti
translated: they will go to the further shore

original: maccudheyyaṁ suduttaraṁ.
analyzed: maccudheyyam su tuttara
translated: of death, so hard to overpass.

original: Kaṇhaṁ dhammaṁ vippahāya,
analyzed: kaṇham dhammam vippahāya
translated: Abandoning the dark, unwholesome qualities,

original: Sukkaṁ bhāvetha paṇḍito;
analyzed: sukkam bhāvetha paṇḍitaḥ
translated: the wise one should develop the bright,

original: Okā anokamāgamma,
analyzed: okāḥ anokama āgamma
translated: leaving home for the houseless life,

original: Viveke yattha dūramaṁ.🔽Tatrābhiratimiccheyya,🔽hitvā kāme akiñcano;
analyzed: viveke yattha dūrama  tatra abhiratim iccheyya  hitvā kāme akiñcanaḥ
translated: to dwell alone in the forest.🔽There, desiring delight,

original: Pariyodapeyya attānaṁ,
analyzed: pariyodapeyya attāna
translated: renouncing sensual pleasures, the one without possessions,🔽the wise one should purify himself,

original: cittaklesehi paṇḍito.🔽Yesaṁ sambodhiyaṅgesu,
analyzed: citta klesehi paṇḍitaḥ  sambodhiyaṅgesu
translated: from the defilements of the mind.🔽Those whose minds are well developed

original: sammā cittaṁ subhāvitaṁ;🔽Ādānapaṭinissagge,🔽anupādāya ye ratā;
analyzed: sammā cittam su bhāvita  ādāna paṭinissagge  an upādāya ye ratā
translated: in the factors of complete awakening,🔽who delight in non-grasping,🔽in the relinquishment of acquisitions,

original: Khīṇāsavā jutimanto,
analyzed: khīṇa āsavāḥ jutimantaḥ
translated: the radiant ones with taints destroyed:

original: te loke parinibbutā”ti.🔽Tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: te loke parinibbutā ati  tatiya
translated: they are fully quenched in the world.”🔽The third section on the further shore.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.170🔽17. Jāṇussoṇivagga
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya  jāṇussoṇi vagga
translated: The Book of the Tens

original: Orimasutta
analyzed: orima sutta
translated: The This Shore

original: “Orimañca, bhikkhave, tīraṁ desessāmi pārimañca tīraṁ.
analyzed: orimañca bhikkhave tīram desessāmi pārimañca
translated: “Bhikkhus, I will teach you the this shore and the further shore.

original: Taṁ suṇātha …pe…
analyzed: tam suṇātha pe
translated: Listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: katamañca, bhikkhave, orimaṁ tīraṁ, katamañca pārimaṁ tīraṁ?
analyzed: katamam ca bhikkhave orimam tīra katamam ca pārimam tīra
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is the this shore, and what is the further shore?

original: Pāṇātipāto, bhikkhave, orimaṁ tīraṁ, pāṇātipātā veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.🔽Adinnādānaṁ orimaṁ tīraṁ, adinnādānā veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.
analyzed: pāṇa atipātaḥ bhikkhave orimam tīra pāṇa atipātā veramaṇī pārimam tīra  adinnādānā orimam tīra adinnādānā veramaṇī pārimam tīra
translated: Killing living beings is this shore, monks, abstinence from killing living beings is the further shore.🔽Taking what is not given is this shore, abstinence from taking what is not given is the further shore.

original: Kāmesumicchācāro orimaṁ tīraṁ, kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.🔽Musāvādo orimaṁ tīraṁ, musāvādā veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.🔽Pisuṇā vācā orimaṁ tīraṁ, pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.
analyzed: kāmesum icchācārā veramaṇī pārimam  musāvādaḥ orimam tīra musāvādā veramaṇī pārimam tīra  pisuṇā vācā orimam pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī pārimam tīra
translated: Unchastity is this shore, abstinence from unchastity is the further shore.🔽False speech is this shore, abstinence from false speech is the further shore.🔽Malicious speech is this shore, abstinence from malicious speech is the further shore.

original: Pharusā vācā orimaṁ tīraṁ, pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.🔽Samphappalāpo orimaṁ tīraṁ, samphappalāpā veramaṇī pārimaṁ tīraṁ.
analyzed: pharusā vācā orimam pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī pārimam tīra  samphappalāpaḥ orimam tīra samphappalāpā veramaṇī pārimam
translated: Harsh speech is this shore, abstinence from harsh speech is the further shore.🔽Loquaciousness is this shore, abstinence from loquaciousness is the further shore.

original: Abhijjhā orimaṁ tīraṁ, anabhijjhā pārimaṁ tīraṁ.🔽Byāpādo orimaṁ tīraṁ, abyāpādo pārimaṁ tīraṁ.
analyzed: anabhijjhā pārimam tīra  a byāpādaḥ pārimam
translated: Covetousness is this shore, uncovetousness is the further shore.🔽Ill-will is this shore, good-will is the further shore.

original: Micchādiṭṭhi orimaṁ tīraṁ, sammādiṭṭhi pārimaṁ tīraṁ.
analyzed: micchā diṭṭhi orimam tīra sammā diṭṭhi pārimam tīra
translated: Wrong view is this shore, right view is the further shore.

original: Idaṁ kho, bhikkhave, orimaṁ tīraṁ, idaṁ pārimaṁ tīranti.🔽Appakā te manussesu,
analyzed: idam kho bhikkhave orimam tīre idam pārimam tīran ti 🔽appakā te manussesu
translated: This, monks, is this shore, this is the further shore.

original: ye janā pāragāmino;
analyzed: ye janā pāra gāminaḥ
translated: Those people who are crossing over,

original: Athāyaṁ itarā pajā,
analyzed: atha ayam itarā pajā
translated: while the rest of the people

original: tīramevānudhāvati.
analyzed: tīram eva anudhāvati
translated: just run back and forth along the bank.

original: Ye ca kho sammadakkhāte,
analyzed: ye ca kho sammad akkhāte
translated: But those who, when the Dhamma is rightly taught,

original: dhamme dhammānuvattino;
analyzed: dhamme dhamma anuvattinaḥ
translated: practice in accordance with the Dhamma,

original: Te janā pāramessanti,
analyzed: te janāḥ pāramessanti
translated: they will cross over the realm of Death,

original: maccudheyyaṁ suduttaraṁ.
analyzed: maccudheyyam su tuttara
translated: so hard to cross over.

original: Kaṇhaṁ dhammaṁ vippahāya,
analyzed: kaṇham dhammam vippahāya
translated: Abandoning the dark, unwholesome qualities,

original: sukkaṁ bhāvetha paṇḍito;
analyzed: sukkam bhāvetha paṇḍitaḥ
translated: the wise one should develop the bright,

original: Okā anokamāgamma,
analyzed: okāḥ anokama āgamma
translated: leaving home for the houseless life,

original: viveke yattha dūramaṁ.🔽Tatrābhiratimiccheyya,🔽hitvā kāme akiñcano;
analyzed: viveke yattha dūrama  tatra abhiratim iccheyya  hitvā kāme akiñcanaḥ
translated: to dwell in the forest, far from the bustle.🔽There, desiring delight,🔽renouncing sensuality, having nothing,

original: Pariyodapeyya attānaṁ,
analyzed: pariyodapeyya attāna
translated: the wise one should purify himself,

original: cittaklesehi paṇḍito.🔽Yesaṁ sambodhiyaṅgesu,
analyzed: citta klesehi paṇḍitaḥ  sambodhiyaṅgesu
translated: from the defilements of the mind.🔽Those whose minds are well developed

original: sammā cittaṁ subhāvitaṁ;🔽Ādānapaṭinissagge,🔽anupādāya ye ratā;
analyzed: sammā cittam su bhāvita  ādāna paṭinissagge  an upādāya ye ratā
translated: in the factors of complete awakening,🔽in the relinquishing of acquisitions,🔽delighting in non-grasping,

original: Khīṇāsavā jutimanto,
analyzed: khīṇa āsavāḥ jutimantaḥ
translated: their pollutants destroyed, radiant,

original: te loke parinibbutā”ti.
analyzed: te loke parinibbutā ati
translated: they are fully extinguished in the world.”

original: Catutthaṁ.
analyzed: catuttha
translated: The fourth.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.171
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Fours

original: 17. Jāṇussoṇivagga
analyzed: jāṇussoṇi vagga
translated: The Jāṇussoṇi Group

original: Paṭhamaadhammasutta
analyzed: paṭhama adhamma sutta
translated: Bad Principles (First: Bad Principles and Bad Conduct)

original: “Adhammo ca, bhikkhave, veditabbo anattho ca;
analyzed: adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave veditabbaḥ anatthaḥ ca
translated: “Monks, bad principles and bad conduct should be known.

original: dhammo ca veditabbo attho ca.
analyzed: dhammaḥ ca veditabbaḥ atthaḥ ca
translated: Good principles and good conduct should be known.

original: Adhammañca viditvā anatthañca, dhammañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammo yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: adhammañca viditvā anatthañca dhammañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammaḥ yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabba
translated: When you know what’s contrary to the Teaching and what’s harmful, and you know what’s in accordance with the Teaching and what’s beneficial, you should practice in accordance with the Teaching and what’s beneficial.

original: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, adhammo ca anattho ca?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhikkhave adhammaḥ ca anattho ca
translated: And what is contrary to the Teaching and harmful?

original: Pāṇātipāto, adinnādānaṁ, kāmesumicchācāro, musāvādo, pisuṇā vācā, pharusā vācā, samphappalāpo, abhijjhā, byāpādo, micchādiṭṭhi—
analyzed: pāṇa atipātaḥ adinnādāna kāmesu micchācāraḥ musāvādaḥ pisuṇā vācā pharusā vācā samphappalāpaḥ abhijjhā byāpādaḥ micchādiṭṭhi
translated: Taking life, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, divisive speech, harsh speech, talking nonsense, greed, ill will, and wrong view.

original: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, adhammo ca anattho ca.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave adhammaḥ ca anattho ca
translated: This is called what’s contrary to the Teaching and harmful.

original: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, dhammo ca attho ca?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhikkhave dhammaḥ ca attho ca
translated: And what is in accordance with the Teaching and beneficial?

original: Pāṇātipātā veramaṇī, adinnādānā veramaṇī, kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇī, musāvādā veramaṇī,
analyzed: pāṇa atipātā veramaṇī adinna ādānā veramaṇī kāmesumicchā ācārā veramaṇī musāvādā veramaṇī
translated: Refraining from taking life, refraining from stealing, refraining from sexual misconduct, refraining from lying,

original: pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī, pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī, samphappalāpā veramaṇī, anabhijjhā,
analyzed: pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī samphappalāpā veramaṇī anabhijjhā
translated: refraining from divisive speech, refraining from harsh speech, refraining from talking nonsense, lack of greed,

original: abyāpādo, sammādiṭṭhi—
analyzed: a byāpādaḥ sammādiṭṭhi
translated: lack of ill will, and right view.

original: ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, dhammo ca attho ca.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave dhammo ca attho ca
translated: This is called what’s in accordance with the Teaching and beneficial.

original: ‘Adhammo ca, bhikkhave, veditabbo anattho ca;
analyzed: adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave veditabbaḥ anatthaḥ ca
translated: ‘You should know what’s contrary to the Teaching and what’s harmful,

original: dhammo ca veditabbo attho ca.
analyzed: dhammaḥ ca veditabbaḥ atthaḥ ca
translated: and you should know what’s in accordance with the Teaching and what’s beneficial.

original: Adhammañca viditvā anatthañca, dhammañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammo yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabban’ti,🔽iti yaṁ taṁ vuttaṁ, idametaṁ paṭicca vuttan”ti.
analyzed: adhammañca viditvā anatthañca dhammañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammaḥ yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabbanti  iti yam tam vutte idam etam paṭicca vuttan ti
translated: Having understood what is contrary to the Teaching and what is beneficial, and having understood what is in accordance with the Teaching and what is beneficial, you should practice in accordance with the Teaching and what is beneficial.’🔽This is the context in which it was said.

original: Pañcamaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.172
analyzed: pañcama  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The fifth section on ‘in accordance with the Teaching’ is finished.🔽The Book of the Fives

original: 17. Jāṇussoṇivagga
analyzed: jāṇussoṇi vagga
translated: The Lesser Chapter

original: Dutiyaadhammasutta
analyzed: dutiya adhamma sutta
translated: What Is Contrary to the Teaching

original: “Adhammo ca, bhikkhave, veditabbo dhammo ca;
analyzed: adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave veditabbaḥ dhammaḥ ca
translated: “Monks, what is contrary to the Teaching and what is in accordance with the Teaching should be known.

original: anattho ca veditabbo attho ca.
analyzed: anatthaḥ ca veditabbaḥ atthaḥ ca
translated: What is contrary to the benefit and what is in accordance with the benefit should be known.

original: Adhammañca viditvā dhammañca, anatthañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammo yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabban”ti.
analyzed: adhammañca viditvā dhammañca anatthañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammaḥ yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: Having understood what is contrary to the Teaching and what is in accordance with the Teaching, and having understood what is contrary to the benefit and what is in accordance with the benefit, you should practice in accordance with the Teaching and what is beneficial.”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: This is what the Buddha said.

original: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: idam vatvāna sugataḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā vihāram pāvisi
translated: Having said this, the one of excellent wisdom rose from his seat and went into his dwelling.

original: Atha kho tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ acirapakkantassa bhagavato etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho tesam bhikkhūnam acira pakkantassa bhagavato etat ahosi
translated: Then, not long after the Buddha had left, the monks thought,

original: “idaṁ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
analyzed: idam kho no āvuso bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesam uddisitvā vitthārena attham a vibhajitvā uṭṭhāya āsanā vihāram paviṭṭhaḥ
translated: “Friends, the Buddha has given this brief summary but has entered his dwelling without explaining the meaning in detail.

original: ‘adhammo ca, bhikkhave, veditabbo dhammo ca;
analyzed: adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave veditabbaḥ dhammaḥ ca
translated: “The unskillful should be known, as should the skillful.

original: anattho ca veditabbo attho ca.
analyzed: anatthaḥ ca veditabbaḥ atthaḥ ca
translated: ‘You should know what is contrary to the Teaching and what is the Teaching,🔽what is contrary to the welfare and what is the welfare.

original: Adhammañca viditvā dhammañca, anatthañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammo yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabban’ti.
analyzed: adhammañca viditvā dhammañca anatthañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammaḥ yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: Having understood what is contrary to the Teaching and what is the Teaching, what is contrary to the welfare and what is the welfare, you should practice in accordance with the Teaching and the welfare.’

original: Ko nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajeyyā”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena attham a vibhattassa vitthārena attham vibhajeyya ati
translated: Who can explain in detail the meaning of this brief statement by the Buddha?”

original: Atha kho tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho tesam bhikkhūnam etat ahosi
translated: Then the thought occurred to them,

original: “ayaṁ kho āyasmā mahākaccāno satthu ceva saṁvaṇṇito, sambhāvito ca viññūnaṁ sabrahmacārīnaṁ.
analyzed: ayam kho āyasmā mahākaccāno satthu ca iva savaṇṇitaḥ sambhāvitaḥ ca viññūnam sabrahmacārīna
translated: “This venerable Mahākaccāna is praised by the Teacher and esteemed by his knowledgeable companions in the holy life.

original: Pahoti cāyasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajituṁ.
analyzed: pahoti ca ayasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena attham a vibhattassa vitthārena attham vibhajitu
translated: He’s capable of explaining in detail the meaning of this brief statement by the Buddha.

original: Yannūna mayaṁ yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkameyyāma; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etamatthaṁ puccheyyāma.
analyzed: yat nūna mayam yena āyasmai mahākaccāno tena upasaṅkameyyāmaḥ upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam mahākaccānam etam attham puccheyyāma
translated: Let’s go to him and ask him the meaning of this.

original: Yathā no āyasmā mahākaccāno byākarissati tathā naṁ dhāressāmā”ti.
analyzed: yathā naḥ āyasmā mahākaccānaḥ byākarissati tathā nam dhāressāma ati
translated: We will remember it as the venerable Mahā Kaccāna explains it to us.”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahākaccānena saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū yena āyasmā mahākaccāno tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahākaccānena saddhim sammodisu
translated: Then the monks went to the venerable Mahā Kaccāna and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdisu ekamantam nisinnāḥ kho te bhikkhū āyasmantam mahākaccānam etat avocuḥ
translated: When they had finished they sat down to one side and told him all that had happened, adding:🔽“Let the venerable Mahā Kaccāna explain to us the meaning of this in such a way that we may remember it.”

original: “Idaṁ kho no, āvuso kaccāna, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:🔽‘adhammo ca, bhikkhave, veditabbo dhammo ca;
analyzed: idam kho no āvuso kaccāna bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesam uddisitvā vitthārena attham a vibhajitvā uṭṭhāya āsanā vihāram paviṭṭhaḥ  adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave veditabbaḥ dhammaḥ ca
translated: “Friends, the Blessed One has given this brief summary of the Dhamma and then risen from his seat and entered his dwelling without expounding its meaning in detail:

original: anattho ca veditabbo attho ca.
analyzed: anatthaḥ ca veditabbaḥ atthaḥ ca
translated: ‘Bhikkhus, the unwholesome should be known, and the wholesome should be known.🔽The disadvantageous should be known, and the advantageous should be known.

original: Adhammañca viditvā dhammañca, anatthañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammo yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabban’ti.
analyzed: adhammañca viditvā dhammañca anatthañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammaḥ yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: Having known the unwholesome and the wholesome, the disadvantageous and the advantageous, one should practise accordingly.’

original: Tesaṁ no, āvuso, amhākaṁ acirapakkantassa bhagavato etadahosi:
analyzed: tesam naḥ āvuso amhākam acira pakkantassa bhagavataḥ etat ahosi
translated: Soon after the Blessed One had gone, we thought:

original: ‘idaṁ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho—
analyzed: idam kho no āvuso bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesam uddisitvā vitthārena attham a vibhajitvā uṭṭhāya āsanā vihāram paviṭṭhaḥ
translated: ‘The Buddha gave this brief summary of the Teaching and then went into his dwelling without explaining the meaning in detail:

original: adhammo ca, bhikkhave …pe…
analyzed: adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave pe
translated: “Monks, there are these two things.

original: tathā paṭipajjitabbanti.
analyzed: tathā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: You should practice in such a way as to understand their meaning.”

original: Ko nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajeyyā’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena attham a vibhattassa vitthārena attham vibhajeyya ati
translated: Who can explain in detail the meaning of this brief summary of the Teaching that the Buddha gave before entering his dwelling?

original: Tesaṁ no, āvuso, amhākaṁ etadahosi:
analyzed: tesam naḥ āvuso amhākam
translated: And we thought,

original: ‘ayaṁ kho āyasmā mahākaccāno satthu ceva saṁvaṇṇito, sambhāvito ca viññūnaṁ sabrahmacārīnaṁ.
analyzed: ayam kho āyasmā mahākaccāno satthu ca iva savaṇṇitaḥ sambhāvitaḥ ca viññūnam sabrahmacārīna
translated: ‘Venerable Mahākaccāna is praised by the Buddha and esteemed by his wise companions in the spiritual life.

original: Pahoti cāyasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajituṁ.
analyzed: pahoti ca ayasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena attham a vibhattassa vitthārena attham vibhajitu
translated: He is capable of explaining in detail the meaning of this brief summary of the Teaching that the Buddha gave before entering his dwelling.

original: Yannūna mayaṁ yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkameyyāma; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyāma.
analyzed: yat nūna mayam yena āyasmai mahākaccāno tena upasaṅkameyyāmaḥ upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam mahākaccānam etam attham paṭipuccheyyāma
translated: Let’s go to him and ask him the meaning of this.

original: Yathā no āyasmā mahākaccāno byākarissati tathā naṁ dhāressāmā’ti.
analyzed: yathā naḥ āyasmā mahākaccānaḥ byākarissati tathā nam dhāressāma ati
translated: We will bear in mind the Dhamma as the venerable Mahā Kaccāna will explain it to us.”

original: Vibhajatu āyasmā mahākaccāno”ti.
analyzed: vibhajatu āyasmai mahākaccānoti
translated: Please explain it.”

original: “Seyyathāpi, āvuso, puriso sāratthiko sāraṁ gavesī sārapariyesanaṁ caramāno mahato
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso purisaḥ sāratthikaḥ sāram gavesī sāra pariyesanam caramānaḥ mahataḥ
translated: “Suppose a man needing heartwood, seeking heartwood, wandering in search of heartwood, would take a sharp axe and enter a forest.🔽There he would see a large plantain trunk, straight, young, without fruit-bud core.

original: rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato atikkammeva mūlaṁ atikkamma khandhaṁ sākhāpalāse sāraṁ🔽pariyesitabbaṁ maññeyya.
analyzed: rukkhassa tiṭṭhataḥ sāravataḥ atikkamma iva mūlam atikkamma khandham sākhā palāse sāra  pariyesitabbam maññeyya
translated: He would cut it down at the root, cut away the leaf-sheaths, and would find that there was no heartwood—only soft sapwood.

original: Evaṁsampadamidaṁ āyasmantānaṁ satthari sammukhībhūte taṁ bhagavantaṁ atisitvā amhe etamatthaṁ paṭipucchitabbaṁ maññatha.
analyzed: eva sampadam idam āyasmantānam satthari sammukhībhūte tam bhagavantam atisitvā amhe etam attham paṭipucchitabbam maññatha
translated: So too, venerable sirs, while the Teacher is still present, you think to question us about this matter.

original: So hāvuso, bhagavā jānaṁ jānāti passaṁ passati cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto vattā pavattā atthassa ninnetā amatassa dātā dhammassāmī tathāgato.
analyzed: saḥ ha āvuso bhagavā jānam jānāti passam passati cakkhu bhūtaḥ ñāṇa bhūtaḥ dhamma bhūtaḥ brahma bhūtaḥ vattā pavattā atthassa ninnetā amatassa dātā dhamma ssāmī tathāgato
translated: The Blessed One, venerable sirs, knows and sees, the Teacher, the One with Eyes, the One with Vision, the Well-gone One, the One who knows the worlds, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha.

original: So ceva panetassa kālo ahosi yaṁ tumhe bhagavantaṁyeva upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyātha.
analyzed: saḥ ca iva pana itassa kālaḥ ahosi yam tumhe bhagavantayā iva upasaṅkamitvā etam attham paṭipuccheyyātha
translated: This was the time, venerable sirs, when you should have questioned the Blessed One about this matter.🔽The Blessed One would have known it thus.

original: Yathā vo bhagavā byākareyya tathā naṁ dhāreyyāthā”ti.
analyzed: yathā vaḥ bhagavā byākareyya tathā nam dhāreyyātha ati
translated: You should remember it thus.”

original: “Addhā, āvuso kaccāna, bhagavā jānaṁ jānāti passaṁ passati cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto vattā pavattā atthassa ninnetā amatassa dātā dhammassāmī tathāgato.
analyzed: addhā āvuso kaccāna bhagavā jānam jānāti passam passati cakkhu bhūtaḥ ñāṇa bhūtaḥ dhamma bhūtaḥ brahma bhūtaḥ vattā pavattā atthassa ninnetā amatassa dātā dhamma ssāmī tathāgato
translated: “Surely, friend Kaccana, the Blessed One is one who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened, and he has declared this matter in various ways.🔽But it is time, friend Kaccana, for the Blessed One to be worshipped by you.

original: So ceva panetassa kālo ahosi yaṁ mayaṁ bhagavantaṁyeva upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyāma.
analyzed: saḥ ca iva pana itassa kālaḥ ahosi yam mayam bhagavantayā iva upasaṅkamitvā etam attham paṭipuccheyyāma
translated: You should go to the Blessed One and ask him about the meaning of this.

original: Yathā no bhagavā byākareyya tathā naṁ dhāreyyāma.
analyzed: yathā naḥ bhagavā byākareyya tathā nam dhāreyyāma
translated: As the Blessed One explains it to you, so you should remember it.”

original: Api cāyasmā mahākaccāno satthu ceva saṁvaṇṇito, sambhāvito ca viññūnaṁ sabrahmacārīnaṁ.
analyzed: api ca ayasmai mahākaccāno satthu ca iva savaṇṇitaḥ sambhāvitaḥ ca viññūnam sabrahmacārīna
translated: “But, friend, the venerable Maha Kaccana is praised by the Teacher and esteemed by his wise companions in the holy life.

original: Pahoti cāyasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajituṁ.
analyzed: pahoti ca ayasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena attham a vibhattassa vitthārena attham vibhajitu
translated: He is capable of expounding the detailed meaning of this summary given in brief by the Blessed One without expounding the detailed meaning.

original: Vibhajatāyasmā mahākaccāno agaruṁ karitvā”ti.
analyzed: vibhajata ayasmai mahākaccāno agarum karitvā ati
translated: Let the venerable Maha Kaccana expound it without finding it troublesome.”

original: “Tena hāvuso, suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena ha āvuso suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Then listen and pay careful attention to what I will say.”

original: “Evaṁ, āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahākaccānassa paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva āvuso ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmataḥ mahākaccānassa paccassosu
translated: “Yes, friend,” those monks replied.

original: Athāyasmā mahākaccāno etadavoca:
analyzed: atha ayasmai mahākaccāno etat avoca
translated: The Venerable Mahā Kaccāna said this:

original: “Yaṁ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
analyzed: yam kho no āvuso bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesam uddisitvā vitthārena attham a vibhajitvā uṭṭhāya āsanā vihāram paviṭṭhaḥ
translated: “Friends, the Blessed One rose from his seat and went into his dwelling after giving a brief presentation of the Dhamma and returning without explaining the meaning in detail:

original: ‘adhammo ca, bhikkhave, veditabbo …pe…
analyzed: adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave veditabbaḥ pe
translated: ‘Bhikkhus, the undhamma should be understood, and the dhamma should be understood.🔽The non-dhamma should be understood, and the dhamma should be understood.

original: tathā paṭipajjitabban’ti.
analyzed: tathā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: Having understood the undhamma and the dhamma, having understood the non-dhamma and the dhamma, one should practice in accordance with the dhamma.’

original: Katamo cāvuso, adhammo; katamo ca dhammo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca āvuso adhammo katamaḥ ca dhammo
translated: “Now, friends, what is the undhamma, and what is the dhamma?

original: Katamo ca anattho, katamo ca attho?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca anattho katamaḥ ca attho
translated: What is the non-dhamma, and what is the dhamma?

original: Pāṇātipāto, āvuso, adhammo;
analyzed: pāṇa atipātaḥ āvuso adhammaḥ
translated: “Taking life, friends, is the undhamma;

original: pāṇātipātā veramaṇī dhammo;
analyzed: pāṇātipātā veramaṇī dhammo
translated: abstaining from taking life is the dhamma.

original: ye ca pāṇātipātapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: ye ca pāṇātipāta paccayā aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: The many evil unwholesome states that originate with taking life as condition are non-dhamma;

original: pāṇātipātā veramaṇipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.
analyzed: pāṇātipātāḥ veramaṇi paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam attho
translated: the many wholesome states that originate with abstaining from taking life as condition are the dhamma.

original: Adinnādānaṁ, āvuso, adhammo;
analyzed: a dinna ādānaḥ āvuso adhammaḥ
translated: “Taking what is not given is the undhamma;

original: adinnādānā veramaṇī dhammo;🔽ye ca adinnādānapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: a dinna ādānā veramaṇī  ye ca adinnādāna paccayā aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: Not taking what is not given is a rule of Dhamma;🔽and the many bad, unwholesome things that come from taking what is not given are unbeneficial,

original: adinnādānā veramaṇipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.
analyzed: adinna ādānā veramaṇi paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam attho
translated: while the many wholesome things that come from not taking what is not given are beneficial.

original: Kāmesumicchācāro, āvuso, adhammo;
analyzed: kāmesu micchā ācāraḥ āvuso adhammo
translated: Sexual misconduct is an unwholesome state;

original: kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇī dhammo;
analyzed: kāmesumicchā ācārā veramaṇī dhammo
translated: not engaging in sexual misconduct is a wholesome state;

original: ye ca kāmesumicchācārapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: ye ca kāmesu micchā ācāra paccayā aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: and the many bad, unwholesome things that come from sexual misconduct are unbeneficial,

original: kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.
analyzed: kāmesumicchā ācārāḥ veramaṇi paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam attho
translated: while the many wholesome things that come from not engaging in sexual misconduct are beneficial.

original: Musāvādo, āvuso, adhammo;
analyzed: musāvādaḥ āvuso adhammo
translated: False speech is an unwholesome state;

original: musāvādā veramaṇī dhammo;
analyzed: musāvādāḥ veramaṇī dhammo
translated: not engaging in false speech is a wholesome state;

original: ye ca musāvādapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: ye ca musāvāda paccayā aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: and the many bad, unwholesome things that come from false speech are unbeneficial,

original: musāvādā veramaṇipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.
analyzed: musāvādāḥ veramaṇi paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam attho
translated: while the many wholesome things that come from not engaging in false speech are beneficial.

original: Pisuṇā vācā, āvuso, adhammo;
analyzed: pisuṇā vācā āvuso adhammo
translated: Slander is an unwholesome state;

original: pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī dhammo;🔽ye ca pisuṇāvācāpaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī dhammo  ye ca pisuṇa avācā paccayāḥ aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: Not speaking maliciously is a quality of the Dhamma.🔽The many bad unwholesome qualities that come about with malicious speech are unbeneficial.

original: pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.🔽Pharusā vācā, āvuso, adhammo;
analyzed: pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇi paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam atthaḥ  pharusā vācā āvuso adhammo
translated: The many wholesome qualities that come about with not speaking maliciously are beneficial.🔽Harsh speech is not a quality of the Dhamma.

original: pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī dhammo;🔽ye ca pharusāvācāpaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī  ye ca pharusa avācā paccayāḥ aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: Not speaking harshly is a quality of the Dhamma.🔽The many bad unwholesome qualities that come about with harsh speech are unbeneficial.🔽The many wholesome qualities that come about with not speaking harshly are beneficial.

original: pharusāya vācāya veramaṇipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.🔽Samphappalāpo, āvuso, adhammo;
analyzed: pharusāya vācāya veramaṇi paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam atthaḥ  samphappalāpaḥ āvuso adhammaḥ
translated: Senseless chatter is not a quality of the Dhamma.

original: samphappalāpā veramaṇī dhammo;🔽ye ca samphappalāpapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: samphappalāpā veramaṇī dhammo  ye ca samphappalāpa paccayā aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: Not engaging in senseless chatter is a quality of the Dhamma.🔽The many bad unwholesome qualities that come about with senseless chatter are unbeneficial.

original: samphappalāpā veramaṇipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.
analyzed: samphappalāpāḥ veramaṇi paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam attho
translated: The many wholesome qualities that come about with not engaging in senseless chatter are beneficial.

original: Abhijjhā, āvuso, adhammo;
analyzed: abhijjhā āvuso adhammaḥ
translated: Covetousness is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: anabhijjhā dhammo;
analyzed: anabhijjhāḥ dhammaḥ
translated: non-covetousness is in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: ye ca abhijjhāpaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: ye ca abhijjhā paccayā aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: The many evil unwholesome qualities that originate with covetousness as condition are contrary to the Dhamma;

original: anabhijjhāpaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.
analyzed: anabhijjhā paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam attho
translated: the many wholesome qualities that reach fullness by development with non-covetousness as condition are in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: Byāpādo, āvuso, adhammo;
analyzed: byāpādaḥ āvuso adhammaḥ
translated: Ill will is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: abyāpādo dhammo;
analyzed: a byāpādaḥ dhammo
translated: non-ill will is in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: ye ca byāpādapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: ye ca byāpāda paccayā aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: The many evil unwholesome qualities that originate with ill will as condition are contrary to the Dhamma;

original: abyāpādapaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.
analyzed: a byāpāda paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam attho
translated: the many wholesome qualities that reach fullness by development with non-ill will as condition are in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: Micchādiṭṭhi, āvuso, adhammo;
analyzed: micchā diṭṭhi āvuso adhammaḥ
translated: Wrong view is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: sammādiṭṭhi dhammo;
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi dhammaḥ
translated: right view is in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: ye ca micchādiṭṭhipaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: ye ca micchādiṭṭhi paccayā aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: The many evil unwholesome qualities that originate with wrong view as condition are contrary to the Dhamma;

original: sammādiṭṭhipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam attho
translated: the many wholesome qualities that reach fullness by development with right view as condition are in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: ‘Yaṁ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho—
analyzed: yam kho no āvuso bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesam uddisitvā vitthārena attham a vibhajitvā uṭṭhāya āsanā vihāram paviṭṭhaḥ
translated: ‘Friends, the Buddha gave this brief summary of the Teaching and then entered his dwelling without explaining the meaning in detail:

original: adhammo ca, bhikkhave, veditabbo …pe…
analyzed: adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave veditabbaḥ pe
translated: ‘You should know what is contrary to the true Teaching …

original: tathā paṭipajjitabban’ti.
analyzed: tathā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: and you should practice in accordance with the true Teaching.’

original: Imassa kho ahaṁ, āvuso, bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi.🔽Ākaṅkhamānā ca pana tumhe, āvuso, bhagavantaṁyeva upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyātha.
analyzed: imassa kho aha āvuso bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena attham avibhattassa evam vitthārena attham ājānāmi  ākaṅkhamānā ca pana tumhe āvuso bhagavantayā iva upasaṅkamitvā etam attham paṭipuccheyyātha
translated: This is how I understand the detailed meaning of the brief summary given by the Buddha.🔽If you wish, you can go to the Buddha and ask him about this.

original: Yathā no bhagavā byākaroti tathā naṁ dhāreyyāthā”ti.
analyzed: yathā naḥ bhagavā byākaroti tathā nam dhāreyyātha ati
translated: You should remember it in accordance with his answer.”

original: “Evamāvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahākaccānassa bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā
analyzed: evam āvuso ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmataḥ mahākaccānassa bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā
translated: “Yes, friend,” they replied, and after rejoicing in and approving of what Mahā Kaccāna had said,

original: uṭṭhāyāsanā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā
analyzed: uṭṭhāya āsanā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamiṣu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā
translated: they got up from their seats and went to the Buddha. They bowed, sat down to one side,🔽and said,

original: ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: ekamantam nisīdisu ekamantam nisinnāḥ kho te bhikkhū bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: and said to him:

original: “Yaṁ kho no, bhante, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
analyzed: yam kho naḥ bhante bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesam uddisitvā vitthārena attham a vibhajitvā uṭṭhāya āsanā vihāram paviṭṭhaḥ
translated: “Venerable Sir, after giving a brief teaching to the monks, you entered your dwelling and said:

original: ‘adhammo ca, bhikkhave, veditabbo …pe…
analyzed: adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave veditabbaḥ pe
translated: ‘Monks, you should know what is contrary to the true Teaching …

original: tathā paṭipajjitabban’ti.
analyzed: tathā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: you should practice in such a way.’

original: Tesaṁ no, bhante, amhākaṁ acirapakkantassa bhagavato etadahosi:
analyzed: tesam naḥ bhante amhākam acira pakkantassa bhagavato etat ahosi
translated: Soon after you left, we thought:

original: ‘idaṁ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
analyzed: idam kho no āvuso bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesam uddisitvā vitthārena attham a vibhajitvā uṭṭhāya āsanā vihāram paviṭṭhaḥ
translated: ‘The Buddha gave a brief teaching and then entered his dwelling without explaining the meaning in detail.

original: “adhammo ca, bhikkhave, veditabbo …pe…
analyzed: adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave veditabbaḥ pe
translated: “Monks, you should know what is contrary to the true Teaching …

original: tathā paṭipajjitabban”ti.
analyzed: tathā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: you should practice in such a way.”

original: Ko nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajeyyā’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena attham a vibhattassa vitthārena attham vibhajeyya ati
translated: Who should explain in detail the meaning of this brief statement by the Buddha?”

original: Tesaṁ no, bhante, amhākaṁ etadahosi:
analyzed: tesam naḥ bhante amhākam etat ahosi
translated: And we thought:

original: ‘ayaṁ kho āyasmā mahākaccāno satthu ceva saṁvaṇṇito, sambhāvito ca viññūnaṁ sabrahmacārīnaṁ.
analyzed: ayam kho āyasmā mahākaccāno satthu ca iva savaṇṇitaḥ sambhāvitaḥ ca viññūnam sabrahmacārīna
translated: ‘Venerable Mahā Kaccāna is praised by the Teacher and esteemed by his wise companions in the holy life.

original: Pahoti cāyasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajituṁ.
analyzed: pahoti ca ayasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena attham a vibhattassa vitthārena attham vibhajitu
translated: He is capable of expounding the detailed meaning of this summary given in brief by the Blessed One without expounding the detailed meaning.

original: Yannūna mayaṁ yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkameyyāma; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyāma.
analyzed: yat nūna mayam yena āyasmai mahākaccāno tena upasaṅkameyyāmaḥ upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam mahākaccānam etam attham paṭipuccheyyāma
translated: Let us go to him and ask him the meaning of this.

original: Yathā no āyasmā mahākaccāno byākarissati tathā naṁ dhāressāmā’ti.
analyzed: yathā naḥ āyasmā mahākaccānaḥ byākarissati tathā nam dhāressāma ati
translated: As he explains it to us, so we will bear it in mind.’

original: Atha kho mayaṁ, bhante, yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkamimhā; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etamatthaṁ apucchimhā.
analyzed: atha kho bhante yena āyasmā mahākaccāno tena upasaṅkamimha upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam mahākaccānam etam attham apucchimhā
translated: So we went to him and asked him the meaning,

original: Tesaṁ no, bhante, āyasmatā mahākaccānena imehi akkharehi imehi padehi imehi byañjanehi attho suvibhatto”ti.
analyzed: tesam naḥ bhante āyasmatā mahākaccānena imehi akkharehi imehi padehi imehi byañjanehi atthaḥ su vibhattaḥ ti
translated: and he explained it to us with these terms, phrases, and syllables.”

original: “Sādhu sādhu, bhikkhave.
analyzed: sādhu sādhu bhikkhave
translated: “Good, good, monks!

original: Paṇḍito, bhikkhave, mahākaccāno. Mahāpañño, bhikkhave, mahākaccāno.
analyzed: paṇḍitaḥ bhikkhave mahākaccānaḥ mahā paññaḥ bhikkhave mahākaccānaḥ
translated: The venerable Mahā Kaccāna is wise, bhikkhus, Mahā Kaccāna has great wisdom.

original: Mañcepi tumhe, bhikkhave, upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyātha, ahampi cetaṁ evamevaṁ byākareyyaṁ yathā taṁ mahākaccānena byākataṁ.
analyzed: mañce pi tumhe bhikkhave upasaṅkamitvā etam attham paṭipuccheyyātha aham pi ca itam evam evam byākareyyam yathā tam mahākaccānena byākata
translated: If you had approached me and asked me the meaning, I would have explained it to you in the same way that Mahā Kaccāna has explained it.

original: Eso ceva tassa attho. Evañca naṁ dhāreyyāthā”ti.
analyzed: esaḥ ca iva tassa atthaḥ evam ca nam dhāreyyātha ati
translated: That is the meaning of this, and so you should remember it.”

original: Chaṭṭhaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.173
analyzed: chaṭṭha  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The sixth chapter🔽The Book of the Sixes

original: 17. Jāṇussoṇivagga
analyzed: jāṇussoṇi vagga
translated: The Group on Jāṇussoṇi

original: Tatiyaadhammasutta
analyzed: tatiya adhamma sutta
translated: On What Is Not Dhamma, Etc.

original: “Adhammo ca, bhikkhave, veditabbo dhammo ca;
analyzed: adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave veditabbaḥ dhammaḥ ca
translated: “Bhikkhus, what is not dhamma should be understood, and what is dhamma should be understood;

original: anattho ca veditabbo attho ca.
analyzed: anatthaḥ ca veditabbaḥ atthaḥ ca
translated: what is not beneficial should be understood, and what is beneficial should be understood.

original: Adhammañca viditvā dhammañca, anatthañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammo yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabbaṁ.
analyzed: adhammañca viditvā dhammañca anatthañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammaḥ yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabba
translated: Having understood what is not dhamma and what is dhamma, what is not beneficial and what is beneficial, you should practice in accordance with what is dhamma and beneficial.

original: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, adhammo, katamo ca dhammo;
analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhikkhave adhammaḥ katamaḥ ca dhammo
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is not dhamma, and what is dhamma?

original: katamo ca anattho, katamo ca attho?🔽Pāṇātipāto, bhikkhave, adhammo;
analyzed: katamaḥ ca anattho katamaḥ ca attho  pāṇātipātaḥ bhikkhave adhammaḥ
translated: What is not beneficial, and what is beneficial?🔽Killing living beings is not dhamma;

original: pāṇātipātā veramaṇī dhammo;
analyzed: pāṇātipātā veramaṇī dhammo
translated: abstaining from killing living beings is dhamma;

original: ye ca pāṇātipātapaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: ye ca pāṇātipāta paccayā aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: The many bad, unwholesome qualities that come about with killing living beings are the disadvantage,

original: pāṇātipātā veramaṇipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.
analyzed: pāṇātipātāḥ veramaṇi paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam attho
translated: while the many wholesome qualities that reach fullness of development with abstention from killing living beings are the benefit.

original: Adinnādānaṁ, bhikkhave, adhammo;
analyzed: adinna ādāna bhikkhave adhammaḥ
translated: Taking what is not given is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: adinnādānā veramaṇī dhammo …
analyzed: a dinna ādānā veramaṇī
translated: Abstention from taking what is not given is in accordance with the Dhamma. …

original: kāmesumicchācāro, bhikkhave, adhammo;
analyzed: kāmesu micchā ācāraḥ bhikkhave adhammaḥ
translated: Sexual misconduct is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇī dhammo …
analyzed: kāmesumicchā ācārā veramaṇī dhammo
translated: Abstention from sexual misconduct is in accordance with the Dhamma. …

original: musāvādo, bhikkhave, adhammo;
analyzed: musāvādaḥ bhikkhave adhammaḥ
translated: False speech is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: musāvādā veramaṇī dhammo …
analyzed: musāvādāḥ veramaṇī dhammo
translated: Abstention from false speech is in accordance with the Dhamma. …

original: pisuṇā vācā, bhikkhave, adhammo;
analyzed: pisuṇā vācā bhikkhave adhammaḥ
translated: Malicious speech is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī dhammo …
analyzed: pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī dhammaḥ
translated: Abstention from malicious speech is in accordance with the Dhamma. …

original: pharusā vācā, bhikkhave, adhammo;
analyzed: pharusā vācā bhikkhave adhammaḥ
translated: Harsh speech is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī dhammo …
analyzed: pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī
translated: Abstention from harsh speech is in accordance with the Dhamma. …

original: samphappalāpo, bhikkhave, adhammo;
analyzed: samphappalāpaḥ bhikkhave adhammaḥ
translated: Idle chatter is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: samphappalāpā veramaṇī dhammo …
analyzed: samphappalāpā veramaṇī dhammo
translated: Abstention from idle chatter is in accordance with the Dhamma. …

original: abhijjhā, bhikkhave, adhammo;
analyzed: abhijjhā bhikkhave adhammaḥ
translated: Covetousness is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: anabhijjhā dhammo …
analyzed: anabhijjhāḥ dhammaḥ
translated: Non-covetousness is in accordance with the Dhamma. …

original: byāpādo, bhikkhave, adhammo;
analyzed: byāpādaḥ bhikkhave adhammaḥ
translated: Ill will is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: abyāpādo dhammo ….
analyzed: a byāpādaḥ dhammo
translated: Non-ill will is in accordance with the Dhamma. …

original: Micchādiṭṭhi, bhikkhave, adhammo;
analyzed: micchā diṭṭhi bhikkhave adhammaḥ
translated: Wrong view is contrary to the Dhamma;

original: sammādiṭṭhi dhammo;
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi dhammaḥ
translated: Right view is a quality of the Dhamma.

original: ye ca micchādiṭṭhipaccayā aneke pāpakā akusalā dhammā sambhavanti, ayaṁ anattho;
analyzed: ye ca micchādiṭṭhi paccayā aneke pāpakāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ sambhavanti ayam anatthaḥ
translated: The many bad unwholesome qualities that arise with wrong view are a danger.

original: sammādiṭṭhipaccayā ca aneke kusalā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṁ gacchanti, ayaṁ attho.
analyzed: sammādiṭṭhi paccayā ca aneke kusalāḥ dhammāḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchanti ayam attho
translated: The many wholesome qualities that reach fulfillment by development with right view are a benefit.

original: ‘Adhammo ca, bhikkhave, veditabbo dhammo ca;
analyzed: adhammaḥ ca bhikkhave veditabbaḥ dhammaḥ ca
translated: ‘The unwholesome should be understood, and the wholesome.

original: anattho ca veditabbo attho ca.
analyzed: anatthaḥ ca veditabbaḥ atthaḥ ca
translated: The disadvantageous should be understood, and the advantageous.

original: Adhammañca viditvā dhammañca, anatthañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammo yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabban’ti,
analyzed: adhammañca viditvā dhammañca anatthañca viditvā atthañca yathā dhammaḥ yathā attho tathā paṭipajjitabbanti
translated: Having understood the unwholesome and the wholesome, the disadvantageous and the advantageous, one should practice accordingly.’

original: iti yaṁ taṁ vuttaṁ, idametaṁ paṭicca vuttan”ti.🔽Sattamaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.174
analyzed: iti yam tam vutte idam etam paṭicca vuttan ti  sattama  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: This is the meaning of what the Blessed One said in brief.🔽The seventh section on “as in the case of Jānussoṇi” is finished.

original: 17. Jāṇussoṇivagga
analyzed: jāṇussoṇi vagga
translated: The Book of the Elevens

original: Kammanidānasutta
analyzed: kammanidāna sutta
translated: The Source of Action

original: “Pāṇātipātampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, tividhaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: pāṇa atipātam pāha bhikkhave tividham vadāmi
translated: “Monks, I say that killing living beings is threefold:

original: lobhahetukampi, dosahetukampi, mohahetukampi.
analyzed: lobha hetukam pi dosa hetukam pi moha hetukam pi
translated: caused by greed, caused by hatred, and caused by delusion.

original: Adinnādānampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, tividhaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: adinnādānam pa aha bhikkhave tividham vadāmi
translated: I say that taking what is not given is threefold:

original: lobhahetukampi, dosahetukampi, mohahetukampi.
analyzed: lobha hetukam pi dosa hetukam pi moha hetukam pi
translated: caused by greed, caused by hatred, and caused by delusion.

original: Kāmesumicchācārampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, tividhaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: bhikkhave tividham vadāmi
translated: I say that sexual misconduct is of three kinds:

original: lobhahetukampi, dosahetukampi, mohahetukampi.
analyzed: lobha hetukam pi dosa hetukam pi moha hetukam pi
translated: caused by greed, caused by hatred, and caused by delusion.

original: Musāvādampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, tividhaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: musāvādam pāha bhikkhave tividham vadāmi
translated: I say that lying is of three kinds:

original: lobhahetukampi, dosahetukampi, mohahetukampi.
analyzed: lobha hetukam pi dosa hetukam pi moha hetukam pi
translated: caused by greed, caused by hatred, and caused by delusion.

original: Pisuṇavācampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, tividhaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: pisuṇa vācam pāha bhikkhave tividham vadāmi
translated: I say that malicious speech is of three kinds:

original: lobhahetukampi, dosahetukampi, mohahetukampi.
analyzed: lobha hetukam pi dosa hetukam pi moha hetukam pi
translated: caused by greed, caused by hatred, and caused by delusion.

original: Pharusavācampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, tividhaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: pharusa vācam pāha bhikkhave tividham vadāmi
translated: I say that harsh speech is of three kinds:

original: lobhahetukampi, dosahetukampi, mohahetukampi.
analyzed: lobha hetukam pi dosa hetukam pi moha hetukam pi
translated: caused by greed, caused by hatred, and caused by delusion.

original: Samphappalāpampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, tividhaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: samphappalāpam pāha bhikkhave tividham vadāmi
translated: I say that idle chatter is of three kinds:

original: lobhahetukampi, dosahetukampi, mohahetukampi.
analyzed: lobha hetukam pi dosa hetukam pi moha hetukam pi
translated: caused by greed, caused by hatred, and caused by delusion.

original: Abhijjhampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, tividhaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: abhijjhampa aha bhikkhave tividham vadāmi
translated: I say that covetousness is of three kinds:

original: lobhahetukampi, dosahetukampi, mohahetukampi.
analyzed: lobha hetukam pi dosa hetukam pi moha hetukam pi
translated: caused by greed, caused by hatred, and caused by delusion.

original: Byāpādampāhaṁ, bhikkhave, tividhaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: byāpādam pāha bhikkhave tividham vadāmi
translated: I say that ill will is of three kinds:

original: lobhahetukampi, dosahetukampi, mohahetukampi.
analyzed: lobha hetukam pi dosa hetukam pi moha hetukam pi
translated: caused by greed, caused by hatred, and caused by delusion.

original: Micchādiṭṭhimpāhaṁ, bhikkhave, tividhaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhim pa āha bhikkhave tividham vadāmi
translated: I say that wrong view is of three kinds:

original: lobhahetukampi, dosahetukampi, mohahetukampi.
analyzed: lobha hetukam pi dosa hetukam pi moha hetukam pi
translated: for the sake of greed, for the sake of hatred, for the sake of delusion.

original: Iti kho, bhikkhave, lobho kammanidānasambhavo, doso kammanidānasambhavo, moho kammanidānasambhavo.🔽Lobhakkhayā kammanidānasaṅkhayo, dosakkhayā kammanidānasaṅkhayo, mohakkhayā kammanidānasaṅkhayo”ti.
analyzed: iti kho bhikkhave lobhaḥ kamma nidāna sambhavaḥ dosaḥ kamma nidāna sambhavaḥ mohaḥ kamma nidāna sambhavaḥ  lobha kkhayā kamma nidāna saṅkhayaḥ dosa kkhayā kamma nidāna saṅkhayaḥ moha kkhayā kamma nidāna saṅkhayaḥ iti
translated: So greed is the source and origin of actions, hatred is the source and origin of actions, delusion is the source and origin of actions.

original: Aṭṭhamaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.175
analyzed: aṭṭhama  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: With the destruction of greed, the source and origin of actions is destroyed; with the destruction of hatred, the source and origin of actions is destroyed; with the destruction of delusion, the source and origin of actions is destroyed.”🔽The eighth section on the source and origin of actions is finished.

original: 17. Jāṇussoṇivagga
analyzed: jāṇussoṇi vagga
translated: The Book of the Elevens

original: Parikkamanasutta
analyzed: parikkamana sutta
translated: The Way Out

original: “Saparikkamano ayaṁ, bhikkhave, dhammo, nāyaṁ dhammo aparikkamano.
analyzed: sa parikkamanaḥ bhikkhave dhammo na ayam dhammo a parikkamanaḥ
translated: “Monks, this Dhamma is with way out, not without way out.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, saparikkamano ayaṁ dhammo, nāyaṁ dhammo aparikkamano?
analyzed: kathañca bhikkhave sa parikkamanaḥ ayam dhammo na ayam dhammo aparikkamanaḥ
translated: And how is this Dhamma with way out, not without way out?

original: Pāṇātipātissa, bhikkhave, pāṇātipātā veramaṇī parikkamanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: pāṇātipātissa bhikkhave pāṇātipātā veramaṇī parikkamanam hoti
translated: For one who kills living beings, the way out is abstaining from killing living beings.

original: Adinnādāyissa, bhikkhave, adinnādānā veramaṇī parikkamanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: adinnādāyissa bhikkhave adinnādānā veramaṇī parikkamanam hoti
translated: For one who takes what is not given, the way out is abstaining from taking what is not given.

original: Kāmesumicchācārissa, bhikkhave, kāmesumicchācārā veramaṇī parikkamanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: kāmesu micchācārissa bhikkhave kāmesu micchācārā veramaṇī parikkamanam hoti
translated: For one who engages in sensual misconduct, the way out is abstaining from sensual misconduct.

original: Musāvādissa, bhikkhave, musāvādā veramaṇī parikkamanaṁ hoti.🔽Pisuṇavācassa, bhikkhave, pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī parikkamanaṁ hoti.🔽Pharusavācassa, bhikkhave, pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī parikkamanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: musāvādissa bhikkhave musāvādā veramaṇī parikkamanam hoti  pisuṇa vācassa bhikkhave pisuṇāya vācāya veramaṇī parikkamanam hoti  pharusa vācassa bhikkhave pharusāya vācāya veramaṇī parikkamanam hoti
translated: For one who lies, the way to avoid it is to refrain from lying.🔽For one who engages in divisive speech, the way to avoid it is to refrain from divisive speech.🔽For one who engages in harsh speech, the way to avoid it is to refrain from harsh speech.

original: Samphappalāpissa, bhikkhave, samphappalāpā veramaṇī parikkamanaṁ hoti.🔽Abhijjhālussa, bhikkhave, anabhijjhā parikkamanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: samphappalāpissa bhikkhave samphappalāpā veramaṇī parikkamanam hoti  abhijjhālussa bhikkhave an abhijjhā parikkamanam hoti
translated: For one who engages in idle chatter, the way to avoid it is to refrain from idle chatter.🔽For one who is covetous, the way to avoid it is to be uncovetous.

original: Byāpannacittassa, bhikkhave, abyāpādo parikkamanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: byāpanna cittassa bhikkhave a byāpādaḥ parikkamanam hoti
translated: For one who has ill will, the way to avoid it is to be without ill will.

original: Micchādiṭṭhissa, bhikkhave, sammādiṭṭhi parikkamanaṁ hoti.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhissa bhikkhave sammādiṭṭhi parikkamanam hoti
translated: For one who has wrong view, the way to avoid it is to have right view.

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, saparikkamano ayaṁ dhammo, nāyaṁ dhammo aparikkamano”ti.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave sa parikkamanaḥ ayam dhammo na ayam dhammo aparikkamanaḥ ti
translated: This is how this Dhamma is to be gone by, not how it is not to be gone by.”

original: Navamaṁ.
analyzed: navama
translated: The ninth.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 10.176
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Tens

original: 17. Jāṇussoṇivagga
analyzed: jāṇussoṇi vagga
